text2: Ba huuphe masqqaliyaa tookkidi , tana kaallenna urai ta erissiyo ashkkara gidanau danddayenna .

text: For which of you , intending to build a tower , sitteth not down first , and counteth the cost , whether he have sufficient to finish it ?
text2: “ Intteppe issi urai shuchcha keettaa keexxanau koyikko , keettaa polanau woqqu miishshaa koshshiyaakko , koiroora uttidi qoodennai oonee ?

text: Lest haply , after he hath laid the foundation , and is not able to finish it , all that behold it begin to mock him ,
text2: Yaanana xayikko , keettaa doommidi , i polanau danddayennan aggin , hegaa be7ida asai ubbai , ' Ha bitanee keexxanau doommidi , polana danddayibeenna ' yaagidi , a bolli miichchaa doommees .

text: Or what king , going to make war against another king , sitteth not down first , and consulteth whether he be able with ten thousand to meet him that cometh against him with twenty thousand ?
text2: “ Woi tammu sha7u asai de7iyo kawoi laatamu sha7u asai de7iyo kawuwaara olettanau danddayiyaakkonne , koiroora uttidi qoppennee ? Qoppana xayikko , hegee yaatin aiba kawoo ?

text: Or else , while the other is yet a great way off , he sendeth an ambassage , and desireth conditions of peace .
text2: Baassi danddayettana xayikko , hinkko kawoi haahuwan de7ishin sigettanau woossees .

text: So likewise , whosoever he be of you that forsaketh not all that he hath , he cannot be my disciple .
text2: Hegaadan baassi de7iya ubbabaa aggi bayenna urai tana kaalliyaagaa gidanau danddayenna .

text: Salt is good : but if the salt have lost his savour , wherewith shall it be seasoned ?
text2: “ Maxinee lo77o ; shin laqilaqana xayikko , naa77antto a waatidi laqilaqissanee ?

text: It is neither fit for the land , nor yet for the dunghill ; but men cast it out . He that hath ears to hear , let him hear .
text2: Biittaunne lo77enna ; araddissiyaabaanne gidenna . Asai a oli bayees . Siyanau haittai de7iyoogee hegaa siyo ” yaagiis .

text: Then drew near unto him all the publicans and sinners for to hear him .
text2: Issi gallassi , giiraa shiishshiyaageetinne nagaranchchati Yesuusabaa siyanau daroti akko shiiqidosona .

text: And the Pharisees and scribes murmured , saying , This man receiveth sinners , and eateth with them .
text2: Parisaawetinne higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti , “ Hagee nagaranchchatuura dabbotees ; etaara mees ” yaagidi , Yesuusa bolli zuuzummidosona .

text: And he spake this parable unto them , saying ,
text2: Zuuzummin Yesuusi etassi ha leemisuwaa odiiddi ,

text: What man of you , having an hundred sheep , if he lose one of them , doth not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness , and go after that which is lost , until he find it ?
text2: “ Intteppe issi uraassi xeetu dorssi de7iyoogee etappe issinna geelladan bayiyaabaa gidikko , uddufun tammanne uddufunaa buuran yeggi bayidi , issinno demmana gakkanaashin koyanau beennee ?

text: And when he hath found it , he layeth it on his shoulders , rejoicing .
text2: He bayida dorssiyo demmido wode ufaittidi , ba hashiyan tookkees .

text: And when he cometh home , he calleth together his friends and neighbours , saying unto them , Rejoice with me ; for I have found my sheep which was lost .
text2: Tookkidi soo ehiidi , ba laggetanne ba shoorota issippe xeesees ; xeesidi , ' Taani ta bayida dorssiyo demmido gishshau , tanaara ufaittite ' yaagidi , etassi odees .

text: I say unto you , that likewise joy shall be in heaven over one sinner that repenteth , more than over ninety and nine just persons , which need no repentance .
text2: Taani intteyyo odiyoogee aibee giikko , hegaadan nagaraappe simmana koshshenna uddufun tammanne uddufun xillotun ufaittanaappe ba nagaraappe simmiya issi nagaranchchan saluwan de7iyaageeti ufaittana .

text: Either what woman having ten pieces of silver , if she lose one piece , doth not light a candle , and sweep the house , and seek diligently till she find it ?
text2: “ Woikko tammu bootta shilinggee de7iyoora geelladan , issi shilinggee bayikko , xomppiyaa xomppada , ba keettaa pittada demmana gakkanaashin , minttada koyennaara oonee ?

text: And when she hath found it , she calleth her friends and her neighbours together , saying , Rejoice with me ; for I have found the piece which I had lost .
text2: Demmido wode , a ba laggetanne ba shoorota issippe xeesada , ' Taani ta bayida shilinggiyaa demmido gishshau , tanaara ufaittite ' yaagana .

text: Likewise , I say unto you , there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner that repenteth .
text2: Taani inttessi odais ; hegaadan Xoossaa kiitanchchati nagaraappe simmiya issi nagaranchchan ufaittana ” yaagiis .

text: And he said , A certain man had two sons :
text2: Qassikka Yesuusi hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Issi bitaniyaassi naa77u naati de7oosona .

text: And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the portion of goods that falleth to me . And he divided unto them his living .
text2: Etappe kaaloi ba aawaa , ' Ta aawau , neessi de7iyaabaappe tana gakkiyaagaa shaakkada hamma ' yaagin , aawai baassi de7iyaabaa ba naa77u naatussi shaakkiis .

text: And not many days after the younger son gathered all together , and took his journey into a far country , and there wasted his substance with riotous living .
text2: “ Guutta gallassaappe guyyiyan , kaalo na7ai ba miishshaa ubbaa shiishshi ekkidi , haaho dere biis . Hegan miishshaa ohettaa mooridi , ba miishshaa laaliis .

text: And when he had spent all , there arose a mighty famine in that land ; and he began to be in want .
text2: Ayyo de7iyaabai ubbai wuriichchidoogaappe guyyiyan , he biittan wolqqaama koshai gelin , i tuggatiis .

text: And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country ; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine .
text2: He dere asaappe issuwaakko biidi , ' Tana neessi ashkkara oottarkkii ? ' yaagin , bitanee ba gudunttaa wudiyaa heemmanau dembbaa a yeddiis .

text: And he would fain have filled his belly with the husks that the swine did eat : and no man gave unto him .
text2: Gudunttaa wudee miyo harqquwaa maanaukka amottiis ; shin ayyo ainne immidai baawa .

text: And when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father ' s have bread enough and to spare , and I perish with hunger !
text2: “ Ba mooruwaa hassayidi , ' Qumai xoonidi sa7an attiyo ta aawaa oosanchchati aappuna shin , tana hagan namisai worii ?

text: I will arise and go to my father , and will say unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and before thee ,
text2: Denddada ta aawaakko baada , “ Ta aawau , taani Xoossaakka nenakka naaqqaas .

text: And am no more worthy to be called thy son : make me as one of thy hired servants .
text2: Hagaappe sinttan ne na7a geetettanaukka bessikke ; tana ne ashkkaratuppe issuwaadan wottarkkii ” gaana '

text: And he arose , and came to his father . But when he was yet a great way off , his father saw him , and had compassion , and ran , and fell on his neck , and kissed him .
text2: yaagidi denddidi , ba aawaakko yiis . “ I biron haahuwan de7ishin , a aawai a be7idi , ayyo mishettiis ; woxxi qoommidi , a yeriis .

text: And the son said unto him , Father , I have sinned against heaven , and in thy sight , and am no more worthy to be called thy son .
text2: “ Na7ai , ' Ta aawau , taani Xoossaakka nenakka naaqqaas ; hagaappe sinttan ne na7a geetettanaukka bessikke ' yaagiis .

text: But the father said to his servants , Bring forth the best robe , and put it on him ; and put a ring on his hand , and shoes on his feet :
text2: “ SHin a aawai ba ashkkarata hagaadan yaagiis ; ' Ubbaappe lo77iya maayuwaa eesuwan ehiidi , a maizzite ; a kushiyan migiduwaa a gediyankka caammaa wottite .

text: And bring hither the fatted calf , and kill it ; and let us eat , and be merry :
text2: Modhdho mirgguwaa ehiidi shukkite ; moos , ufaittoos .

text: For this my son was dead , and is alive again ; he was lost , and is found . And they began to be merry .
text2: Aissi giikko , hagee ta na7ai haiqqiis ; shin paxiis ; qassi bayiis ; shin beettiis ' yaagin , ufaissaa doommidosona .

text: Now his elder son was in the field : and as he came and drew nigh to the house , he heard musick and dancing .
text2: “ Baira na7ai gaden de7iyaagee yiidi , soo matiyo wode , karaabiyaanne yettaa siyiis .

text: And he called one of the servants , and asked what these things meant .
text2: Ashkkaratuppe issuwaa xeesidi , ' Hegee aibee ? ' yaagidi oichchiis .

text: And he said unto him , Thy brother is come ; and thy father hath killed the fatted calf , because he hath received him safe and sound .
text2: Oichchin ashkkarai , ' Ne ishai saro yiido gishshau , ne aawai modhdho mirgguwaa ayyo shukissiis ' yaagiis .

text: And he was angry , and would not go in : therefore came his father out , and intreated him .
text2: “ Baira na7ai hanqqettidi , soo gelennan ixxin , a aawai kare kiyidi , a woossiis .

text: And he answering said to his father , Lo , these many years do I serve thee , neither transgressed I at any time thy commandment : and yet thou never gavest me a kid , that I might make merry with my friends :
text2: SHin i ba aawaa hagaadan yaagiis ; ' Hagaa keena laittaa neessi daro oottaas ; neeni giidobaa polennan mulekka aggabeikke ; ta laggetuura ufaittana mala , taassi harai atto issi deeshsha marakka imma erakka .

text: But as soon as this thy son was come , which hath devoured thy living with harlots , thou hast killed for him the fatted calf .
text2: SHin hagee ne na7ai , ne miishshaa shaaramuxa maccaasan wurssidaagee yin , ayyo modhdho mirgguwaa shukkadasa ' yaagiis .

text: And he said unto him , Son , thou art ever with me , and all that I have is thine .
text2: “ Yaagin aawai a , ' Ta na7au , neeni ubba wode tanaara de7aasa ; tabai ubbaikka neessa .

text: It was meet that we should make merry , and be glad : for this thy brother was dead , and is alive again ; and was lost , and is found .
text2: SHin hagee ne ishai , haiqqidaagee paxido gishshaunne bayidaagee beettido gishshau , nuuni miiddi uyiiddi ufaittana koshshees ' yaagiis ” giidi Yesuusi yootiis .

text: And he said also unto his disciples , There was a certain rich man , which had a steward ; and the same was accused unto him that he had wasted his goods .
text2: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkaratussi yootiiddi , “ Issi dure bitanee de7ees ; baappe garssaara i sunttido bitanee de7iyaagee a miishshaa mooriis giyo zigirssai a gakkiis .

text: And he called him , and said unto him , How is it that I hear this of thee ? give an account of thy stewardship ; for thou mayest be no longer steward .
text2: Ba sunttido bitaniyaa xeesidi , ' Ha nena asai giyoogee aibee ? Hagaappe sinttan neeni taappe garssaara suntta gidanau danddayenna gishshau , ne kushiyan de7iya ta miishsha ubbaa hamma ' yaagiis .

text: Then the steward said within himself , What shall I do ? for my lord taketh away from me the stewardship : I cannot dig ; to beg I am ashamed .
text2: “ Yaagin bitanee , ' Ta godai tana oosuwaappe kessana hanees . SHin hai waanoo ? Taassi hem77anau wolqqi baawa ; woossanau taassi pokkees .

text: I am resolved what to do , that , when I am put out of the stewardship , they may receive me into their houses .
text2: Ta oottanabaa ta erais ; i tana ta oosuwaappe kessiyo wode , bantta soo bin , tana mokkiya laggeta taani demmana ' yaagiis .

text: So he called every one of his lord ' s debtors unto him , and said unto the first , How much owest thou unto my lord ?
text2: “ Ba godaappe miishshaa tal77ida asata huuphiyan huuphiyan xeesidi , koiro bitaniyaa , ' Neeni ta godaappe ai tal77adii ? ' yaagiis .

text: And he said , An hundred measures of oil . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and sit down quickly , and write fifty .
text2: “ ' Taani xeetu baattaa kumida zaitiyaa tal77aas ' yaagiis . “ Yaagin , ' Ne paramaa hei ; uttada eesuwan ishatama gaada xaafa ' yaagiis .

text: Then said he to another , And how much owest thou ? And he said , An hundred measures of wheat . And he said unto him , Take thy bill , and write fourscore .
text2: “ Guyyeppe hankkuwaa ' Ne acoi aappunee ? ' yaagiis . “ ' Xeetu qun77a gistte ' yaagiis . ” Yaagin , ' Ne paramaa hei ; hosppun tamma gaada xaafa ' yaagiis .

text: And the lord commended the unjust steward , because he had done wisely : for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light .
text2: “ He sunttai cinccatettan oottido gishshau , a godai a galatiis ; aissi giikko , ha sa7aa asai babau poo7uwaa asaappe aadhdhida cincca .

text: And I say unto you , Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness ; that , when ye fail , they may receive you into everlasting habitations .
text2: “ Taani intteyyo odais ; worddo miishshai wuriyo wode , merinau wurenna keettan inttena eti mokkana mala , he miishshan intte huuphessi lagge demmite .

text: He that is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much : and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much .
text2: Daro guuttaban ammanettiya urai qassi gitaban ammanettees . Daro guuttaban ammanettenna urai gitabankka ammanettenna .

text: If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon , who will commit to your trust the true riches ?
text2: Yaatin intte ha sa7aa miishshan ammanettennabaa gidikko , tumu miishshaa inttessi asi waatidi hadara yaagidi immanee ?

text: And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man ' s , who shall give you that which is your own ?
text2: Intte hara asa miishshaa bashshiyaabaa gidikko , intteegaa oonee intteyyo immanai ?

text: No servant can serve two masters : for either he will hate the one , and love the other ; or else he will hold to the one , and despise the other . Ye cannot serve God and mammon .
text2: “ Naa77u godatuyyo haarettanau danddayiya ashkkari baawa ; aissi giikko , woi issuwaa ixxidi , hinkkuwaa siiqana ; woi issuwaa bonchchidi , hinkkuwaa karana ; Xoossaassinne miishshaassi haarettanau danddayekketa ” yaagiis .

text: And the Pharisees also , who were covetous , heard all these things : and they derided him .
text2: Miishsha dosiya Parisaaweti hegaa ubbaa siyidi , Yesuusa bolli qilliiccidosona .

text: And he said unto them , Ye are they which justify yourselves before men ; but God knoweth your hearts : for that which is highly esteemed among men is abomination in the sight of God .
text2: SHin Yesuusi eta , “ Intte asaa sinttan intte huuphiyaa xillissiyaageeta ; shin intte wozanaa Xoossai erees ; aissi giikko , asa sinttan bonchchettiyaagee Xoossaa sinttan tuna gidees .

text: The law and the prophets were until John : since that time the kingdom of God is preached , and every man presseth into it .
text2: “ Muuse higgeenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafai Yohaannisa wodiyaa gakkanaashin de7idosona ; he wodiyaappe doommin , Xoossaa kawotettai odettiis ; ubbai yaa gelanau warettees .

text: And it is easier for heaven and earth to pass , than one tittle of the law to fail .
text2: SHin higgiyaappe issi qaaliyaa moorettanaappe saloinne sa7ai aadhdhiyoogee matattees .

text: Whosoever putteth away his wife , and marrieth another , committeth adultery : and whosoever marrieth her that is put away from her husband committeth adultery .
text2: “ Ba machchiyo yeddidi , haranno ekkiya ooninne shaaramuxees ; qassi azinai yeddido maccaasiyo ekkiya ooninne shaaramuxees .

text: There was a certain rich man , which was clothed in purple and fine linen , and fared sumptuously every day :
text2: “ Daro al77o maayuwaa maayiya issi dure bitanee de7ees . Ayyo sa7ai lo77in , ubba gallassi ufaittidi de7ees .

text: And there was a certain beggar named Lazarus , which was laid at his gate , full of sores ,
text2: Al77aazara giyo masunxxida issi hiyyeesai , dure bitanee miyo masoofiyaappe sa7an wodhdhiya suuppa qumaa maanau amottidi , duriyaa penggen zin77ees . Harai atto kanatikka yiidi , a masunttaa laaccoosona .

text: And it came to pass , that the beggar died , and was carried by the angels into Abraham ' s bosom : the rich man also died , and was buried ;
text2: “ Hiyyeesa bitanee haiqqin , kiitanchchati a tookkidi , Abrahaama baggi aattidosona . Qassi dure bitanee haiqqidi moogettiis .

text: And in hell he lift up his eyes , being in torments , and seeth Abraham afar off , and Lazarus in his bosom .
text2: Si7ooliyan daro seelettiiddi , haahuwan de7iya Abrahaama xoqqu giidi xeelliis . Qassi Al77aazarakka Abrahaama matan de7iyaagaa be7iis .

text: And he cried and said , Father Abraham , have mercy on me , and send Lazarus , that he may dip the tip of his finger in water , and cool my tongue ; for I am tormented in this flame .
text2: “ Ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , ' Ta aawau Abrahaamaa , tana maara . Taani ha tamaa lacuwan paxa kaa7ettiyo gishshau , ba kushiyaa biradhdhiyaa xeeraa haattan yeddidi , yiidi ta inxxarssaa irxxissanau Al77aazara taakko yeddarkkii ' yaagiis .

text: But Abraham said , Son , remember that thou in thy lifetime receivedst thy good things , and likewise Lazarus evil things : but now he is comforted , and thou art tormented .
text2: “ SHin Abrahaami yaagiis ; ' Ta na7au , neeni ne de7uwaa wodiyan lo77obaa ekkin , Al77aazari iitabaa ekkidoogaa hassaya ; shin ha77i i hagan ufaittiyo wode , neeni paxa kaa7ettaasa .

text: And beside all this , between us and you there is a great gulf fixed : so that they which would pass from hence to you cannot ; neither can they pass to us , that would come from thence .
text2: Hegaa bolli qassi hagaa baggaara de7iyaageetussi intte baggi pinnanau danddayettenna mala , qassi yaara de7iyaageetikka haa pinnanau danddayenna mala , nu giddooninne intte giddon gita aafoi merettiis ' yaagiis .

text: Then he said , I pray thee therefore , father , that thou wouldest send him to my father ' s house :
text2: “ Yaagin dure bitanee , ' Ta aawau , yaatikko , neeni Al77aazara ta aawaa soo yeddana mala , nena woossais .

text: For I have five brethren ; that he may testify unto them , lest they also come into this place of torment .
text2: Aissi giikko , taassi ichchashu ishantti de7oosona . Eti qassi ha meto sohuwaa yeenna mala , etau Al77aazari biidi markkatto ' yaagiis .

text: Abraham saith unto him , They have Moses and the prophets ; let them hear them .
text2: “ SHin Abrahaami , ' Muuseenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafai etau de7ees ; he maxaafai giyoogaa eti siyona ' yaagiis .

text: And he said , Nay , father Abraham : but if one went unto them from the dead , they will repent .
text2: “ Dure bitanee , ' CHii , ta aawau Abrahaamaa , hegaa gidenna ; shin issi urai haiquwaappe denddidi , etakko biikko , eti bantta nagaraappe simmana ' yaagiis .

text: And he said unto him , If they hear not Moses and the prophets , neither will they be persuaded , though one rose from the dead .
text2: “ Abrahaami , ' Eti Muuseenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido maxaafaappe siyana xayikko , harai atto haiquwaappe issi urai denddikkokka ammanokkona ' giis ” yaagiis .

text: Then said he unto the disciples , It is impossible but that offences will come : but woe unto him , through whom they come !
text2: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkarata hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Asa balettiyaabai yeennan attenna ; shin he balettiyaabaa ehiya uraassi aayye7ana .

text: It were better for him that a millstone were hanged about his neck , and he cast into the sea , than that he should offend one of these little ones .
text2: Ha guutta naatuppe issuwaa balettiyoogaappe gaacciyo woxaa ba qooriyan qachchidi , abban mitettiyoogee au keha .

text: Take heed to yourselves : If thy brother trespass against thee , rebuke him ; and if he repent , forgive him .
text2: Intte huuphiyaassi naagettite . “ Ne ishai nena naaqqikko , a zora . Qassi nagaraappe i simmikko , ayyo atto ga .

text: And if he trespass against thee seven times in a day , and seven times in a day turn again to thee , saying , I repent ; thou shalt forgive him .
text2: I issi gallassi nena laappuntto naaqqidi , he gallassi laappuntto , ' Taani nagaraappe simmaas ' yaagiiddi neekko yiikkokka , ayyo atto ga ” yaagiis .

text: And the apostles said unto the Lord , Increase our faith .
text2: Godai kiittidoogeeti , “ Nuussi ammanuwaa gujja ” yaagidi Godaa oichchidosona .

text: And the Lord said , If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed , ye might say unto this sycamine tree , Be thou plucked up by the root , and be thou planted in the sea ; and it should obey you .
text2: Yaagin Godai zaaridi , “ Inttessi sanaafici giyo qii mittee aifiyo gakkiya ammanoi de7idaakko , intte ha ettaa , ' Ettau , neeni shodettada abban toketta ' yaagana ; ha ettaikka qassi inttessi azazettana .

text: But which of you , having a servant plowing or feeding cattle , will say unto him by and by , when he is come from the field , Go and sit down to meat ?
text2: “ Intte giddon goyiya woi miizza heemmiya ashkkari de7iyo asi geella de7ikko , ba ashkkarai oottidi simmidaagaa , ' Qumaa maanau shiiqa utta ' gii ?

text: And will not rather say unto him , Make ready wherewith I may sup , and gird thyself , and serve me , till I have eaten and drunken ; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink ?
text2: Gaana xayikko , ' Taani maana kahuwaa giigissa ; ne afalaa laammada , taani miishiininne uyishin , taassi kiitetta . Guyyeppe neessi ma , uya ' yaagennee ?

text: Doth he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded him ? I trow not .
text2: I ba azazuwaa polido gishshau , ba ashkkaraa galatii ?

text: So likewise ye , when ye shall have done all those things which are commanded you , say , We are unprofitable servants : we have done that which was our duty to do .
text2: Hegaadan inttekka azazettido ubbabaa oottido wode , ' Nuuni pattenna aille ; nu ooso xalaalaa oottida ' yaagite ” yaagiis .

text: And it came to pass , as he went to Jerusalem , that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee .
text2: Yesuusi Yerusalaame biiddi , Galiilappenne Samaariyaappe gidduwaara aadhdhiis .

text: And as he entered into a certain village , there met him ten men that were lepers , which stood afar off :
text2: I issi qeeri katamiyo geliyo wode , inchchirichchai oiqqido tammu asati haahuwan eqqidaageeta be7iis .

text: And they lifted up their voices , and said , Jesus , Master , have mercy on us .
text2: Eti bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , “ Godaa Yesuusaa , hai nuna maararkkii ! ” yaagidosona .

text: And when he saw them , he said unto them , Go shew yourselves unto the priests . And it came to pass , that , as they went , they were cleansed .
text2: Yaagin Yesuusi eta be7idi , “ Biidi , intte bollaa qeeseta bessite ” yaagiis . Yaagin biiddi , ogiyan inchchirichchaappe paxidosona .

text: And one of them , when he saw that he was healed , turned back , and with a loud voice glorified God ,
text2: Etappe issoi bau paxidoogaa be7idi , ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , Xoossaa galatiiddi simmiis .

text: And fell down on his face at his feet , giving him thanks : and he was a Samaritan .
text2: Qassi Yesuusa galatiiddi , a tohuwan kunddiis . Bitanee Samaariyaa asa .

text: And Jesus answering said , Were there not ten cleansed ? but where are the nine ?
text2: Yesuusi zaaridi , “ Inchchirichchaappe paxidaageeti tamma gidokkonaa ? Yaatin uddufunati awan de7iyoonaa ?

text: There are not found that returned to give glory to God , save this stranger .
text2: Ha hara dere bitaniyaappe harai Xoossaa galatanau simmidai baawee ? ” yaagiis .

text: And he said unto him , Arise , go thy way : thy faith hath made thee whole .
text2: Yesuusi a , “ Denddada ba ; nena ne ammanoi pattiis ” yaagiis .

text: And when he was demanded of the Pharisees , when the kingdom of God should come , he answered them and said , The kingdom of God cometh not with observation :
text2: Parisaaweti , “ Xoossaa kawotettai aude yaanee ? ” yaagidi Yesuusa oichchidosona . Oichchin Yesuusi , “ Xoossaa kawotettai beettiya malaataara yeenna .

text: Neither shall they say , Lo here ! or , lo there ! for , behold , the kingdom of God is within you .
text2: Qassi Xoossaa kawotettai intte giddon de7iyo gishshau , ooninne a hageeho , hagan de7ees ; woi hegan de7ees geenna ” yaagiis .

text: And he said unto the disciples , The days will come , when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man , and ye shall not see it .
text2: Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkaratussi odiiddi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Asa Na7ai beettana gallassatuppe issuwaa intte amottana ; shin be7ekketa .

text: And they shall say to you , See here ; or , see there : go not after them , nor follow them .
text2: Qassi eti inttena , ' Hagan xeellite ' woi ' Hegan xeellite ' yaagana . SHin eta kaallidi , etaara booppite .

text: For as the lightning , that lighteneth out of the one part under heaven , shineth unto the other part under heaven ; so shall also the Son of man be in his day .
text2: Wolqqanttai wolqqammidi , saluwan ha gaxaappe ya gaxaa gakkidi poo7issiyoogaadan , Asa Na7ai ba gallassi hegaadan hanana .

text: But first must he suffer many things , and be rejected of this generation .
text2: SHin koiroora i daro waayiyaa ekkanaunne ha wodiyaa asan ixettanau bessees .

text: And as it was in the days of Noe , so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man .
text2: “ Ta yuussai , Asa Na7aa yuussai , Nohe wodiyan hanidoogaadan , hegaadankka hanana .

text: They did eat , they drank , they married wives , they were given in marriage , until the day that Noe entered into the ark , and the flood came , and destroyed them all .
text2: Nohee markkabiyan gelido gallassai gakkanaashin , asai meesinne uyees , qassi attumaasai machcheesinne maccaasai azinaa gelees ; bashshiya haattai yiidi , asa ubbaa woriis .

text: Likewise also as it was in the days of Lot ; they did eat , they drank , they bought , they sold , they planted , they builded ;
text2: “ Qassi Looxe wode hanidoogaadankka hegaadan hanana ; eti moosona , uyoosona , shammoosona , baizzoosona , kattaa zeroosona , keettaakka keexxoosona .

text: But the same day that Lot went out of Sodom it rained fire and brimstone from heaven , and destroyed them all .
text2: SHin Looxee Sadoomappe kiyido gallassi , Xoossai saluwaappe tamaanne eexxiya shuchchaa bukissidi , ubba asaa wurssiis .

text: Even thus shall it be in the day when the Son of man is revealed .
text2: “ Asa Na7ai qoncciyan beettiyo gallassi hegaadan hanana .

text: In that day , he which shall be upon the housetop , and his stuff in the house , let him not come down to take it away : and he that is in the field , let him likewise not return back .
text2: He gallassi keettaa huuphiyan de7iyaagee ba son de7iya miishshaa ekkanau wodhdhoppo ; hegaadan goshshan de7iyaageekka guyye simmoppo .

text: Remember Lot ' s wife .
text2: Ane Looxe machcheebaa qoppite !

text: Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it ; and whosoever shall lose his life shall preserve it .
text2: Ba shemppuwaa ashshana koyiya ubbai bashshana ; shin ba shemppuwaa bashshiya ubbai ashshana .

text: I tell you , in that night there shall be two men in one bed ; the one shall be taken , and the other shall be left .
text2: Taani intteyyo odiyoogee aibee giikko , he gallassa qammi naa77u asati issi hiixan zin77ana ; etappe issuwaa efin , issoi attana .

text: Two women shall be grinding together ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Naa77u maccaasati issi sohuwan gaacciyaageetuppe issinniyo efin , issinniyaa attana .

text: Two men shall be in the field ; the one shall be taken , and the other left .
text2: Naa77u asati gaden oottiyaageetuppe issuwaa efaana ; issoi attana ” yaagiis .

text: And they answered and said unto him , Where , Lord ? And he said unto them , Wheresoever the body is , thither will the eagles be gathered together .
text2: Erissiyo ashkkarati qassi a , “ Godau , hegee awan hananee ? ” yaagidosona . Yaagin Yesuusi , “ Gauxai de7iyoosaa ankkoi shiiqana ” yaagidi , etassi odiis .

text: And he spake a parable unto them to this end , that men ought always to pray , and not to faint ;
text2: Erissiyo ashkkarati ubba gallassi salettennan woossana mala , Yesuusi etassi leemisuwaa odiiddi ,

text: Saying , There was in a city a judge , which feared not God , neither regarded man :
text2: “ Issi kataman Xoossaassi yayyenna qassi asassikka yeellatenna issi daannai de7ees .

text: And there was a widow in that city ; and she came unto him , saying , Avenge me of mine adversary .
text2: He kataman issi am77e maccaasiyaa de7iyaara he daannaakko ya yaada , ' Taaninne ta baarigaarai mootettiyo yohuwaa taassi pirdda ' yaagausu .

text: And he would not for a while : but afterward he said within himself , Though I fear not God , nor regard man ;
text2: “ Daannai daro wodiyaasappe iyyo pirddennan ixxiis ; shin ba wozanan qoppiiddi , ' Taani Xoossaassi yayyennan woi asassi yeellatennan ixxikkonne ,

text: Yet because this widow troubleth me , I will avenge her , lest by her continual coming she weary me .
text2: ha am77e maccaasiyaa tana waissiyo gishshau , qassi ubba wode ya yaada tana daafurssenna mala , iyyo pirddana ' giis ” yaagiis .

text: And the Lord said , Hear what the unjust judge saith .
text2: Qassikka Godai , “ He makkala daannai giidoogaa siyite .

text: And shall not God avenge his own elect , which cry day and night unto him , though he bear long with them ?
text2: Yaatin bana maaddana mala , gallassinne qammi baakko waassiya doorettida asaassi Xoossai pirddennee ? I etassi eesuwan zaarennee ?

text: I tell you that he will avenge them speedily . Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh , shall he find faith on the earth ?
text2: Taani inttessi odiyoogee aibee giikko , i eesuwan etassi pirddana ; shin Asa Na7ai yiyo wode , ha sa7an ammano demmanee ? ” yaagiis .

text: And he spake this parable unto certain which trusted in themselves that they were righteous , and despised others :
text2: Banttana xillo giidi , hara asa ubbaa kariyaageetussi Yesuusi issi leemisuwaa odiiddi , hagaadan yaagiis ;

text: Two men went up into the temple to pray ; the one a Pharisee , and the other a publican .
text2: “ Naa77u asati Xoossaa woossanau Beeta Maqidasiyaa kiyidosona ; etappe issoi Parisaawe , issoi giiraa shiishshiyaagaa .

text: The Pharisee stood and prayed thus with himself , God , I thank thee , that I am not as other men are , extortioners , unjust , adulterers , or even as this publican .
text2: Parisaawee eqqidi , ba wozana giddon woossiiddi , ' Xoossau , taani hara asa ubbaadan , worddanchcha , uuzenne shaaramuxa woi ha giiraa shiishshiyaagaa mala gidenna gishshau , nena galatais .

text: I fast twice in the week , I give tithes of all that I possess .
text2: Saaminttan saaminttan naa77utoo xoomais ; taani demmiyo miishsha ubbaappe asirataa immais ' yaagiis .

text: And the publican , standing afar off , would not lift up so much as his eyes unto heaven , but smote upon his breast , saying , God be merciful to me a sinner .
text2: “ SHin giiraa shiishshiyaagee haahuwan eqqidi , harai atto saluwaa xeellanaukka dosibeenna . SHin , ' Xoossau , taani nagaranchcha ; tana maara ' yaagidi , ba tiraa bubbuxiis .

text: I tell you , this man went down to his house justified rather than the other : for every one that exalteth himself shall be abased ; and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted .
text2: “ Taani inttessi odiyoogee aibee giikko , hagee Parisaawiyaappe xillidi , ba soo biis . Aissi giikko , bana xoqqu oottiya urai kauyyana ; shin bana kaushshiya urai xoqqu gaana ” yaagiis .

text: And they brought unto him also infants , that he would touch them : but when his disciples saw it , they rebuked them .
text2: Yesuusi guutta naata bochchana mala , issi issi asai naata akko ehiis ; shin erissiyo ashkkarati hegaa be7idi , he asaa hanqqettidosona .

text: But Jesus called them unto him , and said , Suffer little children to come unto me , and forbid them not : for of such is the kingdom of God .
text2: Yesuusi guutta naata baakko xeesidi , “ Guutta naati taakko yiyoogaa diggoppite ; aissi giikko , Xoossaa kawotettai hageetu malaassa .

text: Verily I say unto you , Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein .
text2: Taani intteyyo tumaa gais ; Xoossaa kawotettaa guutta na7adan ekkenna urai ooninne he kawotettaa mulekka gelenna ” yaagiis .

text: And a certain ruler asked him , saying , Good Master , what shall I do to inherit eternal life ?
text2: Yihudaa biittaa haariyaageetuppe issoi , “ Lo77o tamaarissiyaagoo , taani merinaa de7uwaa laattanau ai oottoo ? ” yaagidi Yesuusa oichchiis .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Why callest thou me good ? none is good , save one , that is , God .
text2: Yesuusi zaaridi , “ Tana aissi lo77o gai ? Xoossaa xalaalaappe attin , hara lo77oi ooninne baawa ;

text: Thou knowest the commandments , Do not commit adultery , Do not kill , Do not steal , Do not bear false witness , Honour thy father and thy mother .
text2: Xoossaa azazuwaa , ' SHaaramuxoppa ; woroppa ; wuuqqoppa ; wordduwaa markkattoppa ; ne aawaanne ne aayyiyo bonchcha ' yaagiyaagaa eraasa ” yaagiis .

text: And he said , All these have I kept from my youth up .
text2: Bitanee , “ Taani hegaa ubbaa naatettaasappe doommada ha77i gakkanaassikka naagais ” yaagiis .

text: Now when Jesus heard these things , he said unto him , Yet lackest thou one thing : sell all that thou hast , and distribute unto the poor , and thou shalt have treasure in heaven : and come , follow me .
text2: Yesuusi hegaa siyidi bitaniyaa , “ Ha77ikka neeyyo issibai paccees ; neeyyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa baizzada he miishshaa hiyyeesau gisha ; neeni saluwan duretana ; yaatada yaada tana kaalla ” yaagiis .

text: And when he heard this , he was very sorrowful : for he was very rich .
text2: SHin bitanee hegaa siyido wode , i daro dure gidiyo gishshau qarettiis .

text: And when Jesus saw that he was very sorrowful , he said , How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God !
text2: Bitanee daro qarettidoogaa Yesuusi be7idi , “ Dure asi Xoossaa kawotettaa gelanaagee waani metanddeeshsha !

text: For it is easier for a camel to go through a needle ' s eye , than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God .
text2: Dure asi Xoossaa kawotettaa gelanaagaappe gaameelai marppiyaa xoo7iyaara aadhdhanaagee matattees ” yaagiis .

text: And they that heard it said , Who then can be saved ?
text2: Hegaa siyidaageeti , “ Yaatin attanau danddayiyai oonee ? ” yaagidosona .

text: And he said , The things which are impossible with men are possible with God .
text2: SHin Yesuusi zaaridi , “ Asau danddayettennabai Xoossau danddayettees ” yaagiis .

text: Then Peter said , Lo , we have left all , and followed thee .
text2: PHeexiroosi Yesuusa , “ Be7a ; nuuni nuussi de7iya ubbabaa aggi bayidi , nena kaallida ” yaagiis .

text: And he said unto them , Verily I say unto you , There is no man that hath left house , or parents , or brethren , or wife , or children , for the kingdom of God ' s sake ,
text2: Yesuusi , “ Taani inttessi tumaa gais ; Xoossaa kawotettaa gishshau giiddi , keettaa woi aawaanne aayyiyo , woi ishantta , woi machchiyo , woi naata aggida asi ooninne ha77i baassi de7iyaagaappe daruwaa ekkana ; qassi sinttappe yaana wodiyankka merinaa de7uwaa ekkana ” yaagiis .

text: Then he took unto him the twelve , and said unto them , Behold , we go up to Jerusalem , and all things that are written by the prophets concerning the Son of man shall be accomplished .
text2: Yesuusi tammanne naa77u erissiyo ashkkarata banaara efiiddi eta , “ Nuuni ha77i Yerusalaame kiyeettees ; hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido tabai , Asa Na7aabai , ubbai polettana .

text: For he shall be delivered unto the Gentiles , and shall be mocked , and spitefully entreated , and spitted on :
text2: Aissi giikko , eti tana Aihuda gidenna asaassi aattidi immana ; ta bolli qilliiccana ; cuchchana ; qassi tana waissana ;

text: And they shall scourge him , and put him to death : and the third day he shall rise again .
text2: eti tana lissuwan garafananne worana ; shin taani heezzantto gallassi haiquwaappe denddana ” yaagiis .

text: And they understood none of these things : and this saying was hid from them , neither knew they the things which were spoken .
text2: SHin erissiyo ashkkaratussi i yootidobaappe aibinne gelibeenna ; i yootidobai etappe geemmin , eranau danddayibookkona .

text: And it came to pass , that as he was come nigh unto Jericho , a certain blind man sat by the way side begging :
text2: Yesuusi Yarkko gakkana matidaashin , issi qooqe bitanee woossiiddi , ogiyaa doonan uttiis .

text: And hearing the multitude pass by , he asked what it meant .
text2: Uttidaagee daro asai aadhdhiyoogaa siyidi , “ Hegee aibee ? ” yaagidi oichchiis .

text: And they told him , that Jesus of Nazareth passeth by .
text2: Asai , “ Naazireeta Yesuusi aadhdhees ” yaagidi ayyo yootiis .

text: And he cried , saying , Jesus , thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Yootin ba qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , “ Daawita na7au , Yesuusaa , tana maararkkii ! ” yaagiis .

text: And they which went before rebuked him , that he should hold his peace : but he cried so much the more , Thou Son of David , have mercy on me .
text2: Sinttan de7iyaageeti a , “ Haizza ! ” giidi hanqqettidosona ; shin i ba qaalaa kaseegaappekka keehi xoqqu oottidi , “ Daawita na7au , tana maararkkii ! ” yaagiis .

text: And Jesus stood , and commanded him to be brought unto him : and when he was come near , he asked him ,
text2: Yesuusi eqqidi , he qooqe bitaniyaa baakko ehaana mala azaziis . Qooqee akko yiidi gakkana matishin , “ Taani neeyyo ai oottanau koyai ? ” yaagidi a oichchiis . Oichchin qooqee , “ Ta Godau , taani xeellanaagaa koyais ” yaagiis .

text: And Jesus said unto him , Receive thy sight : thy faith hath saved thee .
text2: Yaagin Yesuusi a , “ Xeella ; nena ne ammanoi pattiis ” yaagiis .

text: And immediately he received his sight , and followed him , glorifying God : and all the people , when they saw it , gave praise unto God .
text2: Sohuwaarakka a aifee xeelli aggin , Xoossaa galatiiddi , Yesuusa kaalli bayiis . Asa ubbai hegaa be7idi , Xoossaa galatiis .

text: And Jesus entered and passed through Jericho .
text2: Yesuusi Yarkko giyo katamaara aadhdhees .

text: And , behold , there was a man named Zacchaeus , which was the chief among the publicans , and he was rich .
text2: Hegan Zakkiyoosa giyo giiraa shiishshiyaageetu alaafee de7ees ; i dure asa .

text: And he sought to see Jesus who he was ; and could not for the press , because he was little of stature .
text2: Zakkiyoosi Yesuusi oonakko be7anau koyiis ; shin i qantta gidido gishshaunne asai daro gidido gishshau , be7anau danddayibeenna .

text: And he ran before , and climbed up into a sycomore tree to see him : for he was to pass that way .
text2: Yesuusi hegaara aadhdhiyo gishshau , asaappe sinttau woxxidi , Yesuusa be7anau issi ettaa xeeraa kiyiis .

text: And when Jesus came to the place , he looked up , and saw him , and said unto him , Zacchaeus , make haste , and come down ; for to day I must abide at thy house .
text2: Yesuusi he sohuwaa gakkiiddi , pude xeellidi , “ Zakkiyoosaa , taani hachchi ne son pe7anau bessiyo gishshau , eesuwan wodhdha ” yaagiis .

text: And he made haste , and came down , and received him joyfully .
text2: Zakkiyoosi eesuwan ettaappe wodhdhidi , ufaissan Yesuusa mokkiis .

text: And when they saw it , they all murmured , saying , That he was gone to be guest with a man that is a sinner .
text2: Hegaa be7ida asai ubbai , “ Hagee nagaranchchaa son imatettanau geliis ” yaagidi zuuzummiis .

text: And Zacchaeus stood , and said unto the Lord ; Behold , Lord , the half of my goods I give to the poor ; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation , I restore him fourfold .
text2: SHin Zakkiyoosi eqqidi Godaa , “ Ta Godau , taani taassi de7iya ubbabaappe baggaa hiyyeesau immana ; qassi ooppenne wordduwan ekkidobaa gidikko , i bashshido mehiyaassi oiddu kushiyaa ayyo zaarana ” yaagiis .

text: And Jesus said unto him , This day is salvation come to this house , forsomuch as he also is a son of Abraham .
text2: Yesuusi Zakkiyoosassi yootiiddi , “ Neenikka Abrahaama zeretta gidiyo gishshau , atotettai hachchi ha keettaa yiis .

text: For the Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost .
text2: Aissi giikko , taani , Asa Na7ai , bayidaagaa koyanaunne ashshanau yaas ” yaagiis .

text: And as they heard these things , he added and spake a parable , because he was nigh to Jerusalem , and because they thought that the kingdom of God should immediately appear .
text2: Asai hegaa siyiyo wode , Yesuusi Yerusalaame matido gishshaunne etassi Xoossaa kawotettai beettana matidobaa milatido gishshau , etassi leemisuwaa yootiis .

text: He said therefore , A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom , and to return .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Issi gita asi baassi kawotettaa ekkidi yaanau , haaho dere biis .

text: And he called his ten servants , and delivered them ten pounds , and said unto them , Occupy till I come .
text2: Ba ashkkaratuppe tammata xeesidi , ' Taani yaanaashin , hagan zal77ite ' yaagidi , tammu paunddiyaa etassi immiis .

text: But his citizens hated him , and sent a message after him , saying , We will not have this man to reign over us .
text2: “ SHin a biittaa asai a ixxidi , ' Hagee nu bolli kawotanau koyokko ' yaagiiddi , asaa a geeduwaa kiittiis .

text: And it came to pass , that when he was returned , having received the kingdom , then he commanded these servants to be called unto him , to whom he had given the money , that he might know how much every man had gained by trading .
text2: “ He gita asi kawotettaa ekkidi simmiis . Simmidi ba miishshaa immido ashkkarati zal77idi , huuphiyan huuphiyan woqqaa worissidaakko eranau , eta baakko xeegissiis .

text: Then came the first , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained ten pounds .
text2: “ Xeegettida ashkkaratuppe koiroogee yiidi , ' Ta godau , ne miishshai tammu paundde wodhdhiis ' yaagiis .

text: And he said unto him , Well , thou good servant : because thou hast been faithful in a very little , have thou authority over ten cities .
text2: “ A godai a , ' Hayyanaashsho ! Neeni lo77o ashkkara ; neeni ha qii guuttaban ammanettidaagaa gidido gishshau , taani nena tammu katamatuyyo alaafe oottana ' yaagiis .

text: And the second came , saying , Lord , thy pound hath gained five pounds .
text2: “ Naa77anttoi yiidi , ' Ta godau , ne miishshai ichchashu paundde wodhdhiis ' yaagiis .

text: And he said likewise to him , Be thou also over five cities .
text2: “ A godai a , ' Neenikka ichchashu katamatuyyo alaafe gida ' yaagiis .

text: And another came , saying , Lord , behold , here is thy pound , which I have kept laid up in a napkin :
text2: “ Heezzanttoi yiidi , ' Taani curqqan xaaxada naaga wottido ne paunddiyo hanno be7a .

text: For I feared thee , because thou art an austere man : thou takest up that thou layedst not down , and reapest that thou didst not sow .
text2: Aissi giikko , neeni meqetti bainna asa gidiyo gishshau , neessi yayyaas . Neeni nebaa gidennabaa ekkaasa ; zerabeennabaakka cakkaasa ' yaagiis .

text: And he saith unto him , Out of thine own mouth will I judge thee , thou wicked servant . Thou knewest that I was an austere man , taking up that I laid not down , and reaping that I did not sow :
text2: “ Yaagin , ' Neeni iita ashkkara ; ne doonai haasayidoban nena taani pirddana . Taani tabaa gidennabaa ekkiyaagaa , qassi zerabeennabaa cakkiya meqetti bainna asa gidiyoogaa eradasa .

text: Wherefore then gavest not thou my money into the bank , that at my coming I might have required mine own with usury ?
text2: Yaatin ta miishshaa aissi dichchau immabeikkii ? Taani simmiyo wode ta miishshaa woriyaara ekkanaagaa shin attiis ' yaagiis .

text: And he said unto them that stood by , Take from him the pound , and give it to him that hath ten pounds .
text2: “ He sohuwan eqqida asata , ' He paunddiyaa appe wotti ekkidi , tammu paunddee de7iyoogaayyo immite ' yaagiis .

text: ( And they said unto him , Lord , he hath ten pounds . )
text2: “ Yaagin , ' Godau , ayyo tammu paunddee de7ees ' yaagidosona .

text: For I say unto you , That unto every one which hath shall be given ; and from him that hath not , even that he hath shall be taken away from him .
text2: “ ' Taani intteyyo odais ; de7iyo ubbau harai gujettana ; shin bainnaagaappe harai atto , he de7iyaageekka appe ekettiichchana .

text: But those mine enemies , which would not that I should reign over them , bring hither , and slay them before me .
text2: SHin ha bantta bolli taani kawotana mala dosibeenna ta morkketa haa ehiidi , ta sinttan goora7ite ' giis ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he went before , ascending up to Jerusalem .
text2: Yesuusi hagaadan yaagidi haasayidoogaappe guyyiyan , etappe sinttatidi , Yerusalaame biis .

text: And it came to pass , when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany , at the mount called the mount of Olives , he sent two of his disciples ,
text2: Yesuusi Dabira Zaite giyo deriyaa lanqqiyan de7iya Beetafaaganne Biitaaniyaa giyo katamata matido wode , erissiyo ashkkaratuppe naa77aa kiittidi ,

text: Saying , Go ye into the village over against you ; in the which at your entering ye shall find a colt tied , whereon yet never man sat : loose him , and bring him hither .
text2: “ Intteppe sinttan de7iya qeeri katamaa biite ; biidi yaa gelosaara biron ooninne mulekka toggibeenna qashuwan de7iya hare maraa intte demmana ; a birshshidi , haa ekki yiite .

text: And if any man ask you , Why do ye loose him ? thus shall ye say unto him , Because the Lord hath need of him .
text2: Ooninne inttena , ' Hegaa aissi birshsheetii ? ' yaagidi oichchikko , ' Godai hagaa koyees ' yaagite ” yaagiis .

text: And they that were sent went their way , and found even as he had said unto them .
text2: Kiitettidaageeti biidi , Yesuusi banttassi odidoogaadan demmidosona .

text: And as they were loosing the colt , the owners thereof said unto them , Why loose ye the colt ?
text2: Eti hare maraa birshshishin , a godati , “ Hare maraa aissi birshsheetii ? ” yaagidosona .

text: And they said , The Lord hath need of him .
text2: Yaagin eti , “ Godai hagaa koyees ” yaagidi ,

text: And they brought him to Jesus : and they cast their garments upon the colt , and they set Jesus thereon .
text2: hare maraa Yesuusakko ehiidi , bantta maayuwaa a zokkuwan hiixxidi , Yesuusa togissidosona .

text: And as he went , they spread their clothes in the way .
text2: Yesuusi toggidi biishin , bantta maayuwaa i biyo ogiyan hiixxidosona .

text: And when he was come nigh , even now at the descent of the mount of Olives , the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen ;
text2: I Dabira Zaite Deriyaa dugettaa wodhdhana matishin , a kaalliya ubbai Xoossai oottido malaata ubbaa be7ido gishshau ufaittidi , Xoossaa galatanau bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi ,

text: Saying , Blessed be the King that cometh in the name of the Lord : peace in heaven , and glory in the highest .
text2: “ Godaa sunttan yiya kawoi anjjettidaagaa ; saluwan sarotettai gido . Qassi salo ubbaappe bolla saluwan de7iya Xoossai bonchchetto ” yaagidosona .

text: And some of the Pharisees from among the multitude said unto him , Master , rebuke thy disciples .
text2: Asaa giddoppe issi issi Parisaaweti Yesuusa , “ Tamaarissiyaagoo , ne erissiyo ashkkarata haizzite giikkii ? ” yaagiis .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I tell you that , if these should hold their peace , the stones would immediately cry out .
text2: Yesuusi zaaridi , “ Taani intteyyo odais ; hageeti co77u giikko , shuchchaikka waassana ” yaagiis .

text: And when he was come near , he beheld the city , and wept over it ,
text2: Katamaa gakkanau i matidi , katamaa be7ido wode qarettidi yeekkiiddi ,

text: Saying , If thou hadst known , even thou , at least in this thy day , the things which belong unto thy peace ! but now they are hid from thine eyes .
text2: hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Sarotettai yiyo ogiyaa hachchi nenakkonne erarkkiishsha ! SHin ha77i hegee ne aifiyaappe geemmiis .

text: For the days shall come upon thee , that thine enemies shall cast a trench about thee , and compass thee round , and keep thee in on every side ,
text2: Aissi giikko , ne bolli yaana wodee de7ees ; he wode ne morkketi urqqaa nukkidi , godaa essana . He godan nena yuushshi aattidi diridi , ubba baggaara neeyyo ogiyaa gorddana .

text: And shall lay thee even with the ground , and thy children within thee ; and they shall not leave in thee one stone upon another ; because thou knewest not the time of thy visitation .
text2: Nenanne ne dirssaa giddon de7iya ne asaa mentterettana . Xoossai nena be7anau yiido wodiyaa neeni akeekabeenna gishshau , ne morkketi shuchcha ubbaa issuwaa issuwaa bollaappe denttidi laalana ” yaagiis .

text: And he went into the temple , and began to cast out them that sold therein , and them that bought ;
text2: Yesuusi Beeta Maqidasiyaa gelidi , hegan zal77iyaageeta , “ Xoossaa maxaafan , ' Ta keettai Xoossaa woossiyo keetta gidana ' geetettidi xaafetti uttiis ; shin intte a panggati qosettiyo gonggolo kessideta ” yaagidi eta yedetaa doommiis .

text: And he taught daily in the temple . But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him ,
text2: Yesuusi ubba gallassi Beeta Maqidasiyan tamaarissees . Qeese halaqati , higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetinne gita asai a xaissanau koyoosona .

text: And could not find what they might do : for all the people were very attentive to hear him .
text2: SHin asai ubbai a haasayaappe issoi attennan ezggi uttido gishshau , a woriyo ogee etau xayiis .

text: And it came to pass , that on one of those days , as he taught the people in the temple , and preached the gospel , the chief priests and the scribes came upon him with the elders ,
text2: Issi gallassi Yesuusi asaa tamaarissiiddinne wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiiddi Beeta Maqidasiyan de7ishin , qeese halaqatinne higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti cimatuura issippe akko yiidi a ,

text: And spake unto him , saying , Tell us , by what authority doest thou these things ? or who is he that gave thee this authority ?
text2: “ Neeni hagaa oottanau neeyyo ai alaafetetti de7ii ? Woi neeyyo ha alaafetettaa immidai oonee ? Ane nuussi oda ” yaagidosona .

text: And he answered and said unto them , I will also ask you one thing ; and answer me :
text2: Yesuusi zaaridi , “ Taani qassi inttena issibaa oichchais ; taassi odite ;

text: The baptism of John , was it from heaven , or of men ?
text2: Yohaannisi xammaqiyo alaafetettaa ekkidoi Xoossaappeeyye woi asappee ? ” yaagiis .

text: And they reasoned with themselves , saying , If we shall say , From heaven ; he will say , Why then believed ye him not ?
text2: Eti bantta giddon palamaa doommidi , “ Nuuni woiganee ? ' Xoossaappe yiis ' yaagikko , i nuna , ' Yaatin Yohaannisi yootidoogaa aissi ammanibeekketii ? ' yaagana .

text: But and if we say , Of men ; all the people will stone us : for they be persuaded that John was a prophet .
text2: SHin nuuni , ' Asappe yiis ' yaagikko , ha asai ubbai Yohaannisi hananabaa yootiyaagaa gididoogaa eri uttido gishshau , nuna shuchchan caddana ” yaagidosona .

text: And they answered , that they could not tell whence it was .
text2: Hegaa gishshau eti , “ He alaafetettaa i awappe ekkidaakkonne nuuni erokko ” yaagidosona .

text: And Jesus said unto them , Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things .
text2: Yesuusi , “ Taanikka hagaa ai alaafetettan oottiyaakko , intteyyo odikke ” yaagiis .

text: Then began he to speak to the people this parable ; A certain man planted a vineyard , and let it forth to husbandmen , and went into a far country for a long time .
text2: Yaagidi asaassi ha leemisuwaa yootiis ; “ Asa issoi woiniyaa turaanne tokkido sohuwaa kottau immidi , haaho dere biidi , daro gam77iis .

text: And at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen , that they should give him of the fruit of the vineyard : but the husbandmen beat him , and sent him away empty .
text2: Woiniyaa aifiyaa maxiyo wodee gakkin , woiniyaa aifiyaappe bana gakkiyaagaa ekkidi yaana mala , issi ashkkaraa ba kottaawatukko kiittiis ; shin kottaawati a ashkkaraa wadhdhidi , kushe mela yedettidosona .

text: And again he sent another servant : and they beat him also , and entreated him shamefully , and sent him away empty .
text2: Qassi hara ashkkaraa etakko kiittiis . Eti akka wadhdhidi kaushshidi , kushe mela yeddidosona .

text: And again he sent a third : and they wounded him also , and cast him out .
text2: Qassi heezzantto ashkkaraa kiittiis . Kiittidoogaa masunxxissidi , woiniyaa turaa giddoppe gaxi kessi olidosona .

text: Then said the lord of the vineyard , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son : it may be they will reverence him when they see him .
text2: “ Woiniyaa turaa godai , ' Yaatin taani waatoo ? Taani siiqiyo ta na7aa kiittana ; eti a bonchchanaakkonne ooni erii ' yaagidi qoppiis .

text: But when the husbandmen saw him , they reasoned among themselves , saying , This is the heir : come , let us kill him , that the inheritance may be ours .
text2: “ SHin kottaawati a be7idi , bantta giddon haasayiiddi , ' Hagaa laattanaagee a ; gadiyaa nuuni laattanau a woroos ' yaagidosona .

text: So they cast him out of the vineyard , and killed him . What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them ?
text2: Na7aa woiniyaa turaa giddoppe gaxaa kessidi woridosona . “ Simmi woiniyaa turaa godai eta waatanee ?

text: He shall come and destroy these husbandmen , and shall give the vineyard to others . And when they heard it , they said , God forbid .
text2: Yiidi , he kottaa oottiyaageeta wori wurssidi , woiniyaa turaa kottaa oottiya hara asau immana ” yaagiis . Asai hegaa siyidi , “ Hegee hanoppo ” yaagiis .

text: And he beheld them , and said , What is this then that is written , The stone which the builders rejected , the same is become the head of the corner ?
text2: Yesuusi etakko xeellidi , “ Yaatin , ' Gimbbiyaageeti karidi ixxido shuchchai godaa xaphuwaa minttiya , ubbaappe aadhdhiya shuchcha gidiis ' geetettidi maxaafan xaafettidaagee hegee aibee ?

text: Whosoever shall fall upon that stone shall be broken ; but on whomsoever it shall fall , it will grind him to powder .
text2: He shuchchaa bolli kunddiya ubbai meqerettana ; shin he shuchchai asa bolli kunddikko , he kunddido uraa gaaccana ” yaagiis .

text: And the chief priests and the scribes the same hour sought to lay hands on him ; and they feared the people : for they perceived that he had spoken this parable against them .
text2: Higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetinne qeese halaqati Yesuusi ha leemisuwaa bantta bolli odidoogaa erido gishshau , he wode a oiqqanau koyidosona ; shin asaassi yayyidosona .

text: And they watched him , and sent forth spies , which should feign themselves just men , that they might take hold of his words , that so they might deliver him unto the power and authority of the governor .
text2: Hegaassi injjetiya wodiyaa naagidi , Yesuusa haasayissiiddi , a doonaappe balabaa demmidi , a oiqqinne deriyaa haariyaagaa wolqqaassinne a alaafetettaassi aattidi immana mala , xillo milatiiddi xillo gidenna kafota akko yeddidosona .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly , neither acceptest thou the person of any , but teachest the way of God truly :
text2: He kafoti Yesuusa , “ Tamaarissiyaagoo , neeni haasayiyoogeenne tamaarissiyoogee likke gidiyoogaa nuuni eroos ; neeni Xoossaa ogiyaa tumatettan tamaarissiyoogaappe attin , asa shaakkennaagaa eroos .

text: Is it lawful for us to give tribute unto Caesar , or no ?
text2: Nuuni Roome biittaa Kawuwaa Qeesaarayyo giiraa giiriyoogee wogeeyye woga gidennee ? ” yaagidi oichchidosona .

text: But he perceived their craftiness , and said unto them , Why tempt ye me ?
text2: SHin Yesuusi eti cimmiyo cimuwaa eridi , “ Tana aissi paacceetii ?

text: Shew me a penny . Whose image and superscription hath it ? They answered and said , Caesar ' s .
text2: Issi santtimiyaa tana bessite ; ha santtimiyaa bolli de7iya merainne sunttai oogee ? ” yaagidi eta oichchiis . Oichchin , eti zaaridi , “ Roome biittaa Kawuwaa Qeesaaraagaa ” yaagidosona .

text: And he said unto them , Render therefore unto Caesar the things which be Caesar ' s , and unto God the things which be God ' s .
text2: Yesuusi eta , “ Yaatikko Qeesaaraagaa Qeesaarassi , Xoossaagaa Xoossaassi immite ” yaagiis .

text: And they could not take hold of his words before the people : and they marvelled at his answer , and held their peace .
text2: Asaa sinttan a haasayan a oiqqiyoobaa demmanau danddayibookkona ; hegaa gishshau , i zaarido zaaruwan garamettidi , co77u giidosona .

text: Then came to him certain of the Sadducees , which deny that there is any resurrection ; and they asked him ,
text2: Haiqqida asi denddenna giya Saaduqaawetuppe issi issi asati Yesuusakko yiidi ,

text: Saying , Master , Moses wrote unto us , If any man ' s brother die , having a wife , and he die without children , that his brother should take his wife , and raise up seed unto his brother .
text2: hagaadan yaagidi , a oichchidosona ; “ Tamaarissiyaagoo , Muusee nuuyyo higgiyaa xaafiiddi , ' Machcho ekkida asi na7a yelennan haiqqikko , he haiqqidaagaa ishai a machchiyo aissidi , ba ishaayyo na7a yelanau bessees ' yaagiyaagaa xaafiis .

text: There were therefore seven brethren : and the first took a wife , and died without children .
text2: Issi wode laappun ishantti de7iyaageetuppe bairai machchiyo ekkidi , na7a yelennan haiqqiis .

text: And the second took her to wife , and he died childless .
text2: Haiqqin naa77anttoi o aissiis ;

text: And the third took her ; and in like manner the seven also : and they left no children , and died .
text2: qassi heezzanttoikka o aissiis ; hegaadan laappunatikka na7a yelennan haiqqidosona .

text: Last of all the woman died also .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , qassi he maccaasiyaa haiqqaasu .

text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them is she ? for seven had her to wife .
text2: Yaatin haiqqida asai haiquwaappe denddiyo gallassi , a etappe augaayyo machcho gidanee ? Aissi giikko , laappunatikka o ekkidosona ” yaagidosona .

text: And Jesus answering said unto them , The children of this world marry , and are given in marriage :
text2: Yesuusi zaaridi , etassi hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Ha wodiyaa asai machchiyo ekkees ; maccaageeti azinaa geloosona .

text: But they which shall be accounted worthy to obtain that world , and the resurrection from the dead , neither marry , nor are given in marriage :
text2: SHin haiquwaappe denddidi , sinttappe yiya wodiyan de7anau bessiya attumaasainne maccaasai ekkennanne gelenna .

text: Neither can they die any more : for they are equal unto the angels ; and are the children of God , being the children of the resurrection .
text2: Aissi giikko , eti kiitanchchatu mala gidiyo gishshau , naa77anttuwaa haiqqanau danddayokkona . Qassi eti haiquwaappe denddido gishshau , Xoossaa naata .

text: Now that the dead are raised , even Moses shewed at the bush , when he calleth the Lord the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
text2: SHin haiqqida asai denddanabaa Muusee geeshshidi erissiis . Xaragettiya buuraabaa odiya sohuwankka Godaabaa i yootiiddi , ' Abrahaama Xoossaa , Yisaaqa Xoossaa , Yaaqooba Xoossaa ' yaagiis .

text: For he is not a God of the dead , but of the living : for all live unto him .
text2: Ubbai ayyo merinau de7iyaageeta gidido gishshau , Xoossai merinau de7iyaageetu Xoossaa gidiyoogaappe attin , haiqqidaageetu Xoossaa gidenna ” yaagiis .

text: Then certain of the scribes answering said , Master , thou hast well said .
text2: Higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetuppe issoi issoi Yesuusa , “ Tamaarissiyaagoo , neeni giidoogee lo77o ” yaagiis .

text: And after that they durst not ask him any question at all .
text2: Aissi giikko , naa77anttuwaa issibaakka a oichchanau xalibookkona .

text: And he said unto them , How say they that Christ is David ' s son ?
text2: Yesuusi qassi eta yaagiis ; “ Eti woigidi Kiristtoosa Daawita na7a giyoonaa ?

text: And David himself saith in the book of Psalms , The LORD said unto my Lord , Sit thou on my right hand ,
text2: Aissi giikko , Daawiti Mazamure Maxaafan , ' Godai ta Godaa ; “ Taani ne morkketa neeni yedhdha eqqiyoobaa oottana gakkanaassi , hagan taappe ushachcha baggaara utta ” giis ' yaagiis .

text: David therefore calleth him Lord , how is he then his son ?
text2: “ Daawiti Kiristtoosa , ' Godaa ' giidi xeesikko , yaatin Kiristtoosi waanidi , Daawita na7a gidii ? ” yaagiis .

text: Then in the audience of all the people he said unto his disciples ,
text2: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkarata asai ubbai siyishin ,

text: Beware of the scribes , which desire to walk in long robes , and love greetings in the markets , and the highest seats in the synagogues , and the chief rooms at feasts ;
text2: “ Higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageetuppe naagettite ; eti adussa maayuwaa maayidi yuuyiyoogaanne giyaa sohuwankka asai eta bonchchidi sarotiyoogaanne dosoosona ; Aihuda woosa keettan daro lo77iya oidiyaa dosoosona ; asi banttana imattiyoosankka bonchcho sohuwaa dosoosona . Eti am77etu keettaa bonqqidi , banttau lo77o milatanau Xoossaa woosaa adussoosona ; eti ubbaappe aadhdhiya pirddaa ekkana ” yaagiis .

text: And he looked up , and saw the rich men casting their gifts into the treasury .
text2: Yesuusi ubbasaa xeelliiddi , dure asai ba miishshaa Beeta Maqidasiyan muxuwaataa yeggiyo saaxiniyan yeggiyoogaa be7iis .

text: And he saw also a certain poor widow casting in thither two mites .
text2: Issi daro hiyyeesa am77iyaa naa77u bakkannaa hegan yeggiyoogaa be7idi ,

text: And he said , Of a truth I say unto you , that this poor widow hath cast in more than they all :
text2: “ Taani intteyyo tumaa gais ; ha hiyyeesa am77iyaa ubbaappe darissada yeggaasu .

text: For all these have of their abundance cast in unto the offerings of God : but she of her penury hath cast in all the living that she had .
text2: Aissi giikko , hageeti ubbai bantta palahida miishshaappe yeggidosona ; shin a ba pacaappe bau de7iya aquwaa muleera imma aggaasu ” yaagiis .

text: And as some spake of the temple , how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts , he said ,
text2: Etappe issoi issoi Beeta Maqidasee lo77o shuchchaaninne Xoossaassi imettidaban lo77idaagaa haasayishin Yesuusi ,

text: As for these things which ye behold , the days will come , in the which there shall not be left one stone upon another , that shall not be thrown down .
text2: “ Ha intte be7iyo ubbai issi shuchchi attennan , ubbai qolettana wodee yaana ” yaagiis .

text: And they asked him , saying , Master , but when shall these things be ? and what sign will there be when these things shall come to pass ?
text2: Yesuusi erissiyo ashkkarati , “ Tamaarissiyaagoo , yaatin , hegee aude hananee ? Hegee hanana wodiyaa erissiya malaatai aiba gidanee ? ” yaagidi a oichchidosona .

text: And he said , Take heed that ye be not deceived : for many shall come in my name , saying , I am Christ ; and the time draweth near : go ye not therefore after them .
text2: Yesuusi , “ Baloppite ; naagettite ; aissi giikko , daro asati ta sunttan , ' Taani Kiristtoosa ; wodee matattiis ' yaagiiddi , yaana . Eta kaallidi booppite .

text: But when ye shall hear of wars and commotions , be not terrified : for these things must first come to pass ; but the end is not by and by .
text2: Olanne ooshsha siyiyo wode dagammoppite ; aissi giikko , hegaa mala yohoi koiroora hanana bessees ; shin hegee wurssettai gakkana matiis giyoogaa gidenna ” yaagiis .

text: Then said he unto them , Nation shall rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom :
text2: He wode Yesuusi haasayiiddi , “ Deree deriyaa bolli , kawotettai kawotettaa bolli denddana .

text: And great earthquakes shall be in divers places , and famines , and pestilences ; and fearful sights and great signs shall there be from heaven .
text2: Biittai wolqqappe qaaxxiyoogee , daro sohuwan koshai , wurssiya harggee yaana . Yashissiyaabainne gita malaatai saluwaappe yaana .

text: But before all these , they shall lay their hands on you , and persecute you , delivering you up to the synagogues , and into prisons , being brought before kings and rulers for my name ' s sake .
text2: “ SHin ha ubbai hananaappe kase , eti inttena oiqqananne waissana ; ta sunttaa gishshau , inttena Aihuda woosa keettaa asatuyyo aattidi immananne ; qasho keettankka qashissana . Qassi inttena kawuwaa sinttinne deriyaa haariyaagaa sintti efaana .

text: And it shall turn to you for a testimony .
text2: Hegee inttessi ta gishshau , eta sinttan markkattanau lo77o wode gidana .

text: Settle it therefore in your hearts , not to meditate before what ye shall answer :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , issibaa intte wozanan oiqqite ; hegee aibee giikko , intte waatidi zaaruwaa immanaakko , koiroora hirggoppite giyoogaa .

text: For I will give you a mouth and wisdom , which all your adversaries shall not be able to gainsay nor resist .
text2: Aissi giikko , intte morkketuppe ooninne inttenaara eqettanaunne palamettanau danddayenna haasayaa minotettaanne aadhdhida eratettaa taani inttessi immana .

text: And ye shall be betrayed both by parents , and brethren , and kinsfolks , and friends ; and some of you shall they cause to be put to death .
text2: Harai atto inttena yelidaageetikka , ishantti , dabboti , laggetikka , inttena aattidi immana . Intteppekka issuwaa issuwaa eti worana .

text: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name ' s sake .
text2: Ta sunttaa gishshau , inttena ubbai ixxana ; shin

text: But there shall not an hair of your head perish .
text2: intte huuphiyaa binnaanaappe issoinne xayenna .

text: In your patience possess ye your souls .
text2: Danddayan intte intte shemppuwaa ashshana .

text: And when ye shall see Jerusalem compassed with armies , then know that the desolation thereof is nigh .
text2: “ SHin wotaaddaran Yerusalaamee diretti uttidaashin intte be7iyo wode , Yerusalaame xayoi matattidoogaa erana .

text: Then let them which are in Judaea flee to the mountains ; and let them which are in the midst of it depart out ; and let not them that are in the countries enter thereinto .
text2: He wode Yihudan de7iyaageeti deriyaakko baqatona ; katama giddon de7iyaageeti katamaappe kiyona ; gaxa biittan de7iyaageeti katamaa geloppona .

text: For these be the days of vengeance , that all things which are written may be fulfilled .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa maxaafatun xaafettidaagee ubbai polettanau , Xoossai halo kessiyo wodee hagaa .

text: But woe unto them that are with child , and to them that give suck , in those days ! for there shall be great distress in the land , and wrath upon this people .
text2: He wode shahaara maccaasatuyyoonne xanttiya maccaasatuyyo aayye7ana ; aissi giikko , sa7aa bollan gita metoi yaana . Ha asaa bollankka iita hanqqoi yaana .

text: And they shall fall by the edge of the sword , and shall be led away captive into all nations : and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of the Gentiles , until the times of the Gentiles be fulfilled .
text2: Eti qara bisuwan qanxxettidi haiqqana ; eti dere ubban omoodettana ; Aihuda gidenna asai bantta wode polettana gakkanaashin , Yerusalaame katamaa yedhdhana .

text: And there shall be signs in the sun , and in the moon , and in the stars ; and upon the earth distress of nations , with perplexity ; the sea and the waves roaring ;
text2: “ Awa aifiyaaninne aginan xoolinttiyan malaatai beettana ; sa7an de7iya issi issi dere asai abbainne beetai guummiyoogaa siyidi , hananabai etassi erettennan ixxin metootana .

text: Men ' s hearts failing them for fear , and for looking after those things which are coming on the earth : for the powers of heaven shall be shaken .
text2: Asai sa7aa bolli yaanabaa ubbaa naagiiddi , yashshan daafurana ; aissi giikko , saluwan de7iya wolqqati qaaxxana .

text: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory .
text2: He wode taani , Asa Na7ai , wolqqaaranne gita bonchchuwaara shaara giddoora yiishin , eti be7ana .

text: And when these things begin to come to pass , then look up , and lift up your heads ; for your redemption draweth nigh .
text2: Hegee hananau doommiyo wode , intte wozettiyo wodee matiyo gishshau , xoqqu giidi , pude xeellite ” yaagiis .

text: And he spake to them a parable ; Behold the fig tree , and all the trees ;
text2: Yesuusi etassi hagaadan yaagidi , leemisuwaa yootiis ; “ Balasiyo giyo mittiyoonne hara mitta ubbaa akeekite .

text: When they now shoot forth , ye see and know of your own selves that summer is now nigh at hand .
text2: Eta haittai aacaa doommiyoogaa intte be7iyo wode , bonee matattidoogaa intte ereeta .

text: So likewise ye , when ye see these things come to pass , know ye that the kingdom of God is nigh at hand .
text2: Hegaadankka intte hegee haniyoogaa be7iyo wode , Xoossaa kawotettai gakkana matattidoogaa erana .

text: Verily I say unto you , This generation shall not pass away , till all be fulfilled .
text2: “ Taani intteyyo tumaa odais ; ha ubbabai hanana gakkanaashin , ha wodiyaa asai haiqqiichchenna .

text: Heaven and earth shall pass away : but my words shall not pass away .
text2: Saloinne sa7ai aadhdhana ; shin ta qaalai mulekka aadhdhenna .

text: And take heed to yourselves , lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting , and drunkenness , and cares of this life , and so that day come upon you unawares .
text2: “ SHin muussan , ushshan , mattooninne aqossi hirggiyooban intte wozanai balenna mala , qassi intte qoppennan he gallassai intte bolli yeennaadan , inttena naagite .

text: For as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face of the whole earth .
text2: Aissi giikko , he gallassai sa7a ubban de7iya asa ubbaa piriyaadan oiqqana .

text: Watch ye therefore , and pray always , that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things that shall come to pass , and to stand before the Son of man .
text2: Simmi intte he yaanabaa ubbaappe attanaunne ta sinttan Asa Na7aa sinttan , eqqanau danddayana mala , ubba wode Xoossaa woosan minnite ” yaagiis .

text: And in the day time he was teaching in the temple ; and at night he went out , and abode in the mount that is called the mount of Olives .
text2: Yesuusi gallassi gallassi Beeta Maqidasiyan tamaarissees ; shin qammi qammi Dabira Zaite Deriyaa kiyidi aqees .

text: And all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple , for to hear him .
text2: Asa ubbai i tamaarissiyoogaa siyanau guuraara akko Beeta Maqidasiyaa yees .

text: Now the feast of unleavened bread drew nigh , which is called the Passover .
text2: Oittaa miyo Paasikaa Baalaa gallassaa bonchchiyo wodee gakkana matiis .

text: And the chief priests and scribes sought how they might kill him ; for they feared the people .
text2: Qeese halaqatinne higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti asaassi yayyiyo gishshau , Yesuusa woriyo ogiyaa koyoosona .

text: Then entered Satan into Judas surnamed Iscariot , being of the number of the twelve .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , Seexaanai tammanne naa77u erissiyo ashkkaratuppe issuwan , Asqqoroota giyo Yihudan gelin ,

text: And he went his way , and communed with the chief priests and captains , how he might betray him unto them .
text2: Yihudai biidi , qeese halaqatuuranne Beeta Maqidasiyaa wotaaddarata azaziyaageetuura , “ Yesuusa waata aattada immoo ” giidi haasayiis .

text: And they were glad , and covenanted to give him money .
text2: Haasayin eti ufaittidi , Yihudaa , “ Nuuni neessi miishsha immana ” yaagidi odidosona .

text: And he promised , and sought opportunity to betray him unto them in the absence of the multitude .
text2: I ero yaagidi , asi bainnasan etassi Yesuusa aattidi immanau injjetiya wodiyaa wochchees .

text: Then came the day of unleavened bread , when the passover must be killed .
text2: Oittaa miyo gallassaa bonchchiyo wodee gakkiis . He gallassan Paasikaassi anqqara dorssa shukkanau bessees .

text: And he sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare us the passover , that we may eat .
text2: Yesuusi PHeexiroosanne Yohaannisa , “ Nuuni Paasikaa Baalaa bonchchiyo gallassan maana qumaa biidi giigissite ” yaagidi kiittiis .

text: And they said unto him , Where wilt thou that we prepare ?
text2: Kiittin , “ Nuuni awan giigissanee ? ” yaagidi a oichchidosona .

text: And he said unto them , Behold , when ye are entered into the city , there shall a man meet you , bearing a pitcher of water ; follow him into the house where he entereth in .
text2: Yesuusi eta hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Siyite ; katamaa intte gelanau biishin , otuwan haattaa tookkida issi bitanee inttenaara gaittana . A kaallidi , i geliyo keettaa gelite .

text: And ye shall say unto the goodman of the house , The Master saith unto thee , Where is the guestchamber , where I shall eat the passover with my disciples ?
text2: Gelidi keettaawaa , ' Tamaarissiyaagee nena , “ Taani ta erissiyo ashkkaratuura Paasikaa Baalaa bonchchiyo gallassan qumaa maanau imatta kifilee awaanee ? ” yaagees ' yaagite .

text: And he shall shew you a large upper room furnished : there make ready .
text2: Keettaawai inttena pooqiyaa bollan de7iya makettida aaho kifiliyaa bessana . Hegan qumaa giigissite ” yaagiis .

text: And they went , and found as he had said unto them : and they made ready the passover .
text2: Eti biidi , Yesuusi banttau yootidoogaadan demmidi , yaani Paasikaa Baalaa bonchchiyo gallassi maana qumaa giigissidosona .

text: And when the hour was come , he sat down , and the twelve apostles with him .
text2: Qumaa miyo wodee gakkin , Yesuusi ba kiittido tammanne naa77atuura issippe maanau uttiis .

text: And he said unto them , With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer :
text2: Uttidi yaagiis ; “ Taani waayettanaappe kasetada , inttenaara ha Paasikaa Baalaa bonchchiyo gallassan miyo qumaa maanau daro amottaas .

text: For I say unto you , I will not any more eat thereof , until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
text2: Aissi giikko , taani inttessi odais ; hegee Xoossaa kawotettan polettana gakkanaashin , taani naa77anttuwaa hegaa miikke ” yaagiis .

text: And he took the cup , and gave thanks , and said , Take this , and divide it among yourselves :
text2: Yaagidi Yesuusi burccukkuwaa ekkidi , Xoossaa galatidi , “ Heite ; hagaa burccukkuwan de7iyaagaa shaakkidi uyite .

text: For I say unto you , I will not drink of the fruit of the vine , until the kingdom of God shall come .
text2: Aissi giikko , taani inttessi odais ; Xoossaa kawotettai yaana gakkanaashin , hachchippe doommada woiniyaa eessaa uyikke ” yaagiis .

text: And he took bread , and gave thanks , and brake it , and gave unto them , saying , This is my body which is given for you : this do in remembrance of me .
text2: Qassi oittaa ekkidi , Xoossaa galatiis ; he oittaa menttidi , etassi immidi , “ Hagee intteyyo imettida ta ashuwaa ; hagan tana hassayite ” yaagiis .

text: Likewise also the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament in my blood , which is shed for you .
text2: Kahuwaa mirggidoogaappe guyye baggan , kaseegaadan burccukkuwaa etassi immidi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Hagee inttessi gukkiya ta suuttan maacettida ooratta maachchaa .

text: But , behold , the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the table .
text2: “ SHin be7ite ; tana aattidi immana bitanee tanaara masoofiyan issippe mees .

text: And truly the Son of man goeth , as it was determined : but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed !
text2: Aissi giikko , taani Asa Na7ai , Xoossai ba qofaa qachchidoogaadan bais ; shin tana aattidi immana uraassi aayye7ana ” yaagiis .

text: And they began to inquire among themselves , which of them it was that should do this thing .
text2: Bantta giddoppe hegaadan oottanau ooni qoppidaakko , issoi issuwaa oichchidosona .

text: And there was also a strife among them , which of them should be accounted the greatest .
text2: Qassi bantta ubbaappe ooni gitakko bantta giddon palamettidosona .

text: And he said unto them , The kings of the Gentiles exercise lordship over them ; and they that exercise authority upon them are called benefactors .
text2: Palamettin Yesuusi eta yaagiis ; “ Ha sa7an de7iya kawoti bantta asaa godatoosona . Eta haariyaageeti kehiyaageeta geetettoosona .

text: But ye shall not be so : but he that is greatest among you , let him be as the younger ; and he that is chief , as he that doth serve .
text2: SHin intteppe gitatiyaagee intte ubbaappe guuxxiyaagaa mala gidanaappe attin , intte hegaadan hanoppite ; inttena haariyaagee inttessi ashkkaradan hano .

text: For whether is greater , he that sitteth at meat , or he that serveth ? is not he that sitteth at meat ? but I am among you as he that serveth .
text2: Qumaa maanau uttiyaagee giteeyye qumaa sinttau aattiyaagee gitee ? Qumaa maanau uttidaagee gita gidennee ? SHin taani intte giddon qumaa sinttau aattiya ashkkara mala .

text: Ye are they which have continued with me in my temptations .
text2: “ Qassi taani paacettiyo wode tana yeggibeennaageeta .

text: And I appoint unto you a kingdom , as my Father hath appointed unto me ;
text2: Ta kawotettan taani qumaa miyo sohuwan intte maana malanne , uyana mala , qassi tammanne naa77u Israa7eela zaretu bolli pirddiiddi , araatatun uttana mala , ta Aawai tana sunttidoogaadan , taani inttena sunttais ” yaagiis .

text: And the Lord said , Simon , Simon , behold , Satan hath desired to have you , that he may sift you as wheat :
text2: Godai , “ Simoonaa , Simoonaa , akeeka ; asai gisttiyaa harqqiyoogaadan , Seexaanai inttena harqqanau Xoossaa woossin , Xoossai ero giis .

text: But I have prayed for thee , that thy faith fail not : and when thou art converted , strengthen thy brethren .
text2: SHin taani ne ammanoi bayenna mala , neessi Xoossaa woossaas ; neeni taakko simmiyo wode , ne ishantta minttetta ” yaagiis .

text: And he said unto him , Lord , I am ready to go with thee , both into prison , and to death .
text2: Simooni , “ Godau , taani nenaara qasho keettaa baanau , qassi nenaara haiqqanaukka giigaas ” yaagiis .

text: And he said , I tell thee , Peter , the cock shall not crow this day , before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me .
text2: SHin Yesuusi , “ PHeexiroosaa , taani neeyyo odais ; hachchi qammi , kuttoi waassanaappe kase , neeni tana eriyoogaa heezzutoo kaddana ” yaagiis .

text: And he said unto them , When I sent you without purse , and scrip , and shoes , lacked ye any thing ? And they said , Nothing .
text2: Yesuusi ba erissiyo ashkkaratussi , “ Korjjoi woi qarcciiti woi caammi bainnan taani inttena kiittido wode , inttessi paccidabi de7ii ? ” yaagiis . Yaagin eti , “ Aibinne baawa ” yaagidosona .

text: Then said he unto them , But now , he that hath a purse , let him take it , and likewise his scrip : and he that hath no sword , let him sell his garment , and buy one .
text2: Yesuusi eta , “ SHin ha77i korjjoi woi qarcciiti de7iyoi ooninne ekki efo . Bisoi bainna urai ooninne ba maayuwaa baizzidikka issi biso shammo .

text: For I say unto you , that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me , And he was reckoned among the transgressors : for the things concerning me have an end .
text2: Aissi giikko , taani inttessi odais ; Xoossaa maxaafan xaafettida tabai polettiyo gishshau , ' Hagee mooranchchatuura paidettiis ' geetettidi xaafettidaagee tanan polettanau bessees ” yaagiis .

text: And they said , Lord , behold , here are two swords . And he said unto them , It is enough .
