text2: PHauloosinne Barnnaabaasi etaara daro ooyettidi palamettin , Anxxookiyan de7iya issi issi hara asati he palamaa gishshau , PHauloosaaranne Barnnaabaasaara Yerusalaame biidi , Yesuusi kiittidoogeetuuranne cimatuura gaittanau qofai qashettiis .

text: And being brought on their way by the church , they passed through Phenice and Samaria , declaring the conversion of the Gentiles : and they caused great joy unto all the brethren .
text2: Woosa keettai ogiyan eta maaddishin , Aihuda gidennaageeti Xoossaakko simmidoogaa yootiiddi , Pinqqeeranne Samaariyaara aadhdhidosona ; hegee ishantta ubbaa daro ufaissiis .

text: And when they were come to Jerusalem , they were received of the church , and of the apostles and elders , and they declared all things that God had done with them .
text2: Eti Yerusalaame gakkido wode , woosa keettai , Yesuusi kiittidoogeetinne cimati eta mokkidosona ; mokkin Xoossai banttanan oottidobaa ubbaa odidosona .

text: But there rose up certain of the sect of the Pharisees which believed , saying , That it was needful to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the law of Moses .
text2: SHin Parisaawetu baggappe ammanida issi issi asati denddi eqqidi , “ Intte eta qaxxaranaunne Muuse higgiyaa naagana mala azazanau bessees ” yaagidosona .

text: And the apostles and elders came together for to consider of this matter .
text2: Yesuusi kiittidoogeetinne cimati hegaa zorettanau shiiqidosona .

text: And when there had been much disputing , Peter rose up , and said unto them , Men and brethren , ye know how that a good while ago God made choice among us , that the Gentiles by my mouth should hear the word of the gospel , and believe .
text2: Keehi haasayidoogaappe guyyiyan , PHeexiroosi denddi eqqidi , eta hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Ta ishatoo , Aihuda gidennaageeti wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa qaalaa ta doonaappe siyidi ammanana mala , tana Xoossai intte giddoppe beni dooridoogaa intte ereeta .

text: And God , which knoweth the hearts , bare them witness , giving them the Holy Ghost , even as he did unto us ;
text2: Asa wozana eriya Xoossai Geeshsha Ayyaanaa nuussi immidoogaadan , etassikka immidi tumayiis .

text: And put no difference between us and them , purifying their hearts by faith .
text2: Eti ammanido gishshau , i eta wozanaa geeshshidi , nu gidduwaaninne eta gidduwan dummatettaa wottibeenna .

text: Now therefore why tempt ye God , to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples , which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
text2: Hegaa gishshau , nu aawatinne nuuni tookkanau danddayibeenna qambbaraa kaalliyaageetu morggiyan wottidi , ha77i intte aissi Xoossaa paacceetii ?

text: But we believe that through the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ we shall be saved , even as they .
text2: SHin Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa aaro kehatettan eti attidoogaadan , nuunikka attidoogaa ammanoos ” yaagiis .

text: Then all the multitude kept silence , and gave audience to Barnabas and Paul , declaring what miracles and wonders God had wrought among the Gentiles by them .
text2: Asai ubbai co77u giidi , Barnnaabaasinne PHauloosi Aihuda gidenna asaa giddon bantta baggaara Xoossai oottido malaataanne oorattabaa ubbaa yootishin siyees .

text: And after they had held their peace , James answered , saying , Men and brethren , hearken unto me :
text2: Eti haasayaa wurssidoogaappe guyyiyan , Yaaqoobi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis ; “ Ishatoo , taani giyoogaa siyite .

text: Simeon hath declared how God at the first did visit the Gentiles , to take out of them a people for his name .
text2: Xoossai Aihuda gidennaageetu giddoppe bau haniya asaa ekkanau Aihuda gidennaageetuyyo koiro waatidi qoppidaakko Simooni yootiis .

text: And to this agree the words of the prophets ; as it is written ,
text2: Hananabaa yootiyaageetu qaalai hagaara giigees ; Godai daro wodiyaappe doommidi , asaa hagaa erissidi , Xoossaa maxaafan hagaadan yaagiis ; ' Hagaappe guyyiyan , sa7an de7iya hara asai ubbainne tabaa gidanau taani xeesido Aihuda gidenna asai ubbai Godaa koyana mala , taani simmana . Taani kolettidi kunddida keettadan hanida Daawita kawotettaa denttana . Qolettidaagaakka zaarada keexxana ; taani naa77anttuwaa a essana ' yaagiis .

text: Wherefore my sentence is , that we trouble not them , which from among the Gentiles are turned to God :
text2: “ Hegaa gishshau , ta qofa gidikko , Aihuda gidennaageetuppe Xoossaakko simmiyaageeta nuuni waissanau koshshenna .

text: But that we write unto them , that they abstain from pollutions of idols , and from fornication , and from things strangled , and from blood .
text2: SHin eti eeqan tunidabaa meenna mala , shaaramuxenna mala , sulettida mehe asho meenna malanne suutta uyenna mala , etassi nuuni dabddaabbiyaa xaafanau koshshees .

text: For Moses of old time hath in every city them that preach him , being read in the synagogues every sabbath day .
text2: Aissi giikko , Muuse higgiyaa kase yeletaappe doommidi Sambbatan Sambbatan Aihuda woosa keettatun nabbabiiddi , a qaalaa katamaa ubban yootiyaageeti de7oosona ” yaagiis .

text: Then pleased it the apostles and elders , with the whole church , to send chosen men of their own company to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas ; namely , Judas surnamed Barsabas , and Silas , chief men among the brethren :
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , Yesuusi kiittidoogeetinne cimati woosa keettaa asa ubbaara issippe bantta giddoppe amarida asata dooridi , PHauloosaaranne Barnnaabaasaara Anxxookiyaa yeddanau qofaa qachchidosona ; eti daro bonchchettida naa77u asata Barssaaba geetettiya Yihudaanne Sillaasa dooridosona .

text: And they wrote letters by them after this manner ; The apostles and elders and brethren send greeting unto the brethren which are of the Gentiles in Antioch and Syria and Cilicia :
text2: Dooridi hagaadan giya dabddaabbiyaa xaafidi , eta bolli kiittidosona ; “ Nuuni Yesuusi kiittidoogeetinne cimati intte ishantti , Anxxookiyan , Sooriyaaninne Kilqqiyan de7iya Aihuda bagga gidenna ishanttussi nu sarotaa kiittoos .

text: Forasmuch as we have heard , that certain which went out from us have troubled you with words , subverting your souls , saying , Ye must be circumcised , and keep the law : to whom we gave no such commandment :
text2: “ Nuuni azazibeenna asati nu giddoppe biidi , ' Intte qaxxarettanaunne higgiyaa naaganau bessees ' giidi , inttena waissidoogaanne yiilloyidoogaa siyidi ,

text: It seemed good unto us , being assembled with one accord , to send chosen men unto you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul ,
text2: nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa sunttaa gishshau , bantta shemppuwaa olida nuuni siiqiyo Barnnaabaasaaranne PHauloosaara doorettida asata inttekko kiittanau issi wozanan nu qofaa qachchida .

text: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas , who shall also tell you the same things by mouth .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , nuuni xaafidoogaa eti bantta huuphen bantta doonan inttessi yootana mala , Yihudaanne Sillaasa kiittida .

text: For it seemed good to the Holy Ghost , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessary things ;
text2: “ Aissi giikko , eeqassi yarshshidobaa mooppite ; suutta uyoppite ; sulettida mehe asho mooppite ; shaaramuxoppite . Ha koshshiyaageetuppe attin , hara tooho inttena toossenna mala , nuuninne Geeshsha Ayyaanai yohuwaa maayida ; ha ubbabaappe intte huuphiyaa naagikko , intte lo77obaa ootteeta . Simmi saro de7ite ” yaagidosona .

text: So when they were dismissed , they came to Antioch : and when they had gathered the multitude together , they delivered the epistle :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , kiitettidaageeti moisettidi , Anxxookiyaa wodhdhidi , ammaniya asaa shiishshidi , dabddaabbiyaa asaassi immidosona .

text: Which when they had read , they rejoiced for the consolation .
text2: Eti he minttettiya dabddaabbiyaa nabbabido wode , ufaittidosona .

text: And Judas and Silas , being prophets also themselves , exhorted the brethren with many words , and confirmed them .
text2: Qassi Yihudainne Sillaasi bantta huuphen hananabaa yootiyaageeta gidiyo gishshau , ishantta keehi zoridi minttettidosona .

text: And after they had tarried there a space , they were let go in peace from the brethren unto the apostles .
text2: Eti Anxxookiyan amarida gallassaa uttidoogaappe guyyiyan , ishantti sarotettan moissin , banttana kiittidaageetukko simmidosona .

text: Notwithstanding it pleased Silas to abide there still .
text2: SHin Sillaasee yaani attanau ba qofaa qachchiis .

text: Paul also and Barnabas continued in Antioch , teaching and preaching the word of the Lord , with many others also .
text2: Qassi PHauloosinne Barnnaabaasi hara daro asatuura issippe Godaa qaalaa tamaarissiiddinne wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiiddi , Anxxookiyan uttidosona .

text: And some days after Paul said unto Barnabas , Let us go again and visit our brethren in every city where we have preached the word of the Lord , and see how they do .
text2: Amarida gallassaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi Barnnaabaasa , “ Nuuni Godaa qaalaa yootido katama ubban nu ishantti waanidi de7iyaakko , guyye simmidi , xomoosi be7oos ” yaagiis .

text: And Barnabas determined to take with them John , whose surname was Mark .
text2: Yaagin Barnnaabaasi Marqqoosa geetettiya Yohaannisa banttanaara efaanau koyiis .

text: But Paul thought not good to take him with them , who departed from them from Pamphylia , and went not with them to the work .
text2: SHin PHauloosi Marqqoosa banttanaara efaanau koyibeenna ; aissi giikko , i etappe PHinifiliyan shaahettiis ; qassi etaara oosuwau bibeenna .

text: And the contention was so sharp between them , that they departed asunder one from the other : and so Barnabas took Mark , and sailed unto Cyprus ;
text2: Eta gidduwan pala ooshshai kiyin , issoi issuwaappe shaahettidosona ; Barnnaabaasi Marqqoosa ekkidi , markkabiyan Qophphiroosa biis .

text: And Paul chose Silas , and departed , being recommended by the brethren unto the grace of God .
text2: SHin PHauloosi Sillaasa doorin , ishantti a hadaraa Xoossaa aaro kehatettau immidoogaappe guyyiyan biis .

text: And he went through Syria and Cilicia , confirming the churches .
text2: Yaatidi woosa keettata minttettiiddi , Sooriyaaranne Kilqqiyaara aadhdhiis .

text: Then came he to Derbe and Lystra : and , behold , a certain disciple was there , named Timotheus , the son of a certain woman , which was a Jewess , and believed ; but his father was a Greek :
text2: PHauloosi qassi Daribenne Lisxxira biis ; hegan Ximootiyoosa giyo kaalliyaagee , issi ammaniya Aihuda maccaasee na7ai de7ees ; a aawai Giriike asa .

text: Which was well reported of by the brethren that were at Lystra and Iconium .
text2: Lisxxiraaninne Iqooniyoonen de7iya ishantti Ximootiyoosabaa loittidi markkattidosona .

text: Him would Paul have to go forth with him ; and took and circumcised him because of the Jews which were in those quarters : for they knew all that his father was a Greek .
text2: PHauloosi Ximootiyoosa banaara efaanau koyidi , a aawai Giriike asa gididoogaa he sohuwan de7iya Aihuda ubbai eriyo gishshau , a oiqqidi qaxxariis .

text: And as they went through the cities , they delivered them the decrees for to keep , that were ordained of the apostles and elders which were at Jerusalem .
text2: Eti katamatuura biiddi , Yesuusi kiittido Yerusalaamen de7iyaageetinne cimati wottido higgiyaa ammaniyaageeti naagana mala , etassi yootiiddi aadhdhidosona .

text: And so were the churches established in the faith , and increased in number daily .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , woosa keettati ammanuwan minnidi , qoodankka gallassappe gallassan dari dari biidosona .

text: Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia , and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia ,
text2: Isiyan qaalaa yootenna mala , Geeshsha Ayyaanai eta diggido gishshau , Pirggiyaa biittaaranne Galaatiyaa biittaara aadhdhidosona .

text: After they were come to Mysia , they assayed to go into Bithynia : but the Spirit suffered them not .
text2: Eti Miisiyaa zawaa gakkido wode , Biitaaniyaa baanau koyidosona ; shin Yesuusa Ayyaanai eta diggiis .

text: And they passing by Mysia came down to Troas .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , eti Miisiyaa mataara aadhdhidi , Xiro7aada wodhdhidosona .

text: And a vision appeared to Paul in the night ; There stood a man of Macedonia , and prayed him , saying , Come over into Macedonia , and help us .
text2: PHauloosi qammi ajjuutan issi Maqidooniyaa asi bana , “ Maqidooniyaa pinnada nuna maaddarkkii ” yaagiiddi eqqidi woossishin be7iis .

text: And after he had seen the vision , immediately we endeavored to go into Macedonia , assuredly gathering that the Lord had called us for to preach the gospel unto them .
text2: Ajjuutaa i be7idoogaappe guyyiyan , nuuni sohuwaara Maqidooniyaa baanau koyida ; aissi giikko , wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yaani de7iya asaassi yootanau , Xoossai nuna xeesidobaa nuuyyo milatiis .

text: Therefore loosing from Troas , we came with a straight course to Samothracia , and the next day to Neapolis ;
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Xiro7aadappe denddidi , sitti giidi markkabiyan Saamootiraaqe biida ; wonttetta gallassi Naaphphule biida .

text: And from thence to Philippi , which is the chief city of that part of Macedonia , and a colony : and we were in that city abiding certain days .
text2: Hegaappe Piliphphisiyuusa biida ; Piliphphisiyuusi Maqidooniyaa biittau waanna katama ; qassi Roome asai de7iyo katama ; nuuni he kataman amarida gallassaa uttida .

text: And on the sabbath we went out of the city by a river side , where prayer was wont to be made ; and we sat down , and spake unto the women which resorted thither .
text2: Sambbata gallassi , katamaappe gaxan shaafaa doonan Aihudati Xoossaa woossiyo sohoi de7iyoogaa akeekidi biida ; biidi uttidi hegan shiiqida maccaasaassi qaalaa yootida .

text: And a certain woman named Lydia , a seller of purple , of the city of Thyatira , which worshipped God , heard us : whose heart the Lord opened , that she attended unto the things which were spoken of Paul .
text2: Issi Lidiyaa giyoora , Tiyaaxiroona katamaappe yaada Xoossaa ammaniyaara , zo7o afalaa baizziya maccaasiyaa , nuuni yootiyoogaa siyausu ; PHauloosi yootiyoogaakka a siyana mala Xoossai i wozanaa dooyiis .

text: And when she was baptized , and her household , she besought us , saying , If ye have judged me to be faithful to the Lord , come into my house , and abide there . And she constrained us .
text2: Lidiyaa ba so asaara issippe xammaqettidoogaappe guyyiyan nuna , “ Intte tana Godaa tumu ammanausu giidi qoppikko , ta sooni takkite ” gaada woossaasu ; minttada shoobbaasu .

text: And it came to pass , as we went to prayer , a certain damsel possessed with a spirit of divination met us , which brought her masters much gain by soothsaying :
text2: Nuuni Xoossaa woossiyoosaa biishin , iita ayyaanai i bolli de7idi kaayissiyo issi aille na7iyaa nunaara gaittaasu ; he na7iyaa kaayada daro miishshaa ba godatussi demmaasu .

text: The same followed Paul and us , and cried , saying , These men are the servants of the most high God , which shew unto us the way of salvation .
text2: Gaittada PHauloosanne nuna kaallaidda , “ Hageeti inttessi attana ogiyaa yootiyaageeti , Ubbaappe Bolla Xoossaa ailleta ” gaada qaalaa xoqqu oottada haasayaasu .

text: And this did she many days . But Paul , being grieved , turned and said to the spirit , I command thee in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her . And he came out the same hour .
text2: Ubba gallassi hegaadan gausu ; shin PHauloosi yiillotidi guyye simmidi , he iita ayyaanaa , “ Neeni ippe kiyana mala Yesuus Kiristtoosa sunttan nena azazais ” yaagiis ; sohuwaarakka iita ayyaanai ippe kiyi aggiis .

text: And when her masters saw that the hope of their gains was gone , they caught Paul and Silas , and drew them into the marketplace unto the rulers ,
text2: SHin i godati bantta miishshaa demmana ogee xayidoogaa be7idi , PHauloosanne Sillaasa oiqqidi , giyaa sohuwan de7iya daannatu sintti goochchidosona .

text: And brought them to the magistrates , saying , These men , being Jews , do exceedingly trouble our city ,
text2: Daannatu sintti eta efiidi , “ Hageeti Aihuda asa gidiiddi , nu katamaa asaa daro waissoosona .

text: And teach customs , which are not lawful for us to receive , neither to observe , being Romans .
text2: Nuuni Roome biittaa asa gidiiddi , ekkanaunne oottanau woga gidennabaa tamaarissoosona ” yaagidosona .

text: And the multitude rose up together against them : and the magistrates rent off their clothes , and commanded to beat them .
text2: Asai issi baggi gididi , PHauloosa bollinne Sillaasa bolli denddiis ; daannatikka eta maayuwaa qaari ekkidi , gatiman eta shocana mala azazidosona .

text: And when they had laid many stripes upon them , they cast them into prison , charging the jailor to keep them safely :
text2: Eta daro wadhdhidoogaappe guyyiyan , qasho keettan yeggidosona . Qasho keettaa naagiyaageekka eta mintti naaganaadan azazidosona .

text: Who , having received such a charge , thrust them into the inner prison , and made their feet fast in the stocks .
text2: Azazin qasho keettaa naagiyaagee he azazuwaa ekkidi , PHauloosanne Sillaasa qasho keettaassi qol77o gelissiis ; eta gediyaakka mittaara gatti daraxidi qachchiis .

text: And at midnight Paul and Silas prayed , and sang praises unto God : and the prisoners heard them .
text2: SHin qamma bilahe gidiyo heeran PHauloosinne Sillaasi Xoossaa woossiiddi , mazamuriyaa yettan Xoossaa galatoosona ; galatishin qashuwaasai eti giyoobaa siyees .

text: And suddenly there was a great earthquake , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken : and immediately all the doors were opened , and every one ' s bands were loosed .
text2: Qasho keettaassi xaphoi qaaxxana gakkanaassi akeekennan biittai daro qaaxxiis ; sohuwaarakka penggee ubbai dooyetti aggin , qashettida asa ubbaa sanssalatai birshshetti wodhdhiis .

text: And the keeper of the prison awaking out of his sleep , and seeing the prison doors open , he drew out his sword , and would have killed himself , supposing that the prisoners had been fled .
text2: Qasho keettaa naagiyaagee xiskkuwaappe beegottiyo wode , qasho keettaa penggee ubbai dooyettidaageeta be7idi , qashuwaasai kessi ekkidi biichchidobaa ayyo milatin , bana woranau qoppidi , bisuwaa ekkiis .

text: But Paul cried with a loud voice , saying , Do thyself no harm : for we are all here .
text2: SHin PHauloosi qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , “ Neeni nena qohoppa ; aissi giikko , nuuni ubbaikka hagan de7oos ” yaagiis .

text: Then he called for a light , and sprang in , and came trembling , and fell down before Paul and Silas ,
text2: Qasho keettaa naagiyaagee xomppiyaa woossi ekkidi , eesuwan qol77o woxxiis ; kokkoriiddi PHauloosa sinttaaninne Sillaasa sinttan gufanniis ;

text: And brought them out , and said , Sirs , what must I do to be saved ?
text2: eta kare kessidi , “ Ta godaatoo , taani attanau ai oottana bessii ? ” yaagiis .

text: And they said , Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ , and thou shalt be saved , and thy house .
text2: PHauloosinne Sillaasi a , “ Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa ammana ; neeni attana ; ne so asaikka ” yaagidosona .

text: And they spake unto him the word of the Lord , and to all that were in his house .
text2: Eti ayyoonne a son de7iya ubbaassi Godaa qaalaa yootidosona .

text: And he took them the same hour of the night , and washed their stripes ; and was baptized , he and all his , straightway .
text2: Qammi he saatiyankka qasho keettaa naagiyaagee eta efiidi eta masunttaa meecciis ; sohuwaarakka ba so asaa ubbaara xammaqetti aggiis .

text: And when he had brought them into his house , he set meat before them , and rejoiced , believing in God with all his house .
text2: PHauloosanne Sillaasa pude ba soo efiidi , etassi qumaa aattiis ; i ba so asaa ubbaara Xoossaa ammanido gishshau , ufaittiis .

text: And when it was day , the magistrates sent the serjeants , saying , Let those men go .
text2: Wonttin daannati , “ He asata birshsha ” yaagidi , polise halaqata akko kiittidosona .

text: And the keeper of the prison told this saying to Paul , The magistrates have sent to let you go : now therefore depart , and go in peace .
text2: Kiittin qasho keettaa naagiyaagee , “ Intte birshshettana mala , daannati tau kiittidosona ; simmi ha77i kiyidi sarotettan biite ” yaagidi he kiitaa PHauloosassi yootiis .

text: But Paul said unto them , They have beaten us openly uncondemned , being Romans , and have cast us into prison ; and now do they thrust us out privily ? nay verily ; but let them come themselves and fetch us out .
text2: SHin PHauloosi he polise halaqata , “ Nuuni Roome biittaa asa gidishin , eti nuna pirddi bainnan asaa sinttan wadhdhidi , qasho keettan yeggidosona . Ha77i nuna geeman kessi yeddiyoonaa ? Hanenna ; eti bantta huuphen yiidi , nuna kessona ” yaagiis .

text: And the serjeants told these words unto the magistrates : and they feared , when they heard that they were Romans .
text2: Polise halaqati daannatussi hegaa yootin , PHauloosinne Sillaasi Roome biittaa asa gididoogaa siyido wode , yayyidosona .

text: And they came and besought them , and brought them out , and desired them to depart out of the city .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , daannati yiidi eta , “ Nuuni inttena naaqqida ” giidosona . Qasho keettaappe kare eta kessidi , katamaappe kiyidi baana mala woossidosona .

text: And they went out of the prison , and entered into the house of Lydia and when they had seen the brethren , they comforted them , and departed .
text2: PHauloosinne Sillaasi qasho keettaappe kiyidi , Lidiyaa soo biidosona ; yaani ishanttuura gaittidi , eta minttettidi hegaappe biidosona .

text: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where was a synagogue of the Jews :
text2: PHauloosinne Sillaasi , Amppipholiisaaranne Apholooniyaara aadhdhidi , Tasalonqqe yiidosona ; Tasalonqqen Aihuda woosa keettai de7ees .

text: And Paul , as his manner was , went in unto them , and three sabbath days reasoned with them out of the scriptures ,
text2: PHauloosi ba meeziyaadankka yaa geliis ; hegan heezzu Sambbata gallassatun Xoossaa maxaafatuppe asaara haasayiis ;

text: Opening and alleging , that Christ must needs have suffered , and risen again from the dead ; and that this Jesus , whom I preach unto you , is Christ .
text2: Kiristtoosi waayiyaa ekkanaunne haiquwaappe denddanau bessiyoogaa etassi birshshidi yootiiddinne tuma gididoogaakka eta erissiiddi , “ Yesuusi ha taani intteyyo odiyoogee Kiristtoosa ” yaagees .

text: And some of them believed , and consorted with Paul and Silas ; and of the devout Greeks a great multitude , and of the chief women not a few .
text2: Etappe issooti issooti yohoi tuma gididoogaa akeekidi , PHauloosaaranne Sillaaseera gaittidosona ; hegaadankka , Xoossaassi goinniya daro Giriiketinne daro bonchchettida maccaasati , PHauloosaaranne Sillaaseera gaittidosona .

text: But the Jews which believed not , moved with envy , took unto them certain lewd fellows of the baser sort , and gathered a company , and set all the city on an uproar , and assaulted the house of Jason , and sought to bring them out to the people .
text2: SHin Aihudati qanaatidi , issi issi oosoi bainna iita asata qocaappe shiishshidosona ; shiishshidi katamaa asaa wocamissidosona ; PHauloosanne Sillaasa asaakko kessana mala koyidi , Yaasoona keettaa menttidosona .

text: And when they found them not , they drew Jason and certain brethren unto the rulers of the city , crying , These that have turned the world upside down are come hither also ;
text2: PHauloosinne Sillaasi etassi beettennan ixxin , Yaasoonanne issi issi ishantta katamaa halaqatukko goochchidi , “ Hageeti biitta ubbaa metoyidaageeti , hagaakka yiidosona .

text: Whom Jason hath received : and these all do contrary to the decrees of Caesar , saying that there is another king , one Jesus .
text2: Yin Yaasooni eta ba sooni wottiis ; hageeti ubbai , ' Yesuusa giyo hara kawoi de7ees ' giidi Qeesaara azazuwaa menttoosona ” yaagidi , qaalaa xoqqissidi haasayidosona .

text: And they troubled the people and the rulers of the city , when they heard these things .
text2: SHiiqida asainne katamaa halaqati hegaa siyidi metootidosona .

text: And when they had taken security of Jason , and of the other , they let them go .
text2: Halaqati Yaasoonanne harata waasiyan birshshidosona .

text: And the brethren immediately sent away Paul and Silas by night unto Berea : who coming thither went into the synagogue of the Jews .
text2: Ammaniyaageeti PHauloosanne Sillaasa sa7ai qammiyoogan sohuwaara Beeriyaa yeddidosona . Beeriyaa gakkidi , Aihuda woosa keettaa gelidosona .

text: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica , in that they received the word with all readiness of mind , and searched the scriptures daily , whether those things were so .
text2: Beeriyaa asati Tasalonqqen de7iya asatuppekka aadhdhiya akeekanchcha gidido gishshau , “ PHauloosi giidoogee tumakkonne ” yaagidi , ubba gallassi Xoossaa maxaafata tamaariiddi , qaalaa kumetta laamotan ekkidosona .

text: Therefore many of them believed ; also of honourable women which were Greeks , and of men , not a few .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , etappe daroti , Giriiketuppe bonchchettida daro maccaasatinne daro attumaasati ammanidosona .

text: But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was preached of Paul at Berea , they came thither also , and stirred up the people .
text2: SHin Tasalonqqen de7iya Aihudati PHauloosi Xoossaa qaalaa Beeriyankka yootidoogaa siyido wode , Beeriyaa yiidi , asaa aara ooshshidosona .

text: And then immediately the brethren sent away Paul to go as it were to the sea : but Silas and Timotheus abode there still .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , ishantti sohuwaarakka PHauloosa abbaa mati yeddi aggidosona ; shin Sillaasinne Ximootiyoosi Beeriyan attidosona .

text: And they that conducted Paul brought him unto Athens : and receiving a commandment unto Silas and Timotheus for to come to him with all speed , they departed .
text2: PHauloosa moissida asati Ateena gattidosona ; he asati Sillaasinne Ximootiyoosi banttau danddayettidoogaadan , eesuwan baakko yaana mala , PHauloosi kiittido kiitaa ekkidi , Beeriyaa simmidosona .

text: Now while Paul waited for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred in him , when he saw the city wholly given to idolatry .
text2: PHauloosi Ateenan Sillaasanne Ximootiyoosa naagiiddi , kataman eeqai kumidaagaa be7idi yiillotiis .

text: Therefore disputed he in the synagogue with the Jews , and with the devout persons , and in the market daily with them that met with him .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Aihuda woosa keettan Aihudatuuranne Xoossaassi goinniya Aihuda gidenna asatuura palamettees ; qassi ubba gallassi giyan banaara gaittiya asaarakka palamettees .

text: Then certain philosophers of the Epicureans , and of the Stoicks , encountered him . And some said , What will this babbler say ? other some , He seemeth to be a setter forth of strange gods : because he preached unto them Jesus , and the resurrection .
text2: Qassi Eppiqoroosappenne Isxxo7ikiyaappe yiida issi issi eranchchati PHauloosaara palamettidosona ; etappe issoi issoi , “ Ha toofiinai ai haasayanau koyii ? ” yaagidosona . Harati PHauloosi Yesuusabaanne haiquwaappe i denddidoogaa banttassi yootiyo gishshau , “ Ooratta xoossatubaa odiyaabaa milatees ” yaagidosona .

text: And they took him , and brought him unto Areopagus , saying , May we know what this new doctrine , whereof thou speakest , is ?
text2: PHauloosa oiqqidi , “ Ha neeni tamaarissiyo ooratta yohoi aibakkonne nuna erissarkkii ? Aissi giikko , neeni nuuyyo oorattabaa yootaasa ; simmi hagee Aibakko nuuni eranau koyoos ” yaagidi PHauloosa Ariyosppaagoosa giyoosaa efiidosona .

text: ( For all the Athenians and strangers which were there spent their time in nothing else , but either to tell , or to hear some new thing . )
text2: Ateena asai ubbainne hegan de7iya imattati oorattabaa haasayiiddinne siyiiddi pe7iyoogaappe attin , haraban pe7okkona .

text: Then Paul stood in the midst of Mars ' hill , and said , Ye men of Athens , I perceive that in all things ye are too superstitious .
text2: PHauloosi Ariyosppaagoosa sinttan eqqidi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Ateena asatoo , Xoossatussi ubbaban intte daro yayyiyoogaa taani be7ais .

text: For as I passed by , and beheld your devotions , I found an altar with this inscription , TO THE UNKNOWN GOD . Whom therefore ye ignorantly worship , him declare I unto you .
text2: Aissi giikko , taani intte goinniyoogaa xeellaidda aadhdhishin , ' Erettenna Xoossaassi ' geetettidi xaafettida yarshshuwaa sohuwaa qassi demmaas ; hegaa gishshau , ha intte erennan goinniyoogaa taani inttessi yootais .

text: God that made the world and all things therein , seeing that he is Lord of heaven and earth , dwelleth not in temples made with hands ;
text2: “ Sa7aanne sa7an de7iya ubbabaa medhdhida Xoossai saluwaanne sa7aa Godai , asi keexxido Beeta Maqidasiyan de7enna .

text: Neither is worshipped with men ' s hands , as though he needed any thing , seeing he giveth to all life , and breath , and all things ;
text2: Aibakko paccido asadan , asa kushe i xeellenna ; aissi giikko , i ba huuphen de7uwaa shemppuwaanne ubbabaa asa ubbaassi immees .

text: And hath made of one blood all nations of men for to dwell on all the face of the earth , and hath determined the times before appointed , and the bounds of their habitation ;
text2: Xoossai asa zare ubbaa issi uraappe medhdhidi , biitta ubban wottiis ; i ba huuphen eti de7ana wodiyaanne sohuwaa kase zawayiis .

text: That they should seek the Lord , if haply they might feel after him , and find him , though he be not far from every one of us :
text2: “ I hegaa oottidoogee eti oiqqi oiqqi xeellidi , bana koyiiddi , geelladan demmanddonaashsha giyoogaana ; gidikkonne , Xoossai nuuppe ooyyoonne haaho gidenna .

text: For in him we live , and move , and have our being ; as certain also of your own poets have said , For we are also his offspring .
text2: Aissi giikko , intteppe issi issi eranchchati , ' Nuuni a naata ' giidoogaadan , nuuni aani paxa de7oosinne de7idi qaaxettoos .

text: Forasmuch then as we are the offspring of God , we ought not to think that the Godhead is like unto gold , or silver , or stone , graven by art and man ' s device .
text2: Simmi nuuni Xoossaa naata gidido gishshau , Xoossai asa cinccatettaaninne qofan worqqappe woi birappe woi shuchchappe oosettidabaa milatees yaagidi , qoppanau bessenna .

text: And the times of this ignorance God winked at ; but now commandeth all men every where to repent :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Xoossai asai eribeenna wodiyaa aattiis ; shin ha77i ubbasan asai ubbai nagaraappe simmana mala azazees .

text: Because he hath appointed a day , in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he hath ordained ; whereof he hath given assurance unto all men , in that he hath raised him from the dead .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossai gallassaa keeri wottiis ; he gallassan ba doorido uran sa7an de7iya asa ubbaa bolli xillo pirddaa i pirddana ; asa ubbaassi haiquwaappe a denttidoogan hegaa tumayiis ” yaagiis .

text: And when they heard of the resurrection of the dead , some mocked : and others said , We will hear thee again of this matter .
text2: Etappe issi issi asati haiquwaappe dendduwaabaa PHauloosappe siyidi , a bolli qilliiccidosona ; shin harati a , “ Nuuni hagaa neeppe gujjidi siyana koyoos ” giidosona .

text: So Paul departed from among them .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , PHauloosi eta giddoppe kiyiis .

text: Howbeit certain men clave unto him , and believed : among the which was Dionysius the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
text2: SHin issi issi attumaasati PHauloosaara gaittidi ammanidosona ; eta gidduwan Ariyosppaagoosan de7iya pirdda keettaa daannai Diyoonaasiyoosi , Damaariiso giyo issi maccaasiyaanne harati de7oosona .

text: After these things Paul departed from Athens , and came to Corinth ;
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi Ateenappe kiyidi , Qoronttoosa biis .

text: And found a certain Jew named Aquila , born in Pontus , lately come from Italy , with his wife Priscilla ; ( because that Claudius had commanded all Jews to depart from Rome : ) and came unto them .
text2: Hegan Aqiila giyo issi Aihuda asa demmiis ; Aqiili PHanxxoosan yelettiis ; Aihuda asai ubbai Roomeppe kiyana mala , Qalaudeyoosi azazido gishshau , amarida wodiyaappe kase , i ba machchee PHirisqqiliira Xaaliyaappe yiis ; yin PHauloosi etaara gaittanau biis .

text: And because he was of the same craft , he abode with them , and wrought : for by their occupation they were tentmakers .
text2: A oosoinne eta oosoi issi mala dunkkaane siho gidiyo gishshau , etaara uttidi , issippe oottiis .

text: And he reasoned in the synagogue every sabbath , and persuaded the Jews and the Greeks .
text2: PHauloosi Sambbata ubban Aihudatanne Giriiketa ammanttanau Aihuda woosa keettan palamettees .

text: And when Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia , Paul was pressed in the spirit , and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Sillaasinne Ximootiyoosi Maqidooniyaappe yiido wode , PHauloosi Aihudatussi Yesuusi ba huuphen Kiristtoosa gididoogau qaalaa yootuwaa toliis .

text: And when they opposed themselves , and blasphemed , he shook his raiment , and said unto them , Your blood be upon your own heads ; I am clean : from henceforth I will go unto the Gentiles .
text2: SHin eti PHauloosa haasayaa phalqqiininne a cayin , PHauloosi ba maayuwaappe buhiyaa qoqqofiiddi , “ Intte palai inttena oiqqo ; taani hegan gelikke ; hagaappe hini baggan taani Aihuda gidenna asaakko bais ” yaagiis .

text: And he departed thence , and entered into a certain man ' s house , named Justus , one that worshipped God , whose house joined hard to the synagogue .
text2: Hegaappe kiyidi , Xoossaassi goinniya Yosxxoosa giyo bitaniyaa soo biis ; Yosxxoosa keettai Aihuda woosa keettaa lanqqiyan de7ees .

text: And Crispus , the chief ruler of the synagogue , believed on the Lord with all his house ; and many of the Corinthians hearing believed , and were baptized .
text2: Aihuda woosa keettaa halaqai Qarisphphoosi ba so asaa ubbaara Godaa ammaniis ; Qoronttoosa asatuppekka daroti Xoossaa qaalaa siyido wode , ammanidi xammaqettidosona .

text: Then spake the Lord to Paul in the night by a vision , Be not afraid , but speak , and hold not thy peace :
text2: Godai issi qammi ajjuutan PHauloosa , “ Yayyoppa ; yoota ; co77u gooppa . Taani nenaara de7iyo gishshau , nena qohanau iitaban yeggana asi ooninne baawa ; aissi giikko , taassi ha kataman daro asai de7ees ” yaagiis .

text: And he continued there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
text2: Yaagin PHauloosi Xoossaa qaalaa asaa tamaarissiiddi , issi laittanne usuppun agina etaara uttiis .

text: And when Gallio was the deputy of Achaia , the Jews made insurrection with one accord against Paul , and brought him to the judgment seat ,
text2: Gaaliyoosi Akaayiyaa biittaa haariyo wode , Aihudati issippe PHauloosa bolli denddidi , pirdda keettaa a efiidosona .

text: Saying , This fellow persuadeth men to worship God contrary to the law .
text2: Efiidi , “ Ha bitanee higgiyaa ixxidi , asai Xoossaassi goinnana mala labees ” yaagidosona .

text: And when Paul was now about to open his mouth , Gallio said unto the Jews , If it were a matter of wrong or wicked lewdness , O ye Jews , reason would that I should bear with you :
text2: PHauloosi haasayana hanishin , Gaaliyoosi Aihudata , “ Aihudatoo , hegee bala ooso woi iita naaqo gidiyaakko , taani inttebaa danddayada siyanau bessees .

text: But if it be a question of words and names , and of your law , look ye to it ; for I will be no judge of such matters .
text2: SHin qaalassi sunttassinne intte huuphe higgiyaassi intte palamettikko , intte huuphen erite ; hagaa taani pirddikke ” yaagiis .

text: And he drave them from the judgment seat .
text2: Yaagidi pirdda keettaappe kare eta kessiis .

text: Then all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the chief ruler of the synagogue , and beat him before the judgment seat . And Gallio cared for none of those things .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , Giriike asai ubbai Aihuda woosa keettaa halaqaa Sostteniisa oiqqidi , pirdda keettaa sinttan wadhdhidosona ; shin Gaaliyoosa hegee ainne metibeenna .

text: And Paul after this tarried there yet a good while , and then took his leave of the brethren , and sailed thence into Syria , and with him Priscilla and Aquila ; having shorn his head in Cenchrea : for he had a vow .
text2: PHauloosi daro gallassaa Qoronttoosan uttidoogaappe guyyiyan , ishantta sarotidi , PHirisqqiliiranne Aqiilaara markkabiyan Sooriyaa biis ; baassi shiiqo gatoi de7iyo gishshau , Kinkkiriyaa kataman ba huuphiyaa meedettiis .

text: And he came to Ephesus , and left them there : but he himself entered into the synagogue , and reasoned with the Jews .
text2: Eti Efisoona gakkido wode , PHauloosi PHirisqqilonne Aqiila yaani yeggiis ; shin baayyo Aihuda woosa keettaa gelidi , Aihudatuura palamettiis .

text: When they desired him to tarry longer time with them , he consented not ;
text2: Eti banttanaara daro wodiyaa uttanau PHauloosa woossin i ixxiis .

text: But bade them farewell , saying , I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem : but I will return again unto you , if God will . And he sailed from Ephesus .
text2: SHin etappe shaahettiiddi , “ Taani yiya baala gallassaa Yerusalaamen bonchchanau bessees ; shin Xoossai giikko , naa77anttuwaa inttekko simmana ” yaagidi Efisoonappe markkabiyan biis .

text: And when he had landed at Caesarea , and gone up , and saluted the church , he went down to Antioch .
text2: Qiisaariyaa gakkido wode Yerusalaame biidi , woosa keettaa asaa sarotidoogaappe guyyiyan , Anxxookiyaa wodhdhiis .

text: And after he had spent some time there , he departed , and went over all the country of Galatia and Phrygia in order , strengthening all the disciples .
text2: Yaani amarida wodiyaa gam77idi biis ; kaalliyaageeta ubbaa minttettiiddi , Galaatiyaaranne Pirggiyaara aadhdhiis .

text: And a certain Jew named Apollos , born at Alexandria , an eloquent man , and mighty in the scriptures , came to Ephesus .
text2: Iskkinddiriyan yelettida Aihuda asa issi Aphiloosa giyo yoho eranchchai Efisoona biis ; Xoossaa maxaafata i daro eriya asa .

text: This man was instructed in the way of the Lord ; and being fervent in the spirit , he spake and taught diligently the things of the Lord , knowing only the baptism of John .
text2: Godaa ogiyaakka tamaarida asa ; Yohaannisa xinqqatiyaa xalaalaa eridi , ayyaanan mishettiiddi , Yesuusabaa sitti oottidi haasayeesinne tamaarissees .

text: And he began to speak boldly in the synagogue : whom when Aquila and Priscilla had heard , they took him unto them , and expounded unto him the way of God more perfectly .
text2: Yaatidi Aihuda woosa keettan yayyennan haasayaa doommiis . PHirisqqilanne Aqiili i yootiyoogaa siyido wode , banttanaara soo a efiidi , Xoossaa ogiyaa kaseppe sittayidi , ayyo geeshshidi yootidosona .

text: And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia , the brethren wrote , exhorting the disciples to receive him : who , when he was come , helped them much which had believed through grace :
text2: Aphiloosi Akaayiyaa pinnana koyin , ishantti a minttettidi , Akaayiyan de7iya kaalliyaageeti a mokkana mala , etassi dabddaabbiyaa xaafidosona ; i yaa gakkidi , Xoossaa aaro kehatettan ammaniyaageeta daro maaddiis .

text: For he mightily convinced the Jews , and that publickly , shewing by the scriptures that Jesus was Christ .
text2: Aissi giikko , Yesuusi ba huuphen Kiristtoosa gididoogaa Aihudatussi Xoossaa maxaafatuppe qonccissidi , deriyaa sinttan minttidi yootees .

text: And it came to pass , that , while Apollos was at Corinth , Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus : and finding certain disciples ,
text2: Aphiloosi Qoronttoosan de7ishin , PHauloosi qommo baggaara aadhdhidi , Efisoona yiis ; yiidi issi issi kaalliyaageeta demmiis .

text: He said unto them , Have ye received the Holy Ghost since ye believed ? And they said unto him , We have not so much as heard whether there be any Holy Ghost .
text2: Eta , “ Intte ammanido wode Geeshsha Ayyaanaa ekkidetii ? ” yaagidi oichchiis . Oichchin eti , “ CHii , ekkibookko ; harai atto , Geeshsha Ayyaani de7iyoobaakka siyibookko ” yaagidosona .

text: And he said unto them , Unto what then were ye baptized ? And they said , Unto John ' s baptism .
text2: PHauloosi eta , “ Yaatin , Aibin xammaqettidetii ? ” yaagiis . Eti , “ Nuuni Yohaannisa xinqqatiyan xammaqettida ” yaagidi zaaridosona .

text: Then said Paul , John verily baptized with the baptism of repentance , saying unto the people , that they should believe on him which should come after him , that is , on Christ Jesus .
text2: PHauloosi , “ Yohaannisi baappe guyyiyan yiya Yesuus Kiristtoosan asai ammanana mala , asaassi yootiiddi , nagaraappe simmiyo xinqqatiyan xammaqiis ” yaagiis .

text: When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: Eti hegaa siyido wode , Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa sunttan xammaqettidosona .

text: And when Paul had laid his hands upon them , the Holy Ghost came on them ; and they spake with tongues , and prophesied .
text2: PHauloosi ba kushiyaa eta bolli wottido wode Geeshsha Ayyaanai eta bolli wodhdhin , dumma dumma qaalan haasayidosona ; qassi hananabaakka yootidosona .

text: And all the men were about twelve .
text2: Hegan ubbaara tammanne naa77u asata gidiyaageeti de7oosona .

text: And he went into the synagogue , and spake boldly for the space of three months , disputing and persuading the things concerning the kingdom of God .
text2: PHauloosi Aihuda woosa keettaa gelidi , Xoossaa kawotettaabaa palamettiiddinne akeekissiiddi , asaara heezzu agina gidiyaagaa keenaa yayyennan haasayees .

text: But when divers were hardened , and believed not , but spake evil of that way before the multitude , he departed from them , and separated the disciples , disputing daily in the school of one Tyrannus .
text2: SHin etappe issoi issoi makkalidi , daro asaa sinttan Godaa ogiyaa cayiiddi ammanennan ixxin , PHauloosi etappe shaahettidi , ba kaalliyaageeta banaara efiis ; Xiraanoosa giyo tamaare keettan ubba gallassi palamettees .

text: And this continued by the space of two years ; so that all they which dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Lord Jesus , both Jews and Greeks .
text2: PHauloosi naa77u laitta gakkanaassi qaalaa yootiis ; hegaa gishshau , Isiyan de7iya asai ubbai , Aihudatikka Aihuda gidennaageetikka Godaa qaalaa siyidosona .

text: And God wrought special miracles by the hands of Paul :
text2: Xoossai PHauloosa baggaara ooratta malaataa oottiis .

text: So that from his body were brought unto the sick handkerchiefs or aprons , and the diseases departed from them , and the evil spirits went out of them .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , asai a bollai bochchido maarabiyaa woi maayuwaa hargganchchatussi efees ; efin hargganchchatikka paxoosona ; iita ayyaanatikka etappe kiyoosona .

text: Then certain of the vagabond Jews , exorcists , took upon them to call over them which had evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus , saying , We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preacheth .
text2: Iita ayyaanata kessiiddi yuuyiya Aihudatuppe issoi issoi , “ PHauloosi qaalaa yootiyo Yesuusa sunttan nuuni inttena kiyite giidi azazoos ” yaagi yaagidi , iita ayyaanati de7iyo asatu bollan Godaa Yesuusa sunttaa xeesi be7idosona .

text: And there were seven sons of one Sceva , a Jew , and chief of the priests , which did so .
text2: Qeese halaqaa Asqqeewa giyo issi Aihudaassi hegaa oottida laappun naati de7oosona .

text: And the evil spirit answered and said , Jesus I know , and Paul I know ; but who are ye ?
text2: Iita ayyaanai etassi zaaridi , “ Taani Yesuusa erais ; PHauloosakka erais . SHin intte oonee ? ” yaagiis .

text: And the man in whom the evil spirit was leaped on them , and overcame them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
text2: Iita ayyaanai de7iyo bitanee eta bolli guppi wodhdhin , eti masunxxidi , he keettaappe kallo baqatana gakkanaas , wolqqaamidi xooniis .

text: And this was known to all the Jews and Greeks also dwelling at Ephesus ; and fear fell on them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified .
text2: Efisoonan de7iya Aihudatinne Aihuda gidennaageeti ubbai hegaa siyidosona ; siyidi ubbaikka daro yayyidosona ; Godaa Yesuusa sunttaikka daro bonchchettiis .

text: And many that believed came , and confessed , and shewed their deeds .
text2: Ammaniyaageetuppe daro asati bantta oottidobaa paaxiiddinne qoncciyan yootiiddi yoosona .

text: Many of them also which used curious arts brought their books together , and burned them before all men : and they counted the price of them , and found it fifty thousand pieces of silver .
text2: Bitiyaageetuppe daroti bantta maxaafata shiishshidi , asaa ubbaa sinttan xuuggidosona ; he maxaafatu waagaa qoodiyo wode , ishatamu sha7u bira gidiis .

text: So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed .
text2: Hegaa mala wolqqaama ogiyan Xoossaa qaalai dicceesinne aakkees .

text: After these things were ended , Paul purposed in the spirit , when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia , to go to Jerusalem , saying , After I have been there , I must also see Rome .
text2: Hegee polettidoogaappe guyyiyan PHauloosi , “ Taani Yerusalaame baada Roomekka qassi be7anau bessees ” yaagidi , Maqidooniyaaranne Akaayiyaara aadhdhidi , Yerusalaame baanau qofaa qachchiis .

text: So he sent into Macedonia two of them that ministered unto him , Timotheus and Erastus ; but he himself stayed in Asia for a season .
text2: Qassi bana maaddiyaageetuppe naa77ata Ximootiyoosanne Erasxxoosa Maqidooniyaa kiittidi , bau Isiyan amarida wodiyaa takkiis .

text: And the same time there arose no small stir about that way .
text2: Godaa ogiyaa gishshau , he wode daro wocamai kiyiis .

text: For a certain man named Demetrius , a silversmith , which made silver shrines for Diana , brought no small gain unto the craftsmen ;
text2: Aissi giikko , biraa tigiya Dimexiroosa giyo issi bitanee Arxxemiisi Beeta Maqidasiyaa misiliyaa biraappe tigi tigidi , oosanchchatussi daro woriyaa demmees .

text: Whom he called together with the workmen of like occupation , and said , Sirs , ye know that by this craft we have our wealth .
text2: Hegeetanne etaagaa mala oosuwaa oottiyaageeta issippe shiishshidi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Asau , nu duretettai ha oosuwaana gidiyoogaa intte ereeta .

text: Moreover ye see and hear , that not alone at Ephesus , but almost throughout all Asia , this Paul hath persuaded and turned away much people , saying that they be no gods , which are made with hands :
text2: Hegee PHauloosi , ' Asa kushee oottidoogeeti xoossata gidokkona ' yaagidi , Efisoona xalaalan gidennan amarida biittatuppe attin , Isiyan ubban daro asaassi odi maizzidoogaanne balettidoogaa intte be7idetanne siyideta .

text: So that not only this our craft is in danger to be set at nought ; but also that the temple of the great goddess Diana should be despised , and her magnificence should be destroyed , whom all Asia and the world worshippeth .
text2: Palabai , nu oosoi karettanaagaa xalaala gidenna ; shin Isiyan de7iya ubbatinne sa7a ubban de7iyaageeti goinniyo gita Xoossee Arxxemiisi Beeta Maqidasee bonchchettennan attanaagaanne , i gitatettaikka kunddanaagaa ” yaagiis .

text: And when they heard these sayings , they were full of wrath , and cried out , saying , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: Asai hegaa siyido wode hanqquwaa xuuqqidi , “ Efisoona Arxxemiisa gita ” yaagidi wocamiis .

text: And the whole city was filled with confusion : and having caught Gaius and Aristarchus , men of Macedonia , Paul ' s companions in travel , they rushed with one accord into the theatre .
text2: Katama ubban wocamai denddiis ; PHauloosaara hemettiya Maqidooniyaa asata Gaayoosanne Arisxxirokoosa banttanaara oiqqi ekkidi , issippe kaassaa sohuwaa woxxidosona .

text: And when Paul would have entered in unto the people , the disciples suffered him not .
text2: PHauloosikka asai shiiqidosaa gelana koyiis . SHin kaalliyaageeti a diggidosona .

text: And certain of the chief of Asia , which were his friends , sent unto him , desiring him that he would not adventure himself into the theatre .
text2: Isiyaa biittaa halaqatuppe PHauloosa lagge gidiya issoi issoi PHauloosau kiittidi , kaassaa sohuwan qoncciyaa kiyidi i beettenna mala , a woossidosona .

text: Some therefore cried one thing , and some another : for the assembly was confused ; and the more part knew not wherefore they were come together .
text2: SHiiquwan wocamai denddin , dariya bagga asai harai atto aissi shiiqidaakkonne erenna gishshau , issoi issibau wocamiyo wode , hinkkoi harabau wocamees .

text: And they drew Alexander out of the multitude , the Jews putting him forward . And Alexander beckoned with the hand , and would have made his defence unto the people .
text2: Aihudati Iskkinddira aatti bessin , issi issi asai i haasayana mala , asaa giddoppe sinttau a aattiis ; aattin asai co77u gaana mala , i ba kushiyan malaati bessidi , asaassi mootettanau koyiis .

text: But when they knew that he was a Jew , all with one voice about the space of two hours cried out , Great is Diana of the Ephesians .
text2: SHin Iskkinddiri Aihuda asa gididoogaa asai erido wode , naa77u saate gidiyaagaa keenaa ubbai issi qaalan , “ Efisoona Arxxemiisa gita ” yaagidi wocamiis .

text: And when the townclerk had appeased the people , he said , Ye men of Ephesus , what man is there that knoweth not how that the city of the Ephesians is a worshipper of the great goddess Diana , and of the image which fell down from Jupiter ?
text2: Katamaa xaafee asaa co77u oottidi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Efisoona asau , Efisoona katamai gita Arxxemiisissinne saluwaappe wodhdhida eeqa shuchchaassi eeqa keettaa naagiyaagaa gididoogaa erenna asi oonee ?

text: Seeing then that these things cannot be spoken against , ye ought to be quiet , and to do nothing rashly .
text2: Hagaa kashi giya asi bainnaashin , intte woppu gaanaunne dirbbennan agganau bessees .

text: For ye have brought hither these men , which are neither robbers of churches , nor yet blasphemers of your goddess .
text2: Aissi giikko , hageeti Beeta Maqidasiyaa miishshaa wuuqqibeennaageeta nu Xoossatakka cayibeennaageeta ehiideta .

text: Wherefore if Demetrius , and the craftsmen which are with him , have a matter against any man , the law is open , and there are deputies : let them implead one another .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Dimexiroosinne aara de7iya oosanchchati asa mootanau koyikko , pirdda keettai dooya de7ees ; qassi deriyaa haariyaageetikka de7oosona ; eti bantta giddon mootettona .

text: But if ye inquire any thing concerning other matters , it shall be determined in a lawful assembly .
text2: SHin intte hara yoho koyikko , higgiyaa yaa7an yohuwaa qachchana .

text: For we are in danger to be called in question for this day ' s uproar , there being no cause whereby we may give an account of this concourse .
text2: Aissi giikko , hachchi hanidabaa shabbiretta giidi , Roome biittaa asati nuna mootana ; ha shiiquwaukka gaasoi bainna gishshau , nuuni gaaso odanau danddayokko ”

text: And when he had thus spoken , he dismissed the assembly .
text2: yaagidi yaa7aa denttiis .

text: And after the uproar was ceased , Paul called unto him the disciples , and embraced them , and departed for to go into Macedonia .
text2: Wocamai irxxidoogaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi kaalliyaageeta ehiissidi zoriis ; eta , “ Saro de7ite ” giidi , Maqidooniyaa baanau kiyiis .

text: And when he had gone over those parts , and had given them much exhortation , he came into Greece ,
text2: He biittaara aadhdhiiddi , qaalaa yootidi , asaa daro minttettidoogaappe guyyiyan , Giriike biittaa yiis .

text: And there abode three months . And when the Jews laid wait for him , as he was about to sail into Syria , he purposed to return through Macedonia .
text2: I hegan heezzu agina uttidi , markkabiyan Sooriyaa baanau qoppishin , Aihudati bana woranau koyiyoogaa be7idi , Maqidooniyaara guyye simmanau ba qofaa qachchiis .

text: And there accompanied him into Asia Sopater of Berea ; and of the Thessalonians , Aristarchus and Secundus ; and Gaius of Derbe , and Timotheus ; and of Asia , Tychicus and Trophimus .
text2: PHauloosa moissidaageeti , Beeriyaappe PHarihaasa na7aa Sosiiphaaxiroosa , Tasalonqqeppe Arisxxirokoosanne Sikonddisa , Daribeppe Gaayoosanne Isiyaappe Tikiqoosanne Xirofiimoosa , qassi Ximootiyoosa .

text: These going before tarried for us at Troas .
text2: Hegeeti sinttau biidi , nuna Xiro7aadan naagoosona .

text: And we sailed away from Philippi after the days of unleavened bread , and came unto them to Troas in five days ; where we abode seven days .
text2: Nuuni Oittaa Baalaa gallassaa bonchchidoogaappe guyyiyan , Piliphphisiyuusappe markkabiyan denddidi , ichchashu gallassan Xiro7aadan eta gakkidi , yaani laappun gallassaa uttida .

text: And upon the first day of the week , when the disciples came together to break bread , Paul preached unto them , ready to depart on the morrow ; and continued his speech until midnight .
text2: Nuuni Woggaa gallassi oittaa menttanau shiiqidaashin , PHauloosi wonttin baanau qoppido gishshau , etassi qaalaa yootiiddi , qammi bilahe gakkanaassi yohuwaa adussiis .

text: And there were many lights in the upper chamber , where they were gathered together .
text2: Nuuni shiiqi uttido pooqiyan daro xomppee de7ees .

text: And there sat in a window a certain young man named Eutychus , being fallen into a deep sleep : and as Paul was long preaching , he sunk down with sleep , and fell down from the third loft , and was taken up dead .
text2: Euxikoosa giyo issi wodallai maskkootiyaa bolli uttidi , keehi xiskkiis ; PHauloosi haasayaa adussido wode , Euxikoosi xiskkuwan kairidaagee heezzantto pooqiyaappe sa7an kunddidi haiqqidaagaa asai denttiis .

text: And Paul went down , and fell on him , and embracing him said , Trouble not yourselves ; for his life is in him .
text2: SHin PHauloosi wodhdhidi , a bolli gufanniis ; a qoommidi , “ A shemppoi kiyibeenna gishshau hirggoppite ” yaagiis .

text: When he therefore was come up again , and had broken bread , and eaten , and talked a long while , even till break of day , so he departed .
text2: Yaagidi pude pooqiyaa kiyidi , oittaa menttidi miis ; sa7ai wonttana gakkanaas , daro wodiyaa haasayidoogaappe guyyiyan biis .

text: And they brought the young man alive , and were not a little comforted .
text2: Wodallai paxin , soo efiidi , daro ufaittidosona .

text: And we went before to ship , and sailed unto Assos , there intending to take in Paul : for so had he appointed , minding himself to go afoot .
text2: SHin PHauloosi bana yaappe nuuni mokkana mala , nuussi yootido gishshau , kasetidi markkabiyaakko biidi , Asoosa baanau denddida ; aissi giikko , tohuwan baanau i qoppido gishshau nuna hegaadan azaziis .

text: And when he met with us at Assos , we took him in , and came to Mitylene .
text2: I nunaara Asoosan gaittin , markkabiyan a ekkidi mixiliine yiida .

text: And we sailed thence , and came the next day over against Chios ; and the next day we arrived at Samos , and tarried at Trogyllium ; and the next day we came to Miletus .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi yaappe markkabiyan denddidi , kiiyo sintti gakkida ; qassi wonttetta gallassi Saamoosa pinnida ; Tirogiliyoomen aqidi , wonttin Miliixe yiida .

text: For Paul had determined to sail by Ephesus , because he would not spend the time in Asia : for he hasted , if it were possible for him , to be at Jerusalem the day of Pentecost .
text2: Aissi giikko , PHauloosi Isiyan daro gam77ennan Efisoona lanqqiyaara aadhdhanau ba qofaa qachchiis ; bau danddayettikko , PHenxxaqosxxe giyo gallassi Yerusalaame gakkanau eesotees .

text: And from Miletus he sent to Ephesus , and called the elders of the church .
text2: PHauloosi Miliixeppe Efisoona kiittidi , woosa keettaa cimata xeegissiis .

text: And when they were come to him , he said unto them , Ye know , from the first day that I came into Asia , after what manner I have been with you at all seasons ,
text2: Woosa keettaa cimati PHauloosakko yin , eta i hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Taani Isiyaa gelido koiro gallassaappe doommin , kaushsha ubbaaranne daro afuttaara Godaassi oottaidda , Aihudatu yaa7aappe tana gakkida paace wode ubban inttenaara waanada de7idaakko intte ereeta .

text: And how I kept back nothing that was profitable unto you , but have shewed you , and have taught you publickly , and from house to house ,
text2: Nagaraappe Xoossaakko simmiyoogaanne nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosa ammaniyoogaa Aihudatussinne Aihuda gidennaageetussi markkattaidda , yaa7ankka intte keettan keettankka inttessi yootada tamaarissidoogaappe attin , inttena go77iyaabaappe issibaanne pacissabeikke .

text: And now , behold , I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem , not knowing the things that shall befall me there :
text2: “ Be7ite ; ha77ikka taani Geeshsha Ayyaanaassi azazettada , Yerusalaame bais ; yaani tau aibi kiyanaakkonne erikke .

text: Save that the Holy Ghost witnesseth in every city , saying that bonds and afflictions abide me .
text2: Geeshsha Ayyaanai qashoinne waayee tana naagiyoogaa katama ubban tau yootees .

text: But none of these things move me , neither count I my life dear unto myself , so that I might finish my course with joy , and the ministry , which I have received of the Lord Jesus , to testify the gospel of the grace of God .
text2: SHin ta wottaa polanaunne Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosappe taani ekkido oosuwaa Xoossaa aaro kehatettaa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa markkattiyoogaa polanau , ta shemppuwaa pattennabaadan qoodais .

text: And now , behold , I know that ye all , among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God , shall see my face no more .
text2: “ Be7ite ; taani ha77ikka Xoossaa kawotettaabaa yootaidda , intte ubbaa giddon yuuyaas ; simmi hagaappe sinttan intteppe ooninne tana be7ennaagaa erais .

text: Wherefore I take you to record this day , that I am pure from the blood of all men .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , intteppe issi urai bayikkokka taani hegan gelennaagaa hachchi intteyyo geeshshada yootais .

text: For I have not shunned to declare unto you all the counsel of God .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossai oottanau qoppidobaa ubbaa intteyyo ainne ashshennan yootaas .

text: Take heed therefore unto yourselves , and to all the flock , over the which the Holy Ghost hath made you overseers , to feed the church of God , which he hath purchased with his own blood .
text2: “ Yesuusi ba suuttan wozido Xoossaa woosa keettaa naagite ; qassi Geeshsha Ayyaanai inttena halaqa oottidi sunttido wude ubbaakka intte huuphiyaakka naagite .

text: For I know this , that after my departing shall grievous wolves enter in among you , not sparing the flock .
text2: Taani biidoogaappe guyyiyan , wudiyaassi qarettenna iita wanggireelloti intte giddo gelanaagaanne , kaalliyaageetakka bantta geeduwaa kaalettanau wordduwaa haasayiya asati intte giddoppe denddanaagaa erais .

text: Therefore watch , and remember , that by the space of three years I ceased not to warn every one night and day with tears .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , taani heezzu laittaa qamminne gallassi afuttan inttena huuphiyan huuphiyan minttettiyoogaa aggabeennaagaa qoppidi genccite .

text: And now , brethren , I commend you to God , and to the word of his grace , which is able to build you up , and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified .
text2: “ Ha77ikka inttena minttanaunne geeshsha asa ubbaa giddon laatissanau danddayiya Xoossaassinne a aaro kehatettaa qaalaassi inttena hadaraa immais .

text: I have coveted no man ' s silver , or gold , or apparel .
text2: “ Taani ooppenne bira woi worqqa woi afala amottabeikke ;

text: Yea , ye yourselves know , that these hands have ministered unto my necessities , and to them that were with me .
text2: taani ha ta kushiyan tananne tanaara issippe de7iyaageeta koshshidabaa oottidoogaa intte intte huuphen ereeta .

text: I have shewed you all things , how that so labouring ye ought to support the weak , and to remember the words of the Lord Jesus , how he said , It is more blessed to give than to receive .
text2: Intte hagaadan daafuridi oottiiddi , daafuranchchata maaddanaassinne Godaa Yesuusi ba huuphen , ' Ekkiyaagaappe immiyaagee anjjettidaagaa ' giidoogaadan , a qaalaa intte haasayanau bessiyoogaa taani ubban inttena bessaas ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he kneeled down , and prayed with them all .
text2: PHauloosi hegaa haasayi wurssidi , eta ubbaara issippe gulbbatidi , Xoossaa woossiis .

text: And they all wept sore , and fell on Paul ' s neck , and kissed him ,
text2: Eti ubbaikka PHauloosa qoommidi , yeekkiiddi yeridosona .

text: Sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake , that they should see his face no more . And they accompanied him unto the ship .
text2: Ubbaappe i , “ Tana naa77anttuwaa mulekka be7ekketa ” yaagido qaalai eta daro qarettiis ; qarettin markkabiyaa gakkanaassi a moissidosona .

text: And it came to pass , that after we were gotten from them , and had launched , we came with a straight course unto Coos , and the day following unto Rhodes , and from thence unto Patara :
text2: Nuuni Efisoona cimatuppe shaahettidi , sitti giidi Qoose yiida ; wonttetta gallassi Rooda gakkida ; hegaappe PHaaxira biida .

text: And finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia , we went aboard , and set forth .
text2: Biidi Pinqqe pinniya markkabiyaa demmidi , aani gelidi baanau denddida .

text: Now when we had discovered Cyprus , we left it on the left hand , and sailed into Syria , and landed at Tyre : for there the ship was to unlade her burden .
text2: Nuuni Qophphiroosappe be7anau danddayiyoosaa yiidi , arshsho xeelliyo wode Qophphiroosa haddirssa baggi yeggidi , Sooriyaa biida ; biidi Xiiroosa gakkida ; aissi giikko , markkabee ba caanaa Xiiroosan wottees .

text: And finding disciples , we tarried there seven days : who said to Paul through the Spirit , that he should not go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Yaani kaalliyaageeta demmidi , etaara laappun gallassaa uttida ; PHauloosi Yerusalaame beenna mala , eti au Ayyaanan yootidosona .

text: And when we had accomplished those days , we departed and went our way ; and they all brought us on our way , with wives and children , till we were out of the city : and we kneeled down on the shore , and prayed .
text2: Nuuni etaara uttiyo wodee wurin , kiyidi biida ; eti ubbati bantta maccaasatuuranne bantta naatuura issippe katamaappe gaxi kessana gakkanaas , nuna moissidosona ; moissin nuuni abbaa doonan gulbbatidi , Xoossaa woossida .

text: And when we had taken our leave one of another , we took ship ; and they returned home again .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , issoi issuwaa sarotidi , markkabiyan gelida ; etinne bantta soo simmidosona .

text: And when we had finished our course from Tyre , we came to Ptolemais , and saluted the brethren , and abode with them one day .
text2: Nuuni abbaa ogiyaa wurssidi , Xiiroosappe PHexelemaise gakkida ; ishantta sarotiiddi , eta matan issi gallassaa pe7ida .

text: And the next day we that were of Paul ' s company departed , and came unto Caesarea : and we entered into the house of Philip the evangelist , which was one of the seven ; and abode with him .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi kiyidi , Qiisaariyaa biida ; wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiya Piliphphoosa soo gakkidi , a matan uttida ; Yerusalaamen doorettida laappunatuppe i issuwaa .

text: And the same man had four daughters , virgins , which did prophesy .
text2: Piliphphoosassi hananabaa yootiya oiddu geela7o naati de7oosona .

text: And as we tarried there many days , there came down from Judaea a certain prophet , named Agabus .
text2: Nuuni unddenna gallassaa uttidaashin , hananabaa yootiya issi Agaaboosa giyo bitanee Yihudaappe Qiisaariyaa yiis .

text: And when he was come unto us , he took Paul ' s girdle , and bound his own hands and feet , and said , Thus saith the Holy Ghost , So shall the Jews at Jerusalem bind the man that owneth this girdle , and shall deliver him into the hands of the Gentiles .
text2: Nuukko yiidi , PHauloosa qabattuwaa ekkinnee ba kushiyaanne ba tohuwaa qachchidi , “ Geeshsha Ayyaanai giyoogee hagaa ; ha qabattuwaa godaa Yerusalaamen Aihudati hagaadan qachchidi , Aihuda gidenna asatussi aattidi immana ” yaagiis .

text: And when we heard these things , both we , and they of that place , besought him not to go up to Jerusalem .
text2: Nuuni hegaa siyido wode , nuuninne yaani de7iya asati PHauloosi Yerusalaame beenna mala woossida .

text: Then Paul answered , What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart ? for I am ready not to be bound only , but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus .
text2: SHin PHauloosi zaaridi , “ Intte yeekkiiddinne ta wozanaa qaretissiiddi waaneetii ? Taani Godaa Yesuusa sunttaa gishshau qashettanaagaa xalaala gidennan , harai atto Yerusalaamen haiqqanaukka giiga uttaas ” yaagiis .

text: And when he would not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , The will of the Lord be done .
text2: Zoriyaa i ekkennan ixxin , “ Godai giidoogee hano ” yaagidi co77u giida .

text: And after those days we took up our carriages , and went up to Jerusalem .
text2: Yaani amarida wodiyaa gam77idoogaappe guyyiyan , giigettidi Yerusalaame baanau kiyida .

text: There went with us also certain of the disciples of Caesarea , and brought with them one Mnason of Cyprus , an old disciple , with whom we should lodge .
text2: Qiisaariyan de7iya kaalliyaageetuppe amaridaageeti qassi nunaara biidosona ; eti nuuni aqanasaa Minaasoona giyo Qophphiroosa bitaniyaa soo nuna efiidosona ; Minaasooni daro wodiyaappe doommidi kaalliyaagaa .

text: And when we were come to Jerusalem , the brethren received us gladly .
text2: Nuuni Yerusalaame gakkido wode , ishantti nuna ufaissan mokkidosona .

text: And the day following Paul went in with us unto James ; and all the elders were present .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi , PHauloosinne nuuni Yaaqoobaara gaittanau biida . Woosa keettaa cimati ubbatikka de7oosona .

text: And when he had saluted them , he declared particularly what things God had wrought among the Gentiles by his ministry .
text2: PHauloosi eta sarotidoogaappe guyyiyan , Aihuda gidenna asaa giddon ba baggaara Xoossai oottidobaa etassi wurssidi yootiis .

text: And when they heard it , they glorified the Lord , and said unto him , Thou seest , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are which believe ; and they are all zealous of the law :
text2: Eti hegaa siyido wode Xoossaa galatidi , PHauloosa hagaadan yaagidosona ; “ Nu ishau , Aihudatu giddon Xoossaa ammanidaageetuppe aappun sha7ai de7iyaakko be7aasa ; eti ubbaikka higgiyaa mintti naagoosona .

text: And they are informed of thee , that thou teachest all the Jews which are among the Gentiles to forsake Moses , saying that they ought not to circumcise their children , neither to walk after the customs .
text2: Yerusalaame Aihudati , Aihuda gidennaageetu biittan de7iya Aihuda ubbati bantta naata qaxxarenna mala , woi Aihudatu meeziyaa kaallenna mala , Muuse higgiyaakka moorana mala neeni tamaarissiyoogaa siyidosona .

text: What is it therefore ? the multitude must needs come together : for they will hear that thou art come .
text2: Yaatin , aibi kehee ? Neeni yiidoogaa daroti siyiyo gishshau , shiiqennan aggokkona .

text: Do therefore this that we say to thee : We have four men which have a vow on them ;
text2: “ Hegaa gishshau , hagaa nuuni neessi yootiyoogaa ootta ; shiiqoi de7iyo oiddu asati nu matan de7oosona .

text: Them take , and purify thyself with them , and be at charges with them , that they may shave their heads : and all may know that those things , whereof they were informed concerning thee , are nothing ; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly , and keepest the law .
text2: Eta ekkada etaara geeya ; qassi eti bantta huuphiyaa meedettana mala , etassi miishsha imma ; eti ubbai nebaa siyidoogee tuma gidennaagaanne neeni ne huuphenkka qassi higgiyaa naagaidda maaran de7iyoogaa erana .

text: As touching the Gentiles which believe , we have written and concluded that they observe no such thing , save only that they keep themselves from things offered to idols , and from blood , and from strangled , and from fornication .
text2: “ SHin ammanida Aihuda gidenna asata gidikko , eti eeqassi yarshshidobaa meenna malanne suutta uyenna mala , sulettida mehe asho meenna malanne shaaramuxenna mala , nuuni yohuwaa qachchidi , etau dabddaabbiyaa xaafida ” yaagidosona .

text: Then Paul took the men , and the next day purifying himself with them entered into the temple , to signify the accomplishment of the days of purifcation , until that an offering should be offered for every one of them .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi wonttetta gallassi asata ekkidi , etaara geeyiis ; i bantta geeshshaa ai gallassi poliyaakko erissanaunne qassi yarshshuwaa huuphiyan huuphiyan aude immanaakko erissanau Beeta Maqidasiyaa geliis .

text: And when the seven days were almost ended , the Jews which were of Asia , when they saw him in the temple , stirred up all the people , and laid hands on him ,
text2: Laappun gallassai wurana hanishin , Isiyaappe yiida Aihudati Beeta Maqidasiyan PHauloosa be7idi , asa ubbaa hanqqetissidi , “ Israa7eela asau , nuna maaddite ; Israa7eela asaa , Muuse higgiyaanne ha Beeta Maqidasiyaa ixxidi , ubbasan asa ubbaa tamaarissiyaagee ha bitaniyaa ; gujjidi qassi Giriiketakka Beeta Maqidasiyaa gelissidi , ha geeshsha sohuwaa tunissiis ” yaagidi wocamiiddi , PHauloosa oiqqidosona .

text: ( For they had seen before with him in the city Trophimus an Ephesian , whom they supposed that Paul had brought into the temple . )
text2: Eti kase Efisoonan de7iya Xirofiimoosa PHauloosaara kataman be7ido gishshau , Beeta Maqidasiyaa PHauloosi a gelissidobaa etayyo milatiis .

text: And all the city was moved , and the people ran together : and they took Paul , and drew him out of the temple : and forthwith the doors were shut .
text2: Katama ubbai shabbirettiis ; asai ubbai shiiqidi PHauloosa oiqqidi , Beeta Maqidasiyaappe kare goochchiis ; sohuwaarakka Beeta Maqidasiyaa penggeti gorddetti aggidosona .

text: And as they went about to kill him , tidings came unto the chief captain of the band , that all Jerusalem was in an uproar .
text2: Asai PHauloosa worana hanishin , “ Yerusalaame katamai mulekka shabbirettiichchiis ” giyo odoi shaalaqaakko gakkiis .

text: Who immediately took soldiers and centurions , and ran down unto them : and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers , they left beating of Paul .
text2: Gakkin shaalaqai wotaaddaratanne mato halaqata issippe ekkidi , woxxiiddi asaa bolli kiyi wodhdhiis ; asai shaalaqaanne wotaaddarata be7ido wode , PHauloosa wadhdhiyoogaa aggi bayiis .

text: Then the chief captain came near , and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains ; and demanded who he was , and what he had done .
text2: He wode , shaalaqai shiiqidi , PHauloosa oiqqidi , naa77u sanssalatan qashettana mala azazidi , i oonakkonne qassi ai oottidaakkonne asaa oichchiis .

text: And some cried one thing , some another , among the multitude : and when he could not know the certainty for the tumult , he commanded him to be carried into the castle .
text2: Asaappe baggai issibaa wocamiyo wode , baggai harabaa wocamees ; wocamai darido gishshau , shaalaqaassi tumaa eranau danddayettennan ixxin , wotaaddarati PHauloosa bantta de7iyoosaa efaana mala , eta azaziis .

text: And when he came upon the stairs , so it was , that he was borne of the soldiers for the violence of the people .
text2: Yedhdhidi kiyiyoosaa PHauloosi gakkido wode , asaa sugettaa gishshau , wotaaddarati a tookkidosona .

text: For the multitude of the people followed after , crying , Away with him .
text2: Aissi giikko , daro asai , “ A wora ! ” yaagiiddinne wocamiiddi kaallees .

text: And as Paul was to be led into the castle , he said unto the chief captain , May I speak unto thee ? Who said , Canst thou speak Greek ?
text2: Wotaaddarati PHauloosa bantta de7iyoosaa efaana hanishin PHauloosi shaalaqaa , “ Taani neessi issibaa odoo ? ” yaagiis . Yaagin shaalaqai PHauloosa , “ Neeni Giriike qaalaa erai ?

text: Art not thou that Egyptian , which before these days madest an uproar , and leddest out into the wilderness four thousand men that were murderers ?
text2: Neeni hagaappe kase wode , ooshshaa kessada shemppo woridaageetuppe oiddu sha7u asata bazzo kaalettida Gibxxe bitaniyaa gidikkii ? ” yaagiis .

text: But Paul said , I am a man which am a Jew of Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , a citizen of no mean city : and , I beseech thee , suffer me to speak unto the people .
text2: SHin PHauloosi , “ Taani Aihuda asa ; qassi Kilqqiyan de7iya Xarsseesen yelettida waanna kataman de7iya asa . Hayyanaa tana asaassi haasayissarkkii ? ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had given him licence , Paul stood on the stairs , and beckoned with the hand unto the people . And when there was made a great silence , he spake unto them in the Hebrew tongue , saying ,
text2: SHaalaqai a , “ Haasaya ” yaagin , PHauloosi yedhdhidi kiyiyoosan eqqidi , asai co77u gaana mala , ba kushiyan asaakko malaatiis . Asai co77u gin , Ibraisxxe qaalan haasayiiddi , hagaadan yaagiis .

text: Men , brethren , and fathers , hear ye my defence which I make now unto you .
text2: “ Ta ishatoo , ta aawatoo , taani ha77i inttessi yootiyo yohuwaa siyite ”

text: ( And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them , they kept the more silence : and he saith , )
text2: PHauloosi etassi Ibraisxxe qaalan haasayiyoogaa siyidi , kaseppe keehi co77u giidosona . Gin i hagaadan yaagiis .

text: I am verily a man which am a Jew , born in Tarsus , a city in Cilicia , yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel , and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers , and was zealous toward God , as ye all are this day .
text2: “ Taani Kilqqiyan de7iya Xarsseesen yelettada , ha kataman Gamaaliyaali tana tamaarissin diccada , nu aawatu higgiyaakka mintta tamaarada , hachchi intte ubbai haniyoogaadankka , taani Xoossaa yohuwaassi mishettiya Aihuda asa .

text: And I persecuted this way unto the death , binding and delivering into prisons both men and women .
text2: Taani maccaasaa attumaasaa oiqqa oiqqada qasho keettan yeggida asanne , ha ogiyaa kaalliya asaa worissana gakkanaas tuggayida asa .

text: As also the high priest doth bear me witness , and all the estate of the elders : from whom also I received letters unto the brethren , and went to Damascus , to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem , for to be punished .
text2: Hegaadankka , qassi , qeese ubbatu halaqainne cima ubbaa yaa7ai tabaa markkattanau danddayees ; taani Damasqqon de7iya eta ishanttussi Aihudatussi , etappe dabddaabbiyaa ekkada , hegan de7iya asati qashettidi qaxxayettanaadan , Yerusalaame eta ehaanau yaa baas .

text: And it came to pass , that , as I made my journey , and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon , suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me .
text2: “ Taani baada Damasqqo matido wode , seeta gallassa gidishin , qoppennan saluwaappe gita poo7oi ta matan yuuyi aadhdhidi poo7iis .

text: And I fell unto the ground , and heard a voice saying unto me , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ?
text2: Taani sa7an kundda uttada , ' Saa7oolaa , Saa7oolaa , tana aissi waissai ? ' giya qaalaa siyaas .

text: And I answered , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said unto me , I am Jesus of Nazareth , whom thou persecutest .
text2: “ Taani zaarada , ' Ta Godau , neeni oonee ? ' yaagaas . “ Yaagin , ' Taani neeni waissiyo Naazireeta Yesuusa ' yaagiis .

text: And they that were with me saw indeed the light , and were afraid ; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me .
text2: Tanaara issippe de7iyaageeti poo7uwaa be7idi yayyidosona ; shin taassi haasayiyaagaa qaalaa siyibookkona .

text: And I said , What shall I do , Lord ? And the Lord said unto me , Arise , and go into Damascus ; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do .
text2: “ ' Ta Godau , taani ai oottoo ? ' yaagaas . “ Godai tana , ' Denddada Damasqqo ba . Neeni oottanau Xoossai qoppido ubbabai neeyyo yaani odettana ' yaagiis .

text: And when I could not see for the glory of that light , being led by the hand of them that were with me , I came into Damascus .
text2: He wolqqaama poo7uwaa gishshau , ta aifee qooqin , tanaara de7iya asati ta kushiyaa oiqqidi , tana goochchin , Damasqqo gakkaas .

text: And one Ananias , a devout man according to the law , having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there ,
text2: “ Damasqqon de7iya Aihuda ubbai daro bonchchiyo issi Hanaaniyaa giyo bitanee , nu higgiyaassi azazettidi , Xoossaa minttidi woossiyaagee de7ees .

text: Came unto me , and stood , and said unto me , Brother Saul , receive thy sight . And the same hour I looked up upon him .
text2: Hanaanee taakko yiidi , ta matan eqqidi tana , ' Ta ishau Saa7oolaa , xeella ' yaagiis . Taanne he wode sohuwaarakka akko xeella aggaas .

text: And he said , The God of our fathers hath chosen thee , that thou shouldest know his will , and see that Just One , and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth .
text2: “ Xeellin i tana hagaadan yaagiis ; ' Nu aawatu Godai neeni a qofaa eranau , a xillo Na7aa be7anaunne a doonaappekka haasayaa siyanau nena kase dooriis .

text: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard .
text2: Aissi giikko , neeni be7idobaanne siyidobaa asa ubbaa sinttan ayyo markkattana .

text: And now why tarriest thou ? arise , and be baptized , and wash away thy sins , calling on the name of the Lord .
text2: Ha77ikka aissi gam77ai ? Denddada xammaqetta ; a sunttaa xeesaidda , ne nagaraappekka meecetta ' yaagiis .

text: And it came to pass , that , when I was come again to Jerusalem , even while I prayed in the temple , I was in a trance ;
text2: “ Taani guyye Yerusalaame simmada Beeta Maqidasiyan woossishin , taassi ajjuutai beettiis .

text: And saw him saying unto me , Make haste , and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem : for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me .
text2: Ajjuutan Godai tana , ' Eesotada , Yerusalaame elle kiya ; aissi giikko , neeni taassi hagan markkattiyoogaa asai ekkenna ' yaagishin taani a be7aas .

text: And I said , Lord , they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee :
text2: “ Taani , ' Ta Godau , Aihuda woosa keetta ubban nena ammaniyaageeta oiqqada wadhdhidoogaanne qasho keettan yeggidoogaa eti eroosona .

text: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed , I also was standing by , and consenting unto his death , and kept the raiment of them that slew him .
text2: Eti ne markkaa Isxxifaanoosa woriyo wode , taani he yohuwaa maayaas . Qassi eta lanqqiyan eqqada , a woriyaageetu maayuwaa naagais ' yaagaas .

text: And he said unto me , Depart : for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles .
text2: “ Godai tana , ' Taani nena Aihuda gidenna asaakko haahosaa kiittiyo gishshau ba ' yaagiis ” yaagiis .

text: And they gave him audience unto this word , and then lifted up their voices , and said , Away with such a fellow from the earth : for it is not fit that he should live .
