text2: PHauloosi he qaalaa haasayana gakkanaassi asai i giyoogaa ezggees ; hegaappe guyyiyan , bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , “ Hagaa biittaappe xaissa ; i de7anau bessenna ” yaagidosona .

text: And as they cried out , and cast off their clothes , and threw dust into the air ,
text2: Eti wocamishin , bantta maayuwaa bollau olishiininne baanaa carkkuwan laalishin , shaalaqai wotaaddarati PHauloosa bantta de7iyoosaa efaana mala azaziis . Qassi asai aissi hegaadan wocamidaakko eranau , PHauloosa lissuwan garafiiddi qorana mala , eta azaziis .

text: And as they bound him with thongs , Paul said unto the centurion that stood by , Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman , and uncondemned ?
text2: SHin wotaaddarati PHauloosa dafuwan mintti qachchido wode , PHauloosi ba matan eqqida mato halaqaa , “ Roome katamaa asa pirddi bainnan wadhdhiyoogee inttessi higgee ? ” yaagiis .

text: When the centurion heard that , he went and told the chief captain , saying , Take heed what thou doest : for this man is a Roman .
text2: Hegaa mato halaqai siyido wode , shaalaqaakko biidi , “ Ha bitanee Roome asa . Neeni ai oottana qoppai ? ” yaagidi oichchiis .

text: Then the chief captain came , and said unto him , Tell me , art thou a Roman ? He said , Yea .
text2: SHaalaqai PHauloosakko shiiqidi , “ Neeni Roome asee ? Tau yoota ” yaagiis . Yaagin PHauloosi , “ Ee ” yaagiis .

text: And the chief captain answered , With a great sum obtained I this freedom . And Paul said , But I was free born .
text2: SHaalaqai PHauloosassi zaaridi , “ Taani ha zaretettaa daro miishshan shammaas ” yaagiis . SHin PHauloosi , “ Taani he zerettaappe yelettaas ” yaagiis .

text: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him : and the chief captain also was afraid , after he knew that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , PHauloosa qoranau qoppidaageeti sohuwaara appe shaahetti aggidosona . SHaalaqaikka PHauloosi Roome asa gididoogaa erido wode yayyiis ; aissi giikko , sanssalatan a qashissi wottiis .

text: On the morrow , because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews , he loosed him from his bands , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear , and brought Paul down , and set him before them .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi shaalaqai , Aihudati PHauloosa aissi mootidaakkonne geeshshidi eranau koyidi , PHauloosa birshshiis . Birshshidi qeese halaqatinne yaa7ai ubbai shiiqana mala azaziis ; qassi PHauloosa duge wottidi , eta sinttan essiis .

text: And Paul , earnestly beholding the council , said , Men and brethren , I have lived in all good conscience before God until this day .
text2: PHauloosi yaa7aa tishshi ootti xeellidi , “ Ta ishatoo , taani hachchi gakkanaassikka Xoossaa sinttan ta de7o ubban lo77o zoriya wozanan de7aas ” yaagiis .

text: And the high priest Ananias commanded them that stood by him to smite him on the mouth .
text2: Qeese ubbatu halaqai Hanaanee , PHauloosa doonaa baqqana mala , a matan eqqidaageeta azaziis .

text: Then said Paul unto him , God shall smite thee , thou whited wall : for sittest thou to judge me after the law , and commandest me to be smitten contrary to the law ?
text2: PHauloosi he wode a , “ Laa ha aannuwan tiyido godau , Xoossaikka nena baqqana . Neeni ta bolli higgiyan pirddanau uttada , higgee bainnan tana baqqana mala azazai ? ” yaagiis .

text: And they that stood by said , Revilest thou God ' s high priest ?
text2: PHauloosa matan eqqidaageeti a , “ Neeni Xoossaa qeese ubbatu halaqaa cayai ? ” yaagidosona .

text: Then said Paul , I wist not , brethren , that he was the high priest : for it is written , Thou shalt not speak evil of the ruler of thy people .
text2: Yaagin PHauloosi , “ Ta ishatoo , i qeese ubbatu halaqa gididoogaa taani erabeikke ; aissi giikko , ' Ne deriyaa haariyaagaa bolli iita qaalaa haasayoppa ' geetettidi Xoossaa maxaafan xaafettiis ” yaagiis .

text: But when Paul perceived that the one part were Sadducees , and the other Pharisees , he cried out in the council , Men and brethren , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee : of the hope and resurrection of the dead I am called in question .
text2: SHin PHauloosi baggati Saaduqaaweta ; baggati Parisaaweta gididoogaa be7idi , “ Ta ishatoo , taani Parisaawenne Parisaawiyaa na7aa ; ' Haiqqidaageeti haiquwaappe denddana ' gaada taani ufaissan naagiyo gishshau , eti ta bolli pirddoosona ” yaagidi , xoqqu oottidi haasayiis .

text: And when he had so said , there arose a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees : and the multitude was divided .
text2: PHauloosi hegaa yaagin , Parisaawetu giddooninne Saaduqaawetu giddon ooshshai kiyin , yaa7ai laalettiis .

text: For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , neither angel , nor spirit : but the Pharisees confess both .
text2: Aissi giikko , Saaduqaaweti , “ Haiqqida asai denddenna ; kiitanchchikka ayyaanikka baawa ” yaagoosona ; Parisaaweti qassi naa77aikka de7iyoogaa ammanoosona .

text: And there arose a great cry : and the scribes that were of the Pharisees ' part arose , and strove , saying , We find no evil in this man : but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him , let us not fight against God .
text2: Gita wocamai denddiis ; Parisaawetu baggappe higgiyaa tamaarissiyaageeti denddi eqqidi , “ Ha bitaniyaa bolli ainne bala demmibookko ; ayyo ayyaani woi kiitanchchi haasayennan aggenna ” yaagidi palamettidosona .

text: And when there arose a great dissension , the chief captain , fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them , commanded the soldiers to go down , and to take him by force from among them , and to bring him into the castle .
text2: Ooshshai darin , shaalaqai PHauloosa eti mentterettanaakkonne giidi yayyidi , ba wotaaddarati wodhdhidi , eta giddoppe a eesuwan kessidi , bantta de7iyoosaa efaana mala azaziis .

text: And the night following the Lord stood by him , and said , Be of good cheer , Paul : for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem , so must thou bear witness also at Rome .
text2: Naa77antto qammi Godai PHauloosa lanqqiyan eqqidi , “ PHauloosaa , neeni taassi Yerusalaamen markkattidoogaadan , Roomenkka markkattanau bessees ; minna ; aikko baawa ” yaagiis .

text: And when it was day , certain of the Jews banded together , and bound themselves under a curse , saying that they would neither eat nor drink till they had killed Paul .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi , Aihudati PHauloosa worana gakkanaas , meennaadaaninne uyennaadan , caaqettidi giigettidosona .

text: And they were more than forty which had made this conspiracy .
text2: PHauloosa bolli hegaa maqqida asati oitamaappe daroosona .

text: And they came to the chief priests and elders , and said , We have bound ourselves under a great curse , that we will eat nothing until we have slain Paul .
text2: Eti qeese halaqatukkonne cimatukko yiidi , “ Nuuni PHauloosa worana gakkanaas , ainne baarennaadan , qanggettidi caaqettida .

text: Now therefore ye with the council signify to the chief captain that he bring him down unto you to morrow , as though ye would inquire something more perfectly concerning him : and we , or ever he come near , are ready to kill him .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , inttenne yaa7ai PHauloosabaa geeshshidi qoriyaabaa misatidi , shaalaqai a inttekko duge wottana mala oichchite ; nuuni i haa shiiqanaappe kase a woranau giigi uttida ” yaagidosona .

text: And when Paul ' s sister ' s son heard of their lying in wait , he went and entered into the castle , and told Paul .
text2: SHin PHauloosa michchee na7ai he maqquwaa siyido wode , biidi wotaaddarati de7iyoosaa gelidi , PHauloosassi yootiis .

text: Then Paul called one of the centurions unto him , and said , Bring this young man unto the chief captain : for he hath a certain thing to tell him .
text2: Yootin PHauloosi mato halaqatuppe issuwaa xeesidi , “ Ha na7aa shaalaqaakko efa ; aissi giikko , shaalaqaassi i yootiyoobai de7ees ” yaagiis .

text: So he took him , and brought him to the chief captain , and said , Paul the prisoner called me unto him , and prayed me to bring this young man unto thee , who hath something to say unto thee .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , mato halaqai na7aa shaalaqaakko efiidi , “ Qasho keettan de7iya PHauloosi , ha na7ai neessi aibakko odiyoobai de7iyo gishshau , tana baakko xeesidi , a neekko ehaanaadan , tana woossiis ” yaagiis .

text: Then the chief captain took him by the hand , and went with him aside privately , and asked him , What is that thou hast to tell me ?
text2: SHaalaqai na7aa kushiyaa oiqqidi , dumma gaxi kessidi , “ Neeni taassi odanabai aibee ? ” yaagidi oichchiis .

text: And he said , The Jews have agreed to desire thee that thou wouldest bring down Paul to morrow into the council , as though they would inquire somewhat of him more perfectly .
text2: Na7ai shaalaqaassi , “ Aihudati PHauloosabaa kaseppe mintti oichchiyaabaa milatidi , neeni yaa7aa a wottanaadan , nena wontto woossanau zoretaa qachchidosona .

text: But do not thou yield unto them : for there lie in wait for him of them more than forty men , which have bound themselves with an oath , that they will neither eat nor drink till they have killed him : and now are they ready , looking for a promise from thee .
text2: SHin neeni eti giyoobaa siyoppa ; aissi giikko , oitamaappe dariya asati PHauloosa worana gakkanaas , quma meennaadaaninne haatta uyennaadan , caaqettidi geemetti uttidi a naagoosona ; neeni giyoobaa siyanau ha77ikka giigetti uttidi naagoosona ” yaagiis .

text: So the chief captain then let the young man depart , and charged him , See thou tell no man that thou hast shewed these things to me .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , shaalaqai na7aa , “ Ha yohuwaa neeni tana erissidoogaa oossinne odoppa ” yaagidi azazidoogaappe guyyiyan , a yeddiis .

text: And he called unto him two centurions , saying , Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea , and horsemen threescore and ten , and spearmen two hundred , at the third hour of the night ;
text2: SHaalaqai mato halaqatuppe naa77aa xeesidi , “ Qiisaariyaa baanau , naa77u xeetu wotaaddarata , laappun tammu paraasatanne naa77u xeetu tooraasata qammaappe heezzu saatiyan giigissite ;

text: And provide them beasts , that they may set Paul on , and bring him safe unto Felix the governor .
text2: deriyaa haariya Pilikisakko PHauloosa saro gattanau togissiyo mehenne giigissite ” yaagidi , eta azaziis .

text: And he wrote a letter after this manner :
text2: SHaalaqai Pilikisassi hagaadan giya dabddaabbiyaa xaafiis .

text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting .
text2: “ Qalaudeyoosa Lusiyoosappe deriyaa haariyaagaassi , bonchcho Pilikisassi , sarotettai neessi gido .

text: This man was taken of the Jews , and should have been killed of them : then came I with an army , and rescued him , having understood that he was a Roman .
text2: Aihudati ha bitaniyaa oiqqidi worana hanishin , Roome katamaa asa i gididoogaa erada , wotaaddaratuura gakkada a ashshaas .

text: And when I would have known the cause wherefore they accused him , I brought him forth into their council :
text2: Eti a aissi mootiyaakko eranau koyada , eta yaa7aassi duge a wottaas .

text: Whom I perceived to be accused of questions of their law , but to have nothing laid to his charge worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: Eti bantta higgiyaabaa i oichchidoogaassi a mootidoogaappe attin , a worissiya woi qashissiya mooto gidenna .

text: And when it was told me how that the Jews laid wait for the man , I sent straightway to thee , and gave commandment to his accusers also to say before thee what they had against him . Farewell .
text2: Eti ha bitaniyaa bolli maqetti uttido zigirssai tana gakkin , taani he sohuwaara a neekko yedda aggaas ; a mootiyaageetikka biidi , ne sinttan mootana mala azazaas ; saro de7a ” yaagiis .

text: Then the soldiers , as it was commanded them , took Paul , and brought him by night to Antipatris .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , wotaaddarati azazettidoogaadankka PHauloosa ekkidi , qammi Anttiphaaxiriisa gattidosona .

text: On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him , and returned to the castle :
text2: Wonttetta gallassi aara baanau paraasata wottidi , tohuwaasati guyye wotaaddarati de7iyoosaa simmidosona .

text: Who , when they came to Caesarea , and delivered the epistle to the governor , presented Paul also before him .
text2: Paraasati Qiisaariyaa gelidi , dabddaabbiyaa deriyaa haariyaagaassi immidi , PHauloosa a sintti aattidosona .

text: And when the governor had read the letter , he asked of what province he was . And when he understood that he was of Cilicia ;
text2: Deriyaa haariyaagee dabddaabbiyaa nabbabidoogaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi awa auraajjaa asakko a oichchiis ; Kilqqiyaa asa i gididoogaa erido wode ,

text: I will hear thee , said he , when thine accusers are also come . And he commanded him to be kept in Herod ' s judgment hall .
text2: “ Taani nebaa nena mootiyaageeti yiyo wode siyana ” yaagidi , wotaaddarati Heeroodisa keettan a naagana mala azaziis .

text: And after five days Ananias the high priest descended with the elders , and with a certain orator named Tertullus , who informed the governor against Paul .
text2: Ichchashu gallassappe guyyiyan , qeese ubbatu halaqai , Hanaaniyaa , cimatuuranne Xarxxaluusa giyo issi xabaqaara duge Qiisaariyaa wodhdhiis ; eti deriyaa haariyaagaa bolli PHauloosa mootidosona .

text: And when he was called forth , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , Seeing that by thee we enjoy great quietness , and that very worthy deeds are done unto this nation by thy providence ,
text2: PHauloosi xeesettido wode , Xarxxaluusi a hagaadan yaagidi , mootuwaa doommiis . “ Bonchcho Pilikisaa , nuuni ne baggaara daro sarotettaa demmidaashin , ne qofan ha deriyaassi ubbaban ubbasankka lo77o laamee beettiyaagaassi nena daro galatidi , hagaa ekkoos .

text: Notwithstanding , that I be not further tedious unto thee , I pray thee that thou wouldest hear us of thy clemency a few words .
text2: SHin taani nena gam77ettennan , ne kehatettan nubaa neeni qanttan siyana mala , nena woossais .

text: For we have found this man a pestilent fellow , and a mover of sedition among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes :
text2: Aissi giikko , ha bitanee xube gididi , sa7a ubban de7iya Aihudatu giddon ooshsha denttiiddi , Naaziraawetu bagga asaa kaalettiyaagaa gididoogaa erida .

text: Who also hath gone about to profane the temple : whom we took , and would have judged according to our law .
text2: Harai atto Beeta Maqidasiyaakka tunissanau koyishin a oiqqidi , nu higgiyaadan , a bolli pirddanau qoppida ;

text: But the chief captain Lysias came upon us , and with great violence took him away out of our hands ,
text2: shin shaalaqaa Lusiyoosi yiidi , wolqqan nu kushiyaappe a wotti ekkiis .

text: Commanding his accusers to come unto thee : by examining of whom thyself mayest take knowledge of all these things , whereof we accuse him .
text2: A mootiyaageetikka neekko yaana mala azaziis ; neeni ne huuphen ha bitaniyaa qorada , nuuni a mootiyo yoho ubbaa eranau danddayaasa ” yaagiis .

text: And the Jews also assented , saying that these things were so .
text2: Aihudatikka qassi , “ Ha yohoi tuma ” giidi , a qofaa maayidosona .

text: Then Paul , after that the governor had beckoned unto him to speak , answered , Forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of many years a judge unto this nation , I do the more cheerfully answer for myself :
text2: Deriyaa haariyaagee PHauloosa oichchin , i hagaadan yaagidi zaariis ; “ Neeni daro wodiyaasappe doommada , ha asaassi pirddaidda de7iyoogaa taani erada , ta yohuwaa ufaissan zaarais .

text: Because that thou mayest understand , that there are yet but twelve days since I went up to Jerusalem for to worship .
text2: Taani Yerusalaame goinnanau kiyoosappe tammanne naa77u gallassappe darennaagaa neeni ne huuphen erana danddayaasa .

text: And they neither found me in the temple disputing with any man , neither raising up the people , neither in the synagogues , nor in the city :
text2: Aihudati tana Beeta Maqidasiyan gidin , Aihuda woosa keettan gidin , kataman gidin , oonaaranne palamettishin woi asa shiishshada maqqishin , issi uraaranne be7ibookkona .

text: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me .
text2: Eti ha77ikka tana mootiyoobaa shatimmanau danddayokkona .

text: But this I confess unto thee , that after the way which they call heresy , so worship I the God of my fathers , believing all things which are written in the law and in the prophets :
text2: “ SHin taani hagaa neessi yootais ; taani higgiyan de7iyaabaanne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafido ubbabaa ammanada , nu aawatu Xoossaassi eti worddo giyo ogiyan goinnais .

text: And have hope toward God , which they themselves also allow , that there shall be a resurrection of the dead , both of the just and unjust .
text2: Hageeti bantta huuphen , ' Asai ubbai , worddoikka xilloikka haiquwaappe denddana ' giyoogaadan , taanikka eti denddanaagaassi Xoossaa ammanais .

text: And herein do I exercise myself , to have always a conscience void of offence toward God , and toward men .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , taani qassi , Xoossaa sinttaaninne asaa sinttan ubba wode , pokkoi bainna zoriya wozanai taassi de7ana mala minnais .

text: Now after many years I came to bring alms to my nation , and offerings .
text2: “ Taani Yerusalaameppe kiyoosappe daro laittaappe guyyiyan , ta biittaa hiyyeesaassi miishsha immanaunne yarshshuwaa yarshshanau Yerusalaame baas .

text: Whereupon certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple , neither with multitude , nor with tumult .
text2: Baada hegaa oottishin , asi shiiqennan , ooshshi denddennan , taani Beeta Maqidasiyan geeyishin , eti tana demmidosona .

text: Who ought to have been here before thee , and object , if they had ought against me .
text2: SHin Isiyaappe yiida issi issi Aihudati hegan de7oosona ; eti ta bolli yoho koyikko , yiidi tana nenan mootanau bessees .

text: Or else let these same here say , if they have found any evil doing in me , while I stood before the council ,
text2: Woi taani eta giddon eqqada , ' Haiqqidaageeti denddanaagaa ammaniyo gishshau , hachchi intte sinttan ta bolli pirddoosona ' gaada ha xoqqissada haasayido issi qaaleeppe attin , yaa7aa sinttan eqqidaashin , tanan issi mooro demmidobaa gidikko , hageeti bantta huuphen hagan yootona ” yaagiis .

text: And when Felix heard these things , having more perfect knowledge of that way , he deferred them , and said , When Lysias the chief captain shall come down , I will know the uttermost of your matter .
text2: SHin Pilikisi Xoossaa ogiyaabaa geeshshi erido gishshau , “ Taani intte yohuwaa shaalaqaa Lusiyoosi yiyo wode qachchana ” yaagidi , pirddiyo wodiyaa sinttau keeriis .

text: And he commanded a centurion to keep Paul , and to let him have liberty , and that he should forbid none of his acquaintance to minister or come unto him .
text2: Pilikisi qassi PHauloosa qachchennan naagana malanne a dabbotuppe ooninne ayyo oottishin , woi akko yiishin diggenna mala , mato halaqaa azaziis .

text: And after certain days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , which was a Jewess , he sent for Paul , and heard him concerning the faith in Christ .
text2: Amarida gallassaappe guyyiyan , Pilikisi Aihuda zare gidida ba maccaasee Dirusilliira yiidi , PHauloosa kiitti ehiissidi , Yesuus Kiristtoosan ammaniyoobaa i haasayishin siyiis .

text: And as he reasoned of righteousness , temperance , and judgment to come Felix trembled , and answered , Go thy way for this time ; when I have a convenient season , I will call for thee .
text2: PHauloosi xillotettaabaa , ba huuphe naaguwaabaanne yaana pirddaabaa haasayishin , Pilikisi yayyidi , “ Neeni ha77issau ba ; taassi injjetido wode , nena kiittada xeegissana ” yaagiis .

text: He hoped also that money should have been given him of Paul , that he might loose him : wherefore he sent for him the oftener , and communed with him .
text2: He wode qassi PHauloosi birshshettanau , baassi mattaayiyaa immanddeeshsha giidi qoppiis ; hegaa gishshau , darotoo a ehiissi ehiissidi , aara haasayees .

text: But after two years Porcius Festus came into Felix ' room : and Felix , willing to shew the Jews a pleasure , left Paul bound .
text2: Naa77u laitta kumidoogaappe guyyiyan , Pilikisa sohuwaa PHorqqiyoosa Pisxxoosi ekkiis . Pilikisi Aihudata ufaissanau koyidi , qasho keettan PHauloosa aggi bayiis .

text: Now when Festus was come into the province , after three days he ascended from Caesarea to Jerusalem .
text2: Pisxxoosi auraajjaa gelido heezzantto gallassaappe guyyiyan , Qiisaariyaappe Yerusalaame biis .

text: Then the high priest and the chief of the Jews informed him against Paul , and besought him ,
text2: Yaani qeese halaqatinne Aihudata kaalettiyaageeti PHauloosa mootidosona .

text: And desired favour against him , that he would send for him to Jerusalem , laying wait in the way to kill him .
text2: Eti PHauloosa woranaassi ogiyan qosetti uttanau , banttana maaddidi a Yerusalaame ehaana mala , Pisxxoosa woossidosona .

text: But Festus answered , that Paul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself would depart shortly thither .
text2: Woossin Pisxxoosi etassi , “ PHauloosi Qiisaariyan qashetti uttiis ; taani ta huuphenkka eesuwan yaa guyye simmanau qoppa uttaas .

text: Let them therefore , said he , which among you are able , go down with me , and accuse this man , if there be any wickedness in him .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , i aibakko mooridobai de7ikko , intte giddon aawatiyaageeti tanaara Qiisaariyaa biidi , a mootona ” yaagidi zaariis .

text: And when he had tarried among them more than ten days , he went down unto Caesarea ; and the next day sitting on the judgment seat commanded Paul to be brought .
text2: Pisxxoosi eta matan hosppun woi tammu gallassappe aattennan uttidi , Qiisaariyaa biis ; wonttetta gallassi pirddiyoosan uttidi , PHauloosa ehaana mala azaziis .

text: And when he was come , the Jews which came down from Jerusalem stood round about , and laid many and grievous complaints against Paul , which they could not prove .
text2: I gakkido wode , Yerusalaameppe yiida Aihudati a lanqqiyan yuuyi aadhdhi eqqidi , banttassi shatimmanau danddayettenna daro deexo mootuwaa a bolli wottidosona .

text: While he answered for himself , Neither against the law of the Jews , neither against the temple , nor yet against Caesar , have I offended any thing at all .
text2: PHauloosi mootettiiddi , “ Taani Aihudatu higgiyaakka Beeta Maqidasiyaakka Roome Kawuwaa Qeesaarakka ainne naaqqabeikke ” yaagiis .

text: But Festus , willing to do the Jews a pleasure , answered Paul , and said , Wilt thou go up to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these things before me ?
text2: SHin Pisxxoosi Aihudata ufaissanau koyidi PHauloosa , “ Pude Yerusalaame kiyada , ha yohuwaabaa yaani ta sinttan pirddettanau koyai ? ” yaagidi oichchiis .

text: Then said Paul , I stand at Caesar ' s judgment seat , where I ought to be judged : to the Jews have I done no wrong , as thou very well knowest .
text2: SHin PHauloosi , “ Taani pirddettanau bessiyo Qeesaara pirdda keettan eqqaichchaas . Neenikka loitta eriyoogaadan , taani Aihudata ainne naaqqabeikke .

text: For if I be an offender , or have committed any thing worthy of death , I refuse not to die : but if there be none of these things whereof these accuse me , no man may deliver me unto them . I appeal unto Caesar .
text2: Simmi taani naaqqidobaa woi haiqossi bessiyaabaa oottidobaa gidikko , haiquwaappe attana giikke ; shin eti tana mootiyo mootoi mela gididoogaappe hini baggan , ooninne tana etassi aattidi immanau danddayenna ; Qeesaari tabaa pirddo gaada oichchais ” yaagiis .

text: Then Festus , when he had conferred with the council , answered , Hast thou appealed unto Caesar ? unto Caesar shalt thou go .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , Pisxxoosi banaara zorettiyaageetuura zorettidi a , “ Neeni Qeesaari tabaa pirddo gaada oichchadasa ; Qeesaarakko baasa ” yaagidi zaariis .

text: And after certain days king Agrippa and Bernice came unto Caesarea to salute Festus .
text2: Amarida gallassaappe guyyiyan , Kawoi Agriiphphinne Barnniiqi Pisxxoosa sarotanau Qiisaariyaa biidosona .

text: And when they had been there many days , Festus declared Paul ' s cause unto the king , saying , There is a certain man left in bonds by Felix :
text2: Yaani eti daro gallassaa uttidaashin , Pisxxoosi kawuwaassi PHauloosabaa hagaadan yaagidi yootiis ; “ Hagan Pilikisi qachchidi aggi bayido issi bitanee de7ees .

text: About whom , when I was at Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me , desiring to have judgment against him .
text2: Taani Yerusalaamen de7ishin , qeese halaqatinne Aihuda cimati a bolli pirddana mala , tana woossiiddi , abaa taassi yootidosona .

text: To whom I answered , It is not the manner of the Romans to deliver any man to die , before that he which is accused have the accusers face to face , and have licence to answer for himself concerning the crime laid against him .
text2: Taani , ' Mootettida urai bana mootiyaageetuura issippe eqqennaaninne bana mootido yohuwaassi zaaro immennan , oona gidikkonne aattidi immiyoogee Roome asaassi woga gidenna ' yaagada etassi zaaraas .

text: Therefore , when they were come hither , without any delay on the morrow I sat on the judgment seat , and commanded the man to be brought forth .
text2: “ Hegaa gishshau , eti hagan shiiqido wode , taani gam77ennan wonttetta gallassi , pirdda keettaa gelada PHauloosa ehaana mala azazaas .

text: Against whom when the accusers stood up , they brought none accusation of such things as I supposed :
text2: A mootiyaageeti eqqidi , iitaban a mootennan aggokkona gaada taani qoppidoogaadan , ainne a mootibookkona .

text: But had certain questions against him of their own superstition , and of one Jesus , which was dead , whom Paul affirmed to be alive .
text2: SHin eti bantta ammanobaanne PHauloosi , ' Paxa de7ees ' giyo haiqqida issi Yesuusa geetettiya bitaniyaabaa aara palamettoosona .

text: And because I doubted of such manner of questions , I asked him whether he would go to Jerusalem , and there be judged of these matters .
text2: Taani ha yohuwaa waatada qoranaakko , qachchabeennan de7aidda , PHauloosi Yerusalaame biidi , ha yohuwaa yaani pirddettanau koyiyaakkonne gaada a oichchaas ;

text: But when Paul had appealed to be reserved unto the hearing of Augustus , I commanded him to be kept till I might send him to Caesar .
text2: shin PHauloosi ba yohuwaa Augisxxoos Qeesaari qachchana gakkanaassi naagettanau oichchin , taani a Qeesaarakko yeddana gakkanaas , i qashettana mala azazaas ” yaagiis .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Festus , I would also hear the man myself . To morrow , said he , thou shalt hear him .
text2: Yaagin Agriiphphi Pisxxoosa , “ Taani ta huuphenkka qassi he bitanee giyoobaa siyana koyais ” yaagiis . Pisxxoosi a , “ Neeni wontto i giyoobaa siyana ” yaagiis .

text: And on the morrow , when Agrippa was come , and Bernice , with great pomp , and was entered into the place of hearing , with the chief captains , and principal men of the city , at Festus ' commandment Paul was brought forth .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi , Agriiphphinne Barnniiqa daro bonchchuwan shaalaqatuuranne kataman de7iya gita asaara yiidi , pirdda keettaa gelidosona ; Pisxxoosi PHauloosa ehaana mala azazin ehiidosona .

text: And Festus said , King Agrippa , and all men which are here present with us , ye see this man , about whom all the multitude of the Jews have dealt with me , both at Jerusalem , and also here , crying that he ought not to live any longer .
text2: Ehin Pisxxoosi hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa , hagan nunaara de7iya asa ubbau , Aihuda asai ubbai Yerusalaameenikka hagankka wocamiiddi , ' I hagaappe sinttan paxa de7anau bessenna ' yaagidi , tana woossido bitaniyaa hagaa be7eeta .

text: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death , and that he himself hath appealed to Augustus , I have determined to send him .
text2: SHin i ainne haiqossi bessiyaabaa oottidobaa taani demmabeikke ; i ba huuphen , ' Augisxxoosi Qeesaari tabaa pirddo yaagada oichchais ' giido gishshau , Qeesaarakko a yeddanau ta qofaa qachchaas .

text: Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord . Wherefore I have brought him forth before you , and specially before thee , O king Agrippa , that , after examination had , I might have somewhat to write .
text2: Taani abaa ta godaa Augisxxoos Qeesaarassi xaafanau tumu yohoi tau aibinne baawa ; hegaa gishshau , i qorettidoogaappe guyyiyan , taani xaafiyoobaa demmana mala , intte sintti , Kawuwau Agriiphphaa , ubba ne sintti a ehaas .

text: For it seemeth to me unreasonable to send a prisoner , and not withal to signify the crimes laid against him .
text2: Aissi giikko , qashettida uraa kiittiyo wode , a aissi mootidaakko , erissennan aggiyoogee taassi eeyyatetta misatees ” yaagiis .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Thou art permitted to speak for thyself . Then Paul stretched forth the hand , and answered for himself :
text2: Agriiphphi PHauloosa , “ Neeni nebaa haasayanau danddayaasa ” yaagiis . He wode PHauloosi ba kushiyaa miccidi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis .

text: I think myself happy , king Agrippa , because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews :
text2: “ Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa , Aihudatu wogaanne palamaa ubbaa neeni loittada eriyo gishshau , tana Aihudati mootiyo yoho ubbaa hachchi taani ne sinttan zaariyoogaassi ta qaadai daro lo77o yaagada qoppais ; hegaa gishshau , neeni ta haasayaa salettennan siyana mala , nena woossais .

text: My manner of life from my youth , which was at the first among mine own nation at Jerusalem , know all the Jews ;
text2: “ Taani naatettaasappe doommada ta asaa giddooninne Yerusalaamen de7ido ta de7uwaa Aihuda ubbati kaseppe doommidi eroosona .

text: Which knew me from the beginning , if they would testify , that after the most straitest sect of our religion I lived a Pharisee .
text2: Taani koiroppe doommada , nu ammanuwaa higgiyaa ooppenne minttidi naagiya Parisaawetu bagga Parisaawe gidada de7iyoogaa , eti markkattanau koyikko eroosona .

text: And now I stand and am judged for the hope of the promise made of God unto our fathers :
text2: Taani ha77ikka Xoossai nu aawatussi immana giidoogaa ufaissan naagiyo gishshau , pirddettanaassi hagan eqqais .

text: Unto which promise our twelve tribes , instantly serving God day and night , hope to come . For which hope ' s sake , king Agrippa , I am accused of the Jews .
text2: Qassi tammanne naa77u nu aawatu zareti Xoossau qamminne gallassi ubbatoo minttidi goinniiddi , Xoossai immana giidoogaa ekkanau ufaissan naagoosona ; Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa , Aihudati tana mootiyoogee taani hegaa ufaissan naagiyo gishshassa .

text: Why should it be thought a thing incredible with you , that God should raise the dead ?
text2: Aihudatoo , Xoossai haiqqidaageeta denttiyoogaa aissi ammanekketii ?

text: I verily thought with myself , that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth .
text2: “ Taani ta huuphenkka Naazireeta Yesuusa sunttaa mooriya darobaa oottanau bessees gaada kase qoppaas .

text: Which thing I also did in Jerusalem : and many of the saints did I shut up in prison , having received authority from the chief priests ; and when they were put to death , I gave my voice against them .
text2: Taani Yerusalaamen oottidoogee hagaa ; qeese halaqatuppe maataa ekkada , Xoossaa asatuppe darota qashissaas ; eta woriyo wodekka eta haiquwaa dosaas .

text: And I punished them oft in every synagogue , and compelled them to blaspheme ; and being exceedingly mad against them , I persecuted them even unto strange cities .
text2: Aihuda woosa keetta ubban daro wode eta qaxxayada , bantta ammanuwaa eti aggana mala godataas ; taani wogi bainnaagaa eta hanqqettada , harai atto , hara biitta katamaa gakkanaassikka eta waissais .

text: Whereupon as I went to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
text2: “ Taani ha yohuwaassi qeese halaqatuppe maataanne azazuwaa ekkada Damasqqo baas .

text: At midday , O king , I saw in the way a light from heaven , above the brightness of the sun , shining round about me and them which journeyed with me .
text2: Kawuwau , taani seeta gallassi ogiyan de7ishin , awaa poo7uwaappe daro aadhdhiya poo7oi tananne tanaara biidaageeta yuuyi aadhdhidi , saluwaappe poo7ishin be7aas .

text: And when we were all fallen to the earth , I heard a voice speaking unto me , and saying in the Hebrew tongue , Saul , Saul , why persecutest thou me ? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks .
text2: Nuuni ubbaikka sa7an kunddido wode , Ibraisxxe qaalan , ' Saa7oolaa , Saa7oolaa , tana aissi waissai ? Boorai bana caddiya xam77aa qakkiyoogaadan , neeni qakkikko , nena qohaasa ' yaagidi taassi odishin siyaas .

text: And I said , Who art thou , Lord ? And he said , I am Jesus whom thou persecutest .
text2: “ Siyada , ' Ta Godau , neeni oonee ? ' yaagaas . “ Godai , ' Taani neeni waissiyo Yesuusa .

text: But rise , and stand upon thy feet : for I have appeared unto thee for this purpose , to make thee a minister and a witness both of these things which thou hast seen , and of those things in the which I will appear unto thee ;
text2: SHin dendda eqqa ; aissi giikko , hachchi neeni tana be7idoogaanne taani nena sinttappe bessanaagaa haratussi markkattana mala , ta oosanchcha oottada nena sunttanau neessi beettaas .

text: Delivering thee from the people , and from the Gentiles , unto whom now I send thee ,
text2: Eti tana ammanin , eta nagarai atto geetettanaadan , Xoossai doorido asaa giddon eti bantta sohuwaa demmanaadan , qassi xumaappe poo7uwaa simmanaadaaninne xalahiyaa godatettaappekka Xoossaakko simmanaadan , eta aifiyaa neeni dooyana mala , Israa7eela asaappenne taani nena etakko kiittiyo Aihuda gidennaageetuppe nena ashshana ' yaagiis .

text: Whereupon , O king Agrippa , I was not disobedient unto the heavenly vision :
text2: “ Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa , hegaa gishshau , taassi saluwaappe beettida ajjuutaassi taani azazettanaagaa ixxabeikke .

text: But shewed first unto them of Damascus , and at Jerusalem , and throughout all the coasts of Judaea , and then to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , and do works meet for repentance .
text2: SHin taani kasetada , Damasqqooninne Yerusalaamen hegaappe guyyiyan , Yihudaa biitta ubban de7iyaageetussinne Aihuda gidennaageetussi bantta nagaraappe simmana mala , qassi nagaraappe simmanau bessiyaabaa oottiiddi , Xoossaakko simmana mala qaalaa yootaas .

text: For these causes the Jews caught me in the temple , and went about to kill me .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Aihudati tana Beeta Maqidasiyan oiqqidi woranau koyidosona .

text: Having therefore obtained help of God , I continue unto this day , witnessing both to small and great , saying none other things than those which the prophets and Moses did say should come :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , taani Xoossaa maaduwaa ekkada , gitaassinne guuttaassi hachchi gakkanaassikka eqqada markkattais . Hananabaa yootiyaageetinne Muusee , ' Kiristtoosi waayettana bessees ; qassi haiquwaappe koiro denddidi , Aihudatussinne Aihuda gidennaageetussi atotettaa poo7uwaa yootanau bessees ' giidoogaadan , taanikka eti haasayidoogaappe haraa issibaakka haasayidobi baawa ” yaagiis .

text: And as he thus spake for himself , Festus said with a loud voice , Paul , thou art beside thyself ; much learning doth make thee mad .
text2: PHauloosi babaa hagaadan yaagidi zaarishin , Pisxxoosi qaalaa xoqqu oottidi , “ PHauloosaa , neeni gooyaasa ; neeni daro tamaaridoogee nena gooshshana hanees ” yaagiis .

text: But he said , I am not mad , most noble Festus ; but speak forth the words of truth and soberness .
text2: SHin PHauloosi hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Bonchcho Pisxxoosaa , taani tumu yohuwaanne wozanaa qofaa haasayiyoogaappe attin gooyikke .

text: For the king knoweth of these things , before whom also I speak freely : for I am persuaded that none of these things are hidden from him ; for this thing was not done in a corner .
text2: Taani Kawuwaa Agriiphphassi ha yohuwaa qassi qoncciyan yootiyoogaa i erees ; aissi giikko , ha yohoi geeman oosettibeenna gishshau , hagaappe issoinne appe geemmennaagaa taani geeshshada erais .

text: King Agrippa , believest thou the prophets ? I know that thou believest .
text2: “ Kawuwaa Agriiphphaa , neeni hananabaa yootiyaageetubaa ammanai ? Neeni etabaa ammaniyoogaa taani erais ” yaagiis .

text: Then Agrippa said unto Paul , Almost thou persuadest me to be a Christian .
text2: Kawoi Agriiphphi PHauloosa , “ Hanni keesenkka tana ammanttanau koyai ? ” yaagiis .

text: And Paul said , I would to God , that not only thou , but also all that hear me this day , were both almost , and altogether such as I am , except these bonds .
text2: Yaagin PHauloosi , “ Daro wode gidin , guutta wode gidin , ne xalaala gidakka ; shin hachchi taani yootiyoogaa siyiya ubbai qassi ha qashuwaappe attin , ta mala gidanau Xoossaa woossais ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had thus spoken , the king rose up , and the governor , and Bernice , and they that sat with them :
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan kawoikka , Pisxxoosikka , Barnniiqakka , etaara uttida ubbaikka denddidi ,

text: And when they were gone aside , they talked between themselves , saying , This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds .
text2: issi baggi simmidi , issoi issuwaara , “ Ha bitanee haiqoi atto shin , qashossikka bessiyaabaa oottibeenna ” yaagidi haasayidosona .

text: Then said Agrippa unto Festus , This man might have been set at liberty , if he had not appealed unto Caesar .
text2: Agriiphphi Pisxxoosa , “ Ha bitanee , ' Qeesaari tabaa pirddo ' gibeennaakko , birshshettana danddayees shin ” yaagiis .

text: And when it was determined that we should sail into Italy , they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners unto one named Julius , a centurion of Augustus ' band .
text2: Nuuni markkabiyan Xaaliyaa baanau qachchido wode , PHauloosanne hara amarida qashuwaa asata Augisxxoosa wotaaddarata giyoogeetuppe issi Yuuliyoosa giyo mato halaqaassi aattidi immidosona .

text: And entering into a ship of Adramyttium , we launched , meaning to sail by the coasts of Asia ; one Aristarchus , a Macedonian of Thessalonica , being with us .
text2: Isiyaa gaxan de7iya biittata biya Adiraamixiyoona markkabiyan gelidi denddida ; Maqidooniyaa asa gidiya Tasalonqqee Arisxxirokoosi nunaara de7ees .

text: And the next day we touched at Sidon . And Julius courteously entreated Paul , and gave him liberty to go unto his friends to refresh himself .
text2: Wonttetta gallassi nuuni Sidoona gakkishin , Yuuliyoosi PHauloosassi kehidi a , “ Ne dabboti nena maaddana mala , neeni etakko baanau danddayaasa ” yaagiis .

text: And when we had launched from thence , we sailed under Cyprus , because the winds were contrary .
text2: Hegaappe denddidi , sinttaara nu bolli carkkiyo gishshau , Qophphiroosa haruuruwan carkkenna baggi biida .

text: And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia , we came to Myra , a city of Lycia .
text2: Kilqqiyaa mataaninne PHinifiliyaa matan de7iya abbaa pinnidi , Luqiyan de7iya Mura gakkida .

text: And there the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing into Italy ; and he put us therein .
text2: Hegan mato halaqai Xaaliyaa biya Iskkinddiriyaa markkabiyaa demmidi , aani nuna gelissiis .

text: And when we had sailed slowly many days , and scarce were come over against Cnidus , the wind not suffering us , we sailed under Crete , over against Salmone ;
text2: Nuuni daro gallassaa loddaara biiddi , daro tuggan Qaniidoose ginaa gakkida ; hegaara baanau nuna carkkoi diggin Salmmoonaara aadhdhidi , Qarxxeesen carkkenna baggi biida .

text: And , hardly passing it , came unto a place which is called The fair havens ; nigh whereunto was the city of Lasea .
text2: Qassikka daro tuggan gaxaara gaxaara aadhdhidi , Luqiyaa katamaa matan de7iya abbaa doonan markkabee woppu giidi shemppiyoosaa giyoosaa yiida .

text: Now when much time was spent , and when sailing was now dangerous , because the fast was now already past , Paul admonished them ,
text2: Nuuni hegan daro wodiyaa gam77idoogaappe guyyiyan , Xoomai birshshettiichchido gishshau , markkabiyan biyoogeekka hirggissin PHauloosi eta zoriiddi ,

text: And said unto them , Sirs , I perceive that this voyage will be with hurt and much damage , not only of the lading and ship , but also of our lives .
text2: “ Asau , nu buussan gita boshainne daro qohoi de7anaagee tau beettees ; bashshai yiyoogee caanaa bollanne markkabiyaa bolla xalaalaani gidenna ; nu shemppuwaa bollikka yaana ” yaagiis .

text: Nevertheless the centurion believed the master and the owner of the ship , more than those things which were spoken by Paul .
text2: SHin mato halaqai PHauloosi giidoogaappe aattidi , markkabiyan de7iyaageeta azaziyaageenne markkabiyaa godai giyoogaa ammanees .

text: And because the haven was not commodious to winter in , the more part advised to depart thence also , if by any means they might attain to Phenice , and there to winter ; which is an haven of Crete , and lieth toward the south west and north west .
text2: He abbaa doona katamai balgguwaa shaaccanau etassi injjetenna katama ; hegaa gishshau , dariya asati banttau danddayettikko , Pinqqe giyo katamaa gakkidi , balgguwaa yaani shaaccana mala , yaappe denddanau zorettidosona ; Pinqqee awai wulliyoosaappenne ushachchappe gidduwan , qassi wulliyoosaappenne haddirssappe gidduwan de7iya abbaa doona katama .

text: And when the south wind blew softly , supposing that they had obtained their purpose , loosing thence , they sailed close by Crete .
text2: Tohossa bagga carkkoi loddaara carkkido wode , bantta qoppidoogaadan hanidabaa etassi milatin denddidosona ; markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya birataa pude dafidi , Qarxxeese matattidi , lanqqiyaara aadhdhidosona .

text: But not long after there arose against it a tempestuous wind , called Euroclydon .
text2: SHin daro gam77ennan , “ Auraaqiis ” giyo daro wolqqaama gotee haruuruwaappe duge eta bolli denddiis .

text: And when the ship was caught , and could not bear up into the wind , we let her drive .
text2: He gotee markkabiyaa dechchidi aattennan diggin , baanau nuuyyo danddayettennan ixxido gishshau , markkabiyaa i efiyoosaa yeddi bayidi biida .

text: And running under a certain island which is called Clauda , we had much work to come by the boat :
text2: Nuuni Qeeda giyo haruuruwan geemmido wode , daro tuggatidi markkabiyaa wolwoluwaa teqqanau danddayida .

text: Which when they had taken up , they used helps , undergirding the ship ; and , fearing lest they should fall into the quicksands , strake sail , and so were driven .
text2: Eti wolwoluwaa pude kessidoogaappe guyyiyan , wodoruwan markkabiyaa xaaxidi , mintti qachchidosona ; Sirttiisa giyo shafiyan banttana oogganaakkonne giidi hirggidi , markkabiyaa efiya sharaa wottidi , carkkuwan markkabiyaa coo yeddi bayidosona .

text: And we being exceedingly tossed with a tempest , the next day they lightened the ship ;
text2: Gotee wolqqaamidi nuna tuggayin , wonttetta gallassi caanaappe abban oluwaa doommidosona .

text: And the third day we cast out with our own hands the tackling of the ship .
text2: Heezzantto gallassikka markkabiyan de7iya miishshaa eti bantta kushiyan olidosona .

text: And when neither sun nor stars in many days appeared , and no small tempest lay on us , all hope that we should be saved was then taken away .
text2: Nuuni daro gallassaa awa aifiyaanne xoolinttiyaa be7ennan , wolqqaama uushoi nu bolli uushishin , sinttappe xayana giidi qoppida .

text: But after long abstinence Paul stood forth in the midst of them , and said , Sirs , ye should have hearkened unto me , and not have loosed from Crete , and to have gained this harm and loss .
text2: Eti daro gallassaa katta meennan gam77idoogaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi he wode eta giddon denddi eqqidi , hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Asau , intte ta zoriyaa ekkidobaa gidiyaakkonne Qarxxeeseppe denddennan aggidaakko , ha bashshainne qohoi nuna gakkenna .

text: And now I exhort you to be of good cheer : for there shall be no loss of any man ' s life among you , but of the ship .
text2: SHin ha77ikka taani inttena yayyoppite gaada zorais ; aissi giikko , ha markkabee xayanaappe attin , intteppe issi uraa shemppoikka xayenna .

text: For there stood by me this night the angel of God , whose I am , and whom I serve ,
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa kiitanchchai , tana haarida taani goinniyo Xoossaagee , zine qammi ta matan eqqidi ,

text: Saying , Fear not , Paul ; thou must be brought before Caesar : and , lo , God hath given thee all them that sail with thee .
text2: ' PHauloosaa , yayyoppa ; neeni Roome biittaa Kawuwaa Qeesaara sinttan eqqanau bessees ; be7a , Xoossai nenaara biya asa ubbaa shemppuwaa ashshana ' yaagiis .

text: Wherefore , sirs , be of good cheer : for I believe God , that it shall be even as it was told me .
text2: Hegaa gishshau asau , yayyoppite . Aissi giikko , he kiitanchchai tau odidoogaadan hananaagaa taani Xoossaa ammanais ;

text: Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island .
text2: shin carkkoi nuna issi haruuruwan abbaa doonan olana ” yaagiis .

text: But when the fourteenth night was come , as we were driven up and down in Adria , about midnight the shipmen deemed that they drew near to some country ;
text2: Tammanne oiddantto qamman Meediteraane Abban nuna carkkoi yaanne haanne sugishin , markkabiyan oottiyaageetussi qamma bilahe biittaakko matidobaa milatiis .

text: And sounded , and found it twenty fathoms : and when they had gone a little further , they sounded again , and found it fifteen fathoms .
text2: Eti likkiyo wodoruwaa xeeran deexxiyaabaa qachchidi , haattan yeggin , haattai hosppun tammu wara ciimmatidoogaa eridosona . Guuttaa gam77iiddi , naa77anttuwaa yeggidi , usuppun tammu wara ciimmatidoogaa eridosona .

text: Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks , they cast four anchors out of the stern , and wished for the day .
text2: Eti shuchchattiyaasan kunddenna mala yayyidi , markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya oiddu birataa markkabiyaappe guyyeera abban yeggidi , sa7ai wonttana mala , Xoossaa woossoosona .

text: And as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under colour as though they would have cast anchors out of the foreship ,
text2: Markkabiyan oottiyaageeti markkabiyaappe baqatanau koyidi , markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya amarida biratata markkabiyaappe sintta baggaara abban yeggiyaabaa milatidi , wolwoluwaa abban wottido wode ,

text: Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers , Except these abide in the ship , ye cannot be saved .
text2: PHauloosi mato halaqaanne wotaaddarata , “ Hageeti markkabe giddon de7ana xayikko , intte attanau danddayekketa ” yaagiis .

text: Then the soldiers cut off the ropes of the boat , and let her fall off .
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , wotaaddarati wolwoloi qashettido wodoruwaa qanxxidi , yeddi bayidosona .

text: And while the day was coming on , Paul besought them all to take meat , saying , This day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarried and continued fasting , having taken nothing .
text2: Sa7ai wonttana hanishin , PHauloosi ubbai qumaa maana mala , hagaadan yaagidi woossiis ; “ Intte hachchiira tammanne oiddu gallassaa naagideta ; qassi he ubbankka quma mibeekketa .

text: Wherefore I pray you to take some meat : for this is for your health : for there shall not an hair fall from the head of any of you .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , guutta qumaa intte maana mala , taani inttena woossais ; aissi giikko , intte paxa de7anau guutta qumaa maana koshshees ; harai atto intte huuphiyaa binnaanaappe issoikka xayenna ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had thus spoken , he took bread , and gave thanks to God in presence of them all : and when he had broken it , he began to eat .
text2: PHauloosi hagaa giidi , oittaa ekkidi , ubbaa sinttan Xoossaa galatiis ; menttidi Muussaa doommiis .

text: Then were they all of good cheer , and they also took some meat .
text2: Doommin ubbai minettidi , banttaukka qassi qumaa miidosona .

text: And we were in all in the ship two hundred threescore and sixteen souls .
text2: Nuuni markkabiyan de7iyaageeti naa77u xeetanne laappun tammanne usuppuna .

text: And when they had eaten enough , they lightened the ship , and cast out the wheat into the sea .
text2: Eti miidi kallido wode , caana gisttiyaa abban olidi markkabiyaa deexuwaa kaushshidosona .

text: And when it was day , they knew not the land : but they discovered a certain creek with a shore , into the which they were minded , if it were possible , to thrust in the ship .
text2: Sa7ai wonttido wode , markkabiyan oottiyaageeti biittaa eribookkona ; shin haattai goggidi abban gelidosaa lanqqiyan de7iya shafiyaa akeeki xeellidosona . Banttassi danddayettiyaakko , markkabiyaa he shafiyaakko laagganau bantta qofaa qachchidosona .

text: And when they had taken up the anchors , they committed themselves unto the sea , and loosed the rudder bands , and hoised up the mainsail to the wind , and made toward shore .
text2: Yaatidi markkabee beenna mala oiqqiya biratata birshshidi , abbaa giddo yeggidosona ; he wode , markkabiyaa koyidosaa zaaridi laaggiyo mittaa qachchido wodoruwaa birshshidosona ; hegaappe guyyiyan , carkkoi markkabiyaa sinttau sugana mala , markkabiyaa efiya sharaa sintta baggaara xoqqu oottidi , buussaa doommidosona .

text: And falling into a place where two seas met , they ran the ship aground ; and the forepart stuck fast , and remained unmoveable , but the hinder part was broken with the violence of the waves .
text2: SHin markkabee naa77u abbai gaittidosan de7iya shafiyan dom77ettidi ohettiis ; markkabiyaassi guyye baggai beetaa sugettan meqerettishin , sintta baggai xishettidi , qaaxxennan ixxi aggiis .

text: And the soldiers ' counsel was to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim out , and escape .
text2: Wotaaddarati qashuwaa asaappe issoinne haattaa wodhdhidi kessi ekkenna mala , eta woranau zorettidosona .

text: But the centurion , willing to save Paul , kept them from their purpose ; and commanded that they which could swim should cast themselves first into the sea , and get to land :
text2: SHin mato halaqai PHauloosa ashshanau koyidi , wotaaddaratu zoretaa ixxiis ; haattaa waraa eriya ubbai markkabiyaappe haattan guppi guppidi kasetidi gaxaa kiyana mala azaziis .

text: And the rest , some on boards , and some on broken pieces of the ship . And so it came to pass , that they escaped all safe to land .
text2: Attidaageetuppe baggati sanqqan , baggati markkabiyaa me7uwan kiyana mala azaziis ; hegaadan ubbatikka gaxaa saro kiyidosona .

text: And when they were escaped , then they knew that the island was called Melita .
text2: Nuuni gaxaa saro kiyido wode , haruuroi Maltta geetettiyoogaa erida .

text: And the barbarous people shewed us no little kindness : for they kindled a fire , and received us every one , because of the present rain , and because of the cold .
text2: Haruuruwaa asati nuussi daro kehaa kehidosona ; irai bukkanau doommido gishshaunne meeggiyo gishshau , tamaa eettidi , nuna ubbaa mokkidosona .

text: And when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks , and laid them on the fire , there came a viper out of the heat , and fastened on his hand .
text2: PHauloosi daro qaixaariyaa qoridi taman wottishin , shooshshai mishuwaa gishshau kiyidi , a kushiyan xaaxettidi , a dukkiis .

text: And when the barbarians saw the venomous beast hang on his hand , they said among themselves , No doubt this man is a murderer , whom , though he hath escaped the sea , yet vengeance suffereth not to live .
text2: Haruuruwaa asati shooshshai PHauloosa kushiyan xaaxettidaagaa be7ido wode issoi issuwaassi , “ Tumu ha bitanee shemppo woriya asa ; harai atto abbaappe i attinkka Xoossaa pirddai a paxa de7o gibeenna ” yaagidosona .

text: And he shook off the beast into the fire , and felt no harm .
text2: SHin PHauloosi ba kushiyaappe shooshshaa wuxakkidi , taman oliis ; a ainne oottibeenna .

text: Howbeit they looked when he should have swollen , or fallen down dead suddenly : but after they had looked a great while , and saw no harm come to him , they changed their minds , and said that he was a god .
text2: Eti , “ A bollai kixxees ; woi akeekennan kunddidi haiqqees ” yaagidi a naagoosona ; shin daro wodiyaa naagidi , a bollan aibinne dummatidabi xayin , “ Hagee xoossa ” yaagidi bantta qofaa aggi bayidosona .

text: In the same quarters were possessions of the chief man of the island , whose name was Publius ; who received us , and lodged us three days courteously .
text2: Hegaa heeran haruuruwaa halaqaa Pupiliyoosa giyoogaassi gadee de7ees ; i nuna mokkidi , heezzu gallassaa siiquwan imattiis .

text: And it came to pass , that the father of Publius lay sick of a fever and of a bloody flux : to whom Paul entered in , and prayed , and laid his hands on him , and healed him .
text2: Pupiliyoosa aawai qoxo , mishonne ulo kara sahetti zin77idi de7ees ; PHauloosi a soo gelidi , ayyo Xoossaa woossiis ; ba kushiyaa a bolli wottidi , a pattiis .

text: So when this was done , others also , which had diseases in the island , came , and were healed :
text2: Hegaappe guyyiyan , he haruuruwan harggiya hara asaikka qassi yiidi paxiis .

text: Who also honoured us with many honours ; and when we departed , they laded us with such things as were necessary .
text2: Paxin nuna daro bonchchuwaa bonchchidosona ; nuuni markkabiyan baanau denddido wode , ogiyau nuna koshshiyaabaa nuussi immidosona .

text: And after three months we departed in a ship of Alexandria , which had wintered in the isle , whose sign was Castor and Pollux .
text2: Heezzu aginaappe guyyiyan , haruuruwan balgguwaa aattidi Diyoosqqoroosa giyo Iskkinddiriyaa markkabiyan baanau denddida .

text: And landing at Syracuse , we tarried there three days .
text2: Nuuni Siraakuse giyo katamaa gelidi , yaani heezzu gallassaa uttida .

text: And from thence we fetched a compass , and came to Rhegium : and after one day the south wind blew , and we came the next day to Puteoli :
text2: Hegaappe yuuyiiddi , Regiiyume giyo katamaa gakkida . Issi gallassappe guyyiyan , tohossa bagga carkkoi carkkin , wonttetta gallassi Putiyoluusa giyo katamaa yiida .

text: Where we found brethren , and were desired to tarry with them seven days : and so we went toward Rome .
text2: Hegan nuuni issi issi ammaniyaageeta demmin , banttanaara laappun gallassaa uttana mala , nuna woossidosona ; hegaadankka qassi Roome yiida .

text: And from thence , when the brethren heard of us , they came to meet us as far as Appiiforum , and The three taverns : whom when Paul saw , he thanked God , and took courage .
text2: Roomen de7iya ammaniyaageeti nubaa siyidi , Afiyoosa Giyaanne Heezzu Aqiyoosaa giyoosaa gakkanaassi nuna mokkanau yiidosona ; PHauloosi eta be7ido wode Xoossaa galatidi , wozanan minettiis .

text: And when we came to Rome , the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard : but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him .
text2: Nuuni Roome gelido wode , PHauloosi bana naagiya wotaaddaraara barkka de7ana mala azazettiis .

text: And it came to pass , that after three days Paul called the chief of the Jews together : and when they were come together , he said unto them , Men and brethren , though I have committed nothing against the people , or customs of our fathers , yet was I delivered prisoner from Jerusalem into the hands of the Romans .
text2: Heezzu gallassaappe guyyiyan , PHauloosi Aihudatu halaqata baakko xeesiis ; eti shiiqido wode , eta hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Ta ishatoo , taani nu asaa woi nu aawatu wogaa phalqqiyaabaa ainne oottennan , tana Yerusalaamen qachchidi , Roome asaassi aattidi immidosona .

text: Who , when they had examined me , would have let me go , because there was no cause of death in me .
text2: Eti tana qoridi , haiqossi bessiyaabai ta bolli ainne bainna gishshau , tana birshshanau qoppidosona .

text: But when the Jews spake against it , I was constrained to appeal unto Caesar ; not that I had ought to accuse my nation of .
text2: SHin hegaa Aihudati maayennan ixxido wode , ' Tabaa Qeesaari pirddo ' gaanaagee tana koshshiisippe attin , taani ta zariyaa mootiyoobai taassi de7iina gidenna .

text: For this cause therefore have I called for you , to see you , and to speak with you : because that for the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain .
text2: Taani inttenaara gaittanaunne haasayanau inttena xeesidoogee hegaassa ; aissi giikko , Israa7eela asai ufaissan naagiyoogaa gishshataassi taani ha sanssalatan qashettaas ” yaagiis .

text: And they said unto him , We neither received letters out of Judaea concerning thee , neither any of the brethren that came shewed or spake any harm of thee .
text2: Aihuda cimati PHauloosa , “ Nuuni Yihudaappe nebau dabddaabbe ekkibookko . Nu ishanttuppekka harai atto , issoikka yiidi , nebaa odibeenna ; woi ne sunttaa mooridi , nuuyyo odibeenna .

text: But we desire to hear of thee what thou thinkest : for as concerning this sect , we know that every where it is spoken against .
text2: SHin he asaa sunttaa ubbasan asai mooridi haasayiyoogaa nuuni eriyo gishshau , ne qofaa siyanau koyoos ” yaagidosona .

text: And when they had appointed him a day , there came many to him into his lodging ; to whom he expounded and testified the kingdom of God , persuading them concerning Jesus , both out of the law of Moses , and out of the prophets , from morning till evening .
text2: Eti bantta yaana gallassaa PHauloosassi keeridi , he gallassi daridi i de7iyoosaa yiidosona ; yin i etassi Xoossaa kawotettaabaa markkattiis . Qassi eti Yesuusabaa ammanana mala , Muuse higgiyaappenne hananabaa yootiyaageeti xaafidoogaappe bochchidi eta tamaarissiiddi , maalladoppe omarssi gakkanaassi loittidi yootiis .

text: And some believed the things which were spoken , and some believed not .
text2: Baggati PHauloosi giidoogaa ammanidosona ; shin baggati ammanibookkona .

text: And when they agreed not among themselves , they departed , after that Paul had spoken one word , Well spake the Holy Ghost by Esaias the prophet unto our fathers ,
text2: Eti bantta giddon yohuwaa maayettennan ixxido wode , PHauloosi issibaa giidoogaappe guyyiyan biidosona ; i hagaadan yaagiis ; “ Geeshsha Ayyaanai nu aawatussi hananabaa yootiya Isiyaasan ,

text: Saying , Go unto this people , and say , Hearing ye shall hear , and shall not understand ; and seeing ye shall see , and not perceive :
text2: ' Neeni he asaakko baada hagaadan ga ; “ Intte sissaa siyana , shin intteyyo gelenna ; intte xeeluwaa xeellana , shin be7ekketa .

text: For the heart of this people is waxed gross , and their ears are dull of hearing , and their eyes have they closed ; lest they should see with their eyes , and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and should be converted , and I should heal them .
text2: Aissi giikko , ha asaa wozanai dammiis ; bantta haittaa tulissidosona ; bantta aifiyaakka qilimmidosona . Hegee bainnaakko , bantta aifiyan be7ana ; eta haittaikka siyana ; eta wozanaikka akeekana ; eti taakko Xoossaakko simmana . Qassi taanikka eta pattana ” yaaga ' yaagiis .

text: Be it known therefore unto you , that the salvation of God is sent unto the Gentiles , and that they will hear it .
text2: Simmi hagee Xoossaa atotettai , Aihuda gidennaageetussi kiitettidoogee inttessi eretto . Qassi etikka siyana ” yaagiis .

text: And when he had said these words , the Jews departed , and had great reasoning among themselves .
text2: PHauloosi hegaa giidoogaappe guyyiyan , Aihudati bantta giddon daro palamettiiddi biidosona .

text: And Paul dwelt two whole years in his own hired house , and received all that came in unto him ,
text2: PHauloosi kera keettan naa77u laitta kumettaa de7iiddi , baakko yiya ubbaa mokkees .

text: Preaching the kingdom of God , and teaching those things which concern the Lord Jesus Christ , with all confidence , no man forbidding him .
text2: Bana ooninne diggennan Xoossaa kawotettaabaanne Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosabaa yootiiddi , yayyennan daro qonccissidi tamaarissiis .

text: Paul , a servant of Jesus Christ , called to be an apostle , separated unto the gospel of God ,
text2: Ba wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootanau Xoossai dooridi xeesido Kiristtoos Yesuusa ashkkarai , Yesuus Kiristtoosi kiittido PHauloosi , taani ha dabddaabbiyaa xaafais .

text: ( Which he had promised afore by his prophets in the holy scriptures , )
text2: Xoossai daro wodeppe kase ba hananabaa yootiyaageetu baggaara wonggeliyaa immana yaagidoogee Xoossaa Geeshsha Maxaafatun xaafettiis ;

text: Concerning his Son Jesus Christ our Lord , which was made of the seed of David according to the flesh ;
text2: he wonggelee asatettan Daawita zariyaappe yelettida Xoossaa Na7aa , nu Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosabaa .

text: And declared to be the Son of God with power , according to the spirit of holiness , by the resurrection from the dead :
text2: Qassi i ba geeshshatetta Ayyaanan haiquwaappe denddidoogan , Xoossaa Na7aa gidiyoogaa gita wolqqan bessiis .

text: By whom we have received grace and apostleship , for obedience to the faith among all nations , for his name :
text2: Aihuda gidenna asai ubbai ammananaadaaninne azazettanaadan , nuuni eta kaalettana mala , Xoossai Kiristtoosa sunttaa gishshau , Kiristtoosa baggaara aaro kehatettaanne Yesuusi kiittidoogeeta gidiyo maataa nuuyyo immiis .

text: Among whom are ye also the called of Jesus Christ :
text2: Yesuus Kiristtoosabaa gidanaadan , Xoossai xeesido inttekka hegeetu giddon de7eeta .

text: To all that be in Rome , beloved of God , called to be saints : Grace to you and peace from God our Father , and the Lord Jesus Christ .
text2: Xoossai siiqiyoogeetuyyoonne geeshsha oottanau xeesido Roome biittan de7iya ubbatuyyo Xoossaa nu Awaappenne Godaa Yesuus Kiristtoosappe aaro kehatettainne sarotettai intteyyo gido .

text: First , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all , that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world .
text2: Kasetada taani intte ammanoi sa7aa ubban siyettido gishshau , Yesuus Kiristtoosa baggaara intteyyo ta Xoossaa galatais .

text: For God is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the gospel of his Son , that without ceasing I make mention of you always in my prayers ;
text2: Aissi giikko , taani ubba wode ta woosan inttena hassayiyoogau , Xoossai , taani a Na7aa wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootiyoogan ta ayyaanan ayyo oottiyoogee markka . Xoossai , ba sheniyan , taani ha77i inttekko baanau ta ogiyaa injjeyanaadan , ubba wode woossais .

text: For I long to see you , that I may impart unto you some spiritual gift , to the end ye may be established ;
text2: Aissi giikko , taani inttena minttettanau , inttenaara issippe Ayyaanaa imuwaa shaakkana mala , inttena be7anau laamotais .

text: That is , that I may be comforted together with you by the mutual faith both of you and me .
text2: Taani giyoogee , inttekka taakka issi wode minettana . Intte ta ammanuwan , qassi taanikka intte ammanuwan minettana .

text: Now I would not have you ignorant , brethren , that oftentimes I purposed to come unto you , ( but was let hitherto , ) that I might have some fruit among you also , even as among other Gentiles .
text2: Ta ishatoo , taani ubba wode inttekko baanau qoppaas . SHin tana diggiyaabai de7iyoogaa intte eranau bessees ; taani harai atto Aihuda gidenna hara asaappekka aife demmidoogaadan , intteppekka aife demmanau koyais .

text: I am debtor both to the Greeks , and to the Barbarians ; both to the wise , and to the unwise .
text2: Taani asa ubbau , Giriike asaunne tamaaribeenna asau qassi aadhdhida eranchchatuyyoonne eeyyatuyyo qanxxana acoi de7ees .

text: So , as much as in me is , I am ready to preach the gospel to you that are at Rome also .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , tau danddayettida keesan Roomen de7iya inttessikka wonggeliyaa mishiraachchuwaa yootanau amottais .

text: For I am not ashamed of the gospel of Christ : for it is the power of God unto salvation to every one that believeth ; to the Jew first , and also to the Greek .
text2: Wonggeliyaa mishiraachchoi tana yeellayenna ; i ammaniya ubbaa , kasetidi Aihuda asaa qassi Aihuda gidenna asaa ashshanau Xoossaappe yiya wolqqa .

text: For therein is the righteousness of God revealed from faith to faith : as it is written , The just shall live by faith .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa maxaafai , “ Xilloi ammanuwan de7ana ” yaagiyoogaadan , Xoossai asaa koiroppe wurssettaa gakkanaassi , ammanuwan xillissiyoogaa wonggelee qonccissees .

text: For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men , who hold the truth in unrighteousness ;
text2: Tumatettai erettanaagaa bantta iita hanotan diggiya nagara ooso ubbaa bollinne asaa iita ooso ubbaa bolli , Xoossaa hanqqoi saluwaappe wodhdhidi qonccana .

text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them ; for God hath shewed it unto them .
text2: Eti Xoossaabaa erana danddayiyoobai etau qoncce ; aissi giikko , Xoossai etau qonccissiis .

text: For the invisible things of him from the creation of the world are clearly seen , being understood by the things that are made , even his eternal power and Godhead ; so that they are without excuse :
text2: Beettenna a hanotai , hegeekka a merinaa wolqqainne a Xoossatettai issippe Xoossai ha sa7aa medhdhoosappe doommidi , etau qonccidi beettiis ; eti hegaa Xoossai medhdhidobaappe be7anau danddayiyo gishshau , etau gaasoyiyoobi baawa .

text: Because that , when they knew God , they glorified him not as God , neither were thankful ; but became vain in their imaginations , and their foolish heart was darkened .
text2: Aissi giikko , eti Xoossaa erikkokka , au bessiya bonchchuwaa immibookkona ; qassi a galatokkona . SHin eti allaalle kessennabaa qoppoosona ; qassi eta akeekenna wozanai xumiis .

text: Professing themselves to be wise , they became fools ,
text2: Eti banttana aadhdhida eranchcha goosona ; shin eti eeyya .

text: And changed the glory of the uncorruptible God into an image made like to corruptible man , and to birds , and fourfooted beasts , and creeping things .
text2: Eti haiqqenna Xoossaassi goinniyoogaa ixxidi , haiqqiya asaa meraa , kafotu meraa , do7atu meraanne tiran gooshettiyaageetu meran medhdhido misiletussi goinnidosona .

text: Wherefore God also gave them up to uncleanness through the lusts of their own hearts , to dishonour their own bodies between themselves :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , eti issoi issuwaara borssobaa oottana mala , Xoossai eta wozanai amottiyo tunabaa oottanau eta yeggi bayiis .

text: Who changed the truth of God into a lie , and worshipped and served the creature more than the Creator , who is blessed for ever . Amen .
text2: Aissi giikko , eti Xoossaa tumatettaa wordduwan laammidosona ; qassi medhdhida Xoossaa aggi bayidi , i medhdhidobau goinnidosonanne oottidosona . Xoossai merinau galatettidaagaa . Amin77i .

text: For this cause God gave them up unto vile affections : for even their women did change the natural use into that which is against nature :
text2: Hegaa gishshau , Xoossai eti borssobaa amottana mala , eta yeggi bayiis ; harai atto eta maccaasai banttau bessiyaabaa aggidi , bessennabaa hanidosona .

text: And likewise also the men , leaving the natural use of the woman , burned in their lust one toward another ; men with men working that which is unseemly , and receiving in themselves that recompence of their error which was meet .
text2: Hegaadankka , attumaasai qassi bau bessiyoogaadan maccaasaara gaittiyoogaa aggidi , issoi issuwaara gaittanau qaaqqatidosona ; attumaasai issoi issuwaara borssobaa oottidi , bantta oottido balan banttau bessiya pirddaa ekkidosona .

text: And even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge , God gave them over to a reprobate mind , to do those things which are not convenient ;
text2: Eti Xoossaa eranau dosennan ixxidoogaa keenaa Xoossai eti bessennabaa oottana mala , etau pattenna qofaa immiis .

text: Being filled with all unrighteousness , fornication , wickedness , covetousness , maliciousness ; full of envy , murder , debate , deceit , malignity ; whisperers ,
text2: Etan geellatettai , iitatettai , yiiqeenne iita hanotai kumiis ; qassi etan qanaatee , shemppo woriyo qofai , palami , cimoinne iita qofai kumiis ; qassi eti soqiyaageeta ,

text: Backbiters , haters of God , despiteful , proud , boasters , inventors of evil things , disobedient to parents ,
text2: zigiriyaageeta , Xoossaa ixxiyaageeta , cayiyaageeta , otorettiyaageeta , ceeqettiyaageeta , iitabaa oottanau koyiyaageetanne bantta aayeeyyoonne aawaayyo azazettennaageeta ,

text: Without understanding , covenantbreakers , without natural affection , implacable , unmerciful :
text2: kaushshata , caaquwaa polennaageeta , siiqoi bainnaageetanne haratussi qarettennaageeta .

text: Who knowing the judgment of God , that they which commit such things are worthy of death , not only do the same , but have pleasure in them that do them .
text2: Eti hageetu malaa oottiyaageetuyyo haiqoi bessees giya Xoossaa higgiyaa eriiddi , hageeta oottoosona ; hegaa xalaala gidennan , hageeta oottiyaageetakka oottite goosona .

text: Therefore thou art inexcusable , O man , whosoever thou art that judgest : for wherein thou judgest another , thou condemnest thyself ; for thou that judgest doest the same things .
text2: Hegaa gishshau , nenoo haratu bolli pirddiyaagoo , neeyyo gaasoyiyoobi baawa ; aissi giikko , neeni haratu bolli pirddaidda , he neeni eta bolli pirddiyoogaa malaa oottikko , ne bolli pirddaasa .

text: But we are sure that the judgment of God is according to truth against them which commit such things .
text2: Nuuni hagaa mala oosuwaa oottiyaageetu bolli Xoossai xillo pirddaa pirddiyoogaa eroos .

text: And thinkest thou this , O man , that judgest them which do such things , and doest the same , that thou shalt escape the judgment of God ?
text2: Nenoo , hagaa mala oosuwaa oottiyaageetu bolli pirddiyaagoo , qassi he neeni pirddiyoogaa malaa oottiyaagoo , neeni Xoossaa pirddaappe kessa ekkiyaabaa milatii ?

text: Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering ; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance ?
text2: Woikko Xoossaa kehatettaa , genccaa , danddayaanne duretettaa karaishsha ? Xoossai nena nagaraappe zaaranau koyiyo gishshau , i keha gidiyoogaa neeni eraasa .

text: But after thy hardness and impenitent heart treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God ;
text2: SHin intteyyo siyenna wozanainne nagaraappe simmenna wozanai de7ees ; hegaa gishshau , Xoossaa hanqqoinne xillo pirddai qoncciyo gallassi , neeni ne bolli hanqquwaa kaseegaappe darissaasa .

text: Who will render to every man according to his deeds :
text2: Xoossai asa ubbau a oosuwaa malaa immana .

text: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality , eternal life :
text2: Issi issi asati lo77obaa danddayan oottoosona ; qassi galataa , bonchchuwaanne xayenna de7uwaa koyoosona ; etau Xoossai merinaa de7uwaa immana .

text: But unto them that are contentious , and do not obey the truth , but obey unrighteousness , indignation and wrath ,
text2: SHin harati iitabaa oottanau yaaretoosonanne tumatettaa ixxoosona ; Xoossai eta bolli bashshaanne hanqquwaa yeddana .

text: Tribulation and anguish , upon every soul of man that doeth evil , of the Jew first , and also of the Gentile ;
text2: Iitabaa oottiya asai ubbai tuggatananne waayettana ; hegee kasetidi , Aihuda asaa gakkana ; kaallidi qassi Aihuda gidenna asaa gakkana .

text: But glory , honour , and peace , to every man that worketh good , to the Jew first , and also to the Gentile :
text2: SHin Xoossai lo77o ooso oottiya ubbatuyyo galataa , bonchchuwaanne sarotettaa immana . Kasetidi Aihudatuyyo immana ; kaallidi qassi Aihuda gidennaageetuyyo immana .

text: For there is no respect of persons with God .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa aifiyan asai ubbai issi mala .

text: For as many as have sinned without law shall also perish without law : and as many as have sinned in the law shall be judged by the law ;
text2: Muuse higgee bainnan nagara oottida ubbai higgee bainnan xayana . Muuse higgee de7ishin , nagara oottida ubbai higgiyan pirddettana .

text: ( For not the hearers of the law are just before God , but the doers of the law shall be justified .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa sinttan higgiyaa naagiyaageeti xilloosonappe attin , higgiyaa siyiyaageeti xillokkona .

text: For when the Gentiles , which have not the law , do by nature the things contained in the law , these , having not the law , are a law unto themselves :
text2: Aihuda gidenna asau higgee baawa ; shin banttana zoriya wozanan higgee azaziyoogaa oottoosona ; etau higgee xayikkokka , eti bantta huupheyyo higge .

text: Which shew the work of the law written in their hearts , their conscience also bearing witness , and their thoughts the mean while accusing or else excusing one another ; )
text2: Higgee azaziyoogee eta wozanaa giddon xaafettidoogaa eta hanotettai bessees ; issi issitoo eta zoriya wozanai etau markkattiyo gishshaunne qassi issi issitoo eta qofai eta mootiyo gishshau , woikko qassi etaara gaaddetiyo gishshau , hegee tuma gidiyoogaa erissees .

text: In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel .
text2: Taani tamaarissido wonggeliyaadan , asaa wozanan geemmida qofaa Xoossai Yesuus Kiristtoosa baggaara hagaadan pirddana .

text: Behold , thou art called a Jew , and restest in the law , and makest thy boast of God ,
text2: SHin neeni nena Aihuda gaasa ; higgiyan zemppada Xoossan ceeqettaasa .

text: And knowest his will , and approvest the things that are more excellent , being instructed out of the law ;
text2: Neeni oottana mala , Xoossai koyiyoobai aibakko eraasa ; qassi tuma gidiyaabaa dooranau higgiyaappe tamaaradasa .

text: And art confident that thou thyself art a guide of the blind , a light of them which are in darkness ,
text2: Neeni qooqeta kaalettiyaagaa , qassi xuman de7iyaageetuyyookka poo7issiyaagaa , eeyyaa erissiyaagaanne yelagaa tamaarissiyaagaa gidiyoogaa eraas ; higgiyaappe neeni kumetta eratettaanne kumetta tumatettaa demmiyoogaa eraasa .

text: Thou therefore which teachest another , teachest thou not thyself ? thou that preachest a man should not steal , dost thou steal ?
text2: Yaatin , neeni harata tamaarissiyaagee nena ne huuphen aissi tamaarissikkii ? Neeni , “ Wuuqqoppa ” yaagada qaalaa yootaasa . SHin neeni ne huuphen wuuqqaiyye ?

text: Thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery , dost thou commit adultery ? thou that abhorrest idols , dost thou commit sacrilege ?
text2: Neeni , “ SHaaramuxoppa ” yaagaasa . SHin neeni ne huuphen shaaramuxai ? Neeni eeqaa shenetaasa . SHin eeqai de7iyo keettaa bonqqai ?

text: Thou that makest thy boast of the law , through breaking the law dishonourest thou God ?
text2: Xoossaa higgee neeyyo de7iyo gishshau , neeni ceeqettaasa ; shin he higgiyaa menttada Xoossaa yeellayai ?

text: For the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles through you , as it is written .
text2: Aissi giikko , Xoossaa maxaafai , “ Aihuda asatoo , intte gaasuwan Xoossaa sunttai Aihuda gidenna asatu giddon cayettees ” yaagees .

text: For circumcision verily profiteth , if thou keep the law : but if thou be a breaker of the law , thy circumcision is made uncircumcision .
text2: Neeni higgiyau azazettikko , ne qaxxarai go77aara de7ees ; shin neeni higgiyaa menttikko , neeni qaxxarettidoogee qaxxarettibeennabaa mala gidana .

text: Therefore if the uncircumcision keep the righteousness of the law , shall not his uncircumcision be counted for circumcision ?
text2: Aihuda gidenna asi qaxxarettennan higgee azaziyoogaa naagikko , Xoossai a qaxxarettidabaadan qoodennee ?

text: And shall not uncircumcision which is by nature , if it fulfil the law , judge thee , who by the letter and circumcision dost transgress the law ?
text2: Intte , Aihuda asati , intteyyo xaafettida higgee de7ikkokka qassi intte qaxxarettikkokka , higgiyaa intte menttiyo gishshau , Aihuda gidenna asai bollaa qaxxarettana xayikkokka , higgiyau azazettidi , intte bolli pirddana .

text: For he is not a Jew , which is one outwardly ; neither is that circumcision , which is outward in the flesh :
text2: Aissi giikko , Aihuda asa milatiya ubbai tumu aihuda asa gidenna ; qassi asi ba bollaa qaxxarettido gishshau , tumu Aihuda asa gidenna .

text: But he is a Jew , which is one inwardly ; and circumcision is that of the heart , in the spirit , and not in the letter ; whose praise is not of men , but of God .
text2: SHin tumu Aihuda asa giyo urai garssa baggaara Aihuda asa gididaagaa ; qaxxarettiyoogee Xoossaa Ayyaanan oosettiya wozanaa qaxxarappe attin , xaafettida higgiyaana gidenna ; he urai ba galataa Xoossaappe ekkiyoogaappe attin , asappe ekkenna .

text: What advantage then hath the Jew ? or what profit is there of circumcision ?
text2: Yaatin , Aihuda asati aibin Aihuda gidenna asaappe aadhdhiyoonaa ? Woi qaxxarettiyoogan ai go77i de7ii ?

text: Much every way : chiefly , because that unto them were committed the oracles of God .
text2: Hagee Aihudata ubbaban keehi maaddees ; ubbabaappe kase Xoossai ba kiitaa hadaraa Aihudatuyyo immiis .

text: For what if some did not believe ? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect ?
text2: Yaatin etappe issooti issooti ammanettennabaa gidikko , waanii ? Hegaa gishshau , Xoossai ammanettenna yaagiyoogee ?

text: God forbid : yea , let God be true , but every man a liar ; as it is written , That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings , and mightest overcome when thou art judged .
text2: Mulekka hegaa gidenna ; asai ubbai worddanchcha gidikkokka , Xoossai giyoogee tuma gidanau bessees . Xoossaa maxaafai , “ Neeni haasayiyo wode , neeni xillo gidiyoogaa erissanau koshshees ; neeni mootettiyo wode , shatimmanau bessees ” yaagees .

text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance ? ( I speak as a man )
text2: SHin nu mooro oosoi Xoossaa xillo oosuwaa erissiyaakko , nuuni woiganee ? Nu bolli hanqquwaa ehiya Xoossai mooranchchee ? Taani asi giyoogaadan gais .

text: God forbid : for then how shall God judge the world ?
text2: Hegee mulekka hanoppo . Aissi giikko , hegaadan gidikko , Xoossai ha sa7aa bolli waati pirddanee ?

text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory ; why yet am I also judged as a sinner ?
text2: SHin ta wordduwan Xoossaa tumatettai a bonchchuwau doorikko , yaatin , hanno gakkanaassi aissi ta bolli nagaranchchadan pirddii ?

text: And not rather , ( as we be slanderously reported , and as some affirm that we say , ) Let us do evil , that good may come ? whose damnation is just .
text2: Yaatin nuuni , “ Lo77oi yaanaadan , ane iitabaa oottoos ” aissi gookkonii ? Issi issi asai hagaa tana mootiiddi cayidosona ; eti Xoossaappe bessiya pirddaa ekkana .

text: What then ? are we better than they ? No , in no wise : for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles , that they are all under sin ;
